Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, D. manera que pueda tener diferentes tallas, estampados y colores, los cuales le permitan aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
62 year-old Marta Ester A. D. R. lives in Santa Tecla, in La Libertad department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a day laborer, and also with two grandchildren aged 14 and 6.

Marta's business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes in San Juan Opico market.  She has a very good customer base which means that her sales are very stable.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes so that she can have different sizes, patterns and colors which will allow her to increase her income and thereby enjoy better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clothes to stock her business

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta Raquel

texts.es: Marta Raquel R. D. G. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador en donD. vive únicamente junto a su hijo quien se dedica a estudiar, su esposo se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos desD. donD. les envía una pequeña ayuda económica. Marta posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Marta no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su hijo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar gran parte D. sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Marta espera mejorar las ganancias y D. esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Marta Raquel R. D. G. is 29 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her school-aged son.  Her husband lives in the United States and, from there, sends them a small amount of financial aid. 

Marta owns and operates a store and sells fresh produce and staple goods out of one of the rooms in her home.  She plans to use the loan to buy more products for her business which is the main source of income for her and her son.  She would like to offer products such as detergent, canned goods, bread, sweets, beverages and other basic needs items that customers request.  She hopes to increase earnings and lead a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy fresh produce for retail sales

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian J. is a 21-year-old single woman. She does dairy farming in the Eldoret area and sells milk from the cows to her neighbors and dairy processing plants in her area. She has been in this business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of 22,000 KES.

This will be Lilian's first loan with KADET Ltd., and she plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production. With the income she will get, she plans to buy land for agricultural production so as to maximize profits. 

In the future, she wants to continue with dairy farming and also to diversify to maize farming.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members. It is located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mi C. is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the other members. She is a vegetable seller in the market where she can earn a little income to support her family. With this business, she still earns less income than needed to support the family. So in order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business activities. 
 
Mrs. Mi C. is 41 years old, and she is a widow with four children. Two of them are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a student, while the last one stays at home.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business activities.

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
24-year-old Marie Fe O. grows rice for a living. She tills her land and makes sure her crops are growing healthy. She hires some friends to help till her farm. Marie Fe desires to help her family financially. That's why she works hard to improve her earnings.

Marie Fe needs seeds and fertilizers. She also needs to pay for the labor of the people who helped work at her farm. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use for what she needs. This loan will truly help Marie Fe improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine L. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Geraldine is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Geraldine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Geraldine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bismar Enrique

texts.es: Bismar Enrique tiene una pulpería. Su negocio consiste en ofrecer productos para el hogar, la mayoría de sus clientes solicitan una gran variedad de productos, por lo que él siempre está al pendiente de lo que ellos le están solicitando. El tomo la iniciativa de invertir en ciertos productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos fue así que empezó y al observar que este medio de vida era rentable decide empezar con su nuevo negocio en su vivienda.   Este crédito es para la compra de ciertos productos que le solicitan como granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, sopas, pan, galletas y detergentes. Sueña con tener un gran inventario en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bismar Enrique has a small grocery store where he sells household products.  His customers ask him for a wide range of products which means that he is always paying attention to what they are requesting.  Bismar took the initiative of investing in certain products such as basic grains, candy, soft drinks and that is how he started out.  He realized that this way of making a living was profitable and so decided to start his new business in his home.

Bismar will use this loan to buy certain products that his customers are requesting such as basic grains, candy, canned goods, soups, bread, cookies and detergents.  He dreams of his business having a large inventory.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, canned goods, soups, bread, cookies and detergents

loans.name: Monica Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente tiene 2 hijos  menores de  8  y 2 años de edad,  vive en casa de su suegra desde hace 8 años, ya que su vivienda aun no esta construida,su cónyuge trabaja como operario en construcción, Monica se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora desde hace 2 años ella como toda joven tiene sueños y metas y uno de ellos es poder tener su propio puesto de ropa, Con el dinero surtira  su mercadería por cambio de estación.
texts.en:
26-year old Sra. Mónica has lived with her partner and their two children aged 8 and 2 in her mother-in-law’s house for eight years as her own house is not yet built. Her partner works in construction. 

Mónica has been selling clothing door-to-door for the last two years. Ever since she was a young girl, she has had dreams and goals. One of them is to own a clothing stall. With the loan she plans buy new stock appropriate for the time of year.

loans.use: to buy new stock appropriate for the time of year

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 24 años, vive sola en una casa arrendada.
Hace más de 4 años decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos, ya que anteriormente había trabajado en una tienda de repuestos para autos, y gracias a la experiencia que ganó en dicho trabajo hoy decidió abrir su propia tienda de repuestos de autos, específicamente embragues.  Desde entonces vente estos repuestos de auto, en un local de ventas ubicado en una zona más comercial, y en ese mismo lugar lo ha convertido en su hogar, de esa manera cuida de estos repuestos. Actualmente le va muy bien en el negocio, además vende artículos para vehículos, de esa manera aumentaron sus ganancias, con ello ha logrado contratar los servicios de un mecánico que le ayuda a colocar los repuestos en los autos de sus clientes, cuando estos los requieren. Su mayor anhelo es tener un taller automotriz bien implementado y una local mucho más amplio porque ha visto que su negocio es rentable y seguirá trabajando para conseguir esa meta. Es su tercer crédito con MFP,  para ella esta solvencia es de mucha ayuda en la mejora de su negocio ya que le llega de manera oportuna por la cual esta muy agradecida y tiene el firme compromiso de responder puntualmente en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de más repuestos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 24 years old and lives alone in a leased house. More than four years ago, she decided to establish her own source of income. She previously worked in a store that sold spare parts for cars, so thanks to the experience she gained there, she decided to open her own spare auto parts store, where she specializes in clutches. Since then, she has been selling spare auto parts from a storefront located in a commercial zone. She has converted part of the space into her home, so she can always take care of her business.

Her business is currently going very well. She also sells accessories for cars, which has increased her earnings. As a result, she has been able to contract the services of a mechanic who helps install the parts in her customers' cars when needed. Evelyn's greatest dream is to have a well-equipped auto workshop and a much larger space, because she has seen that her business is profitable. She will keep working to achieve this goal.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the credit, which arrived at the right time and has been a great help in improving her business. She is firmly committed to making her repayments punctually. She will use the requested loan to buy more spare parts wholesale.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a rice farmer who can earn meager income. She uses her own farmland to plant crops following rainy season and dry season. From her farming business, she is able to make an income of approximately $1.50 a day to help support her family. She married but she divorced from her husband a few years ago and at this time, she lives with her three kids. All of them are working in various jobs and they always share some of their gross salary with Mrs. Meas every month. 

Her house is old and the walls are rotten, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to repair it. To deal with this trouble, Mrs. Meas is seeking a Kiva loan to buy planks to rebuild the walls. She plans to use any remainder to purchase piglets for feeding.

loans.use: to buy planks to rebuild walls and purchase piglets to feed.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Asha has operated a Khangas business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other Khangas sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of Khangas for sale

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en: Linda (in the middle) is 32 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is single with one child, who attends school.  Linda runs a clothing business selling clothes and shoes as well as some electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for one year. She says overcoming the current slow pace of business is her main challenge. Linda has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and shoes. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy a residential stand. In the future, Linda plans to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de tractor, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y también la socia tiene un negocio de venta de helados, ella reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden helados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados y comprar repuestos de tractor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos e insumos para preparar los helados.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “RICHARY ANTEÑA.”  The bank is located in Anta District, which belongs to the province of Anta and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Rosini.  She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her day between her household duties and her business selling spare tractor parts.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  Sra. Rosini also has a business selling ice cream.  She distributes her ice cream to various ice cream stores.  She wants to expand her ice cream business and to purchase spare tractor parts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase the spare parts and to buy ice cream making supplies.
                                                      
The member is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and ice-cream making supplies.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with five family members. Three of the family members work.

Zaman has had a barber shop since 2007. He has more than eight years experience and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.en: Margarita Cortona is 66 years old and married with four children. One of her children still lives with her while he studies in University and the others live separately. Margarita worked as a docent but currently she is unemployed. She is asking for a loan in order to help pay for her son's University tuition. Her son is 22 years old and attends the National University of San Antonio Abad Cusco. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. For eight years, she has been operating a retail shop.  She also does farming to earn extra income for her family.  In addition, she owns rental houses. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has benefited because she has boosted her business with her previous loans. Florence hopes that one day; she will open a wholesale business.  She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and detergents

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis was born in the Dominican Republic, but came to the United States for the opportunity to live a better life and build a business. Less than a year ago, he founded an organization that provides non-food products to hospitality businesses, educational institutions and restaurants. Luis is the owner, partner and only employee, and operates business from home. He also works full-time as an IT professional at a shipping management company.

Luis is still in the early stages of forming his business and is now working on advertisements and visits to local hospitality establishments on weekends in order to get the word out about his unique services. He is committed to provide products to the hospitality industry quickly and inexpensively. 

He will use the loan to buy inventory as well as a desktop computer and a laptop to expedite orders. Luis also plans to invest in accounting software in order to manage sales and profits more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy inventory, a desktop computer and laptop to use the field.

loans.name: Manuel Alexis

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa, sus padres y un hermano, en su familia todos trabajan; él es empleado de un banco, su horario es de 8:00am a 7:00pm, él está por segunda vez solicitando un préstamo que esta hoy lo necesira para la reparacion de una motocicleta, que le permita desplazarse a su trabajo con mayor facilidad.
Este préstamo le ayudara para tener más accesibilidad al trabajo, ya que será una inversión que le ayudara para transporte. El objetivo de Manuel es poco a poco a través de préstamo ir mejorando su calidad de vida y en un futuro tener su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife, his parents, and his brother.  In his family everyone works.  He works at a bank from 8AM to 7PM and is requesting, for the second time, a loan that would be used to repair his motorcycle which allows him to get to work with ease.  
This loan would help him have better access to his employment since the investment would aide in his transportation.  Manuel's objective is to use loans little by little to steadily improve his quality of life and in the future have his own place.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr:
Mana est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant de 20 ans qui n’est pas scolarisé.  
Mana travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de rechange depuis l’an 2000. Elle sert tous les clients dans l’enceinte du Centre Médicaux Social d’Agoé. Elle achète les produits dans les agences de télécommunication du Togo. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence rude sur le marché. 
Mana a requis son cinquième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mana voudrait pérenniser son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit construire une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Mana is a 35-year-old woman. She is single with a 20-year-old child who has not had schooling.
Mana has been working as a retailer of phone recharge cards since 2000. She serves all her customers inside the Medical Social Center of Agoè. She gets her products from the telecommunication agencies of Togo. She works alone.

At this time her main problem is the tough competition in the marketplace. Mana has requested her fifth loan cycle from WAGES to purchase recharge cards. She wants to reinvest her profits into her business activity.
In coming years, Mana would like to carry on her business. She says that with the profits earned, she plans on establishing a happy family.

loans.use: buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Kristelle Lira

texts.en:
Kristelle Lira is married with one child to care for. Kristelle Lira is 25-years-old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living she sells personal products such as fashion jewelries, sun glasses, cellphone cases, and more. She loves fashion and new trends and that entices her to engage in such activity. She has been operating this site for two years and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell.

Kristelle Lira is a new member of the cooperative. In the future, Kristelle Lira hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to widen the facility and product offerings to attract more customers. She plans to procure trendy items to meet the market's current demands.

loans.use: To obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos 5 y 6 años D. edad, el se dedica a vender mariscos y articulos D. chatarra (aluminio, hierro, latas)el oficio lo inicio hace tres años, todos los días venD., no tiene un horario establecido sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería pescado, camarones, langostas, apretadores, esta inversion ayudara para mejorar en las ventas y tener  variedad, tambien aumentar en clientela.
El propósito D. José es, que sus ingresos aumenten, tener más clientes y obtener más  ganancias, D. esa manera ayudar con los gastos D.  la casa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 6.  He works selling seafood and scrap metal (aluminium, iron, cans).  He has been working in this business for three years, and sells every day.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule on the weekends.

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise: fish, shrimp, lobsters, etc.  This investment will help him to improve his sales and offer variety a products; it will also help him grow his customer base.

José's plan is for his income to grow, to have more customers, and to earn better money so that he can help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, lobsters, etc.

loans.name: Leonor Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Leonor es cliente recurrente de la fundación, pues confía mucho en nosotros, el mismo vive en la ciudad de Luque, vive en su casa propia con su esposa.
Don Leonor cuenta con una despensa desde el año 1992, por lo que ya cuenta con buena antigüedad en su negocio, en la mismo se encargan de atender Don Leonor y su esposa. El Señor cuenta con mas de 20 créditos cancelados con la fundación.
Comenta que en todos estos años que lleva con su negocio se ha formado ya una buena clientela que siempre van a su negocio, por lo que le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos abasteciendo mas su local, por ello solicita el crédito, para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados y demás con lo que podrá surtirse.
texts.en:
Señor Leonor is a regular client of the Fundación; he trusts us a lot. Leonor lives in Luque city in his own home with his wife.
Leonor has had a food shop since 1992. His business is well-established, and he and his wife run it. He has taken out and repaid over 20 loans from the Fundacion.
He tells us that he has built up a good customer base throughout the years, and they always choose his business. He would like to be able to stock his store more, so he is requesting a loan for the purchase of food to stock his business; drinks, baked goods and more.

loans.use: to buy edible goods: drinks, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Mariela Del Socorro

texts.es: Mariela Del Socorro tiene 36 años, es madre de 2 hijos.  Ella, es el sostén de su familia, desde Hace 5 año que se dedica al negocio de brindar el servicio de costura sus vecino ya conocen el trabajo de Mariela y la buscan para que pueda confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que ella es su propia jefa de su negocio. Con el crédito desea comprar productos como hilos, tijeras, telas, bordados, cintas entre otros. Sueña con algún día poder realizarle modificaciones a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Mariela Del Socorro is 36 years old and the mother of two children. She is the breadwinner of her family. For the past five years, Mariela has managed a business in which she provides sewing services to her neighbors who are familiar with her work and are looking to buy handmade clothing. What she likes most about her work is that she gets to be her own boss.

With this loan, Mariela will buy products such as thread, scissors, fabrics, embroideries, ribbons, and other supplies. She dreams of someday making renovations to her modest home.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabrics, embroideries, ribbons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 31-year-old Lebanese man, engaged to be married and  living on his own. He has been working as a fisherman for over 10 years and bought his individual fishing boat in 2006. He buys frequently needed tools from a local fishing center to proceed with his business operation. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy required fishing equipment and supplies. He feels positive about his business prospects for the coming year and looks forward to purchasing another fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy required fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 36 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gene has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy additional stock from Natasha and Avon.

Gene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita de 31 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora. Convive con Werner, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 4 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Alto Yapaz en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña. Sus padres le enseñaron a desenvolverse con responsabilidad. En sus 5 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos siembra café y piñas. “Las piñas las cosechamos en febrero, marzo, abril y mayo; y el café esta listo en mayo, junio y julio”, explica. 
Rita sabe como comercializar sus productos, por eso se desplaza con las piñas hacia la ciudad de Santa Ana donde las vende satisfactoriamente. Por su parte el café lo vende en la ciudad de La Merced.
Con esta actividad, Rita y Werner han pensado extender sus sembríos y mejorar su producción, para ello tendrán que invertir en la adquisición de nuevos terrenos. “Ya tenemos clientes fieles, nos hacen pedidos, por eso vendemos rápido las cosechas”, comenta. Los hijos de Rita aún son pequeños, pero cuando crezcan piensa salir de Alto Yapaz hacia la ciudad  por las mejores oportunidades de educación y trabajo. Con éste serían 5 los préstamos que obtendría de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Comenta que se siente a gusto y muy apoyada por su banco comunal por la oportunidad de desarrollo de sus integrantes.
Invertirá el dinero en bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de piñas y café.
texts.en:
Rita is thirty-one years old, and an enterprising woman. She lives with Werner, her partner, with whom she has three children, who are ten, nine, and four years old. They all live in their own home in the Alto Yapaz annex in the San Luis de Shuaro district of Chanchamayo. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl. Her parents taught her to handle responsibility well. She raises coffee and pineapples on her five parcels of land. “We harvest the pineapples in February, March, April, and May; and the coffee is ready in May, June, and July,” she explains.
Rita knows how to market her products, and for this reason she takes the pineapples to the city of Santa Ana, where she sells them satisfactorily. She sells the coffee in the city of La Merced.
Rita and Werner have thought to increase their fields and improve their production. To do that, they will have to invest by acquiring new fields. “We already have loyal customers, they make orders, and this is how we sell our harvests quickly,” she says. Rita’s children are still small, but when they get older, she plans to leave Alto Yapaz and go to the city for better education and work opportunities. This will be the fifth loan she has received from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She is committed to make her monthly payments on time. She says that she feels comfortable and supported by her communal bank for the development opportunities it gives its members. 
She will invest the money in bags of organic fertilizers to amend her pineapple and coffee fields.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Savarn

texts.en:
Savarn, age 51, lives in a suburb of the city of Phnom Penh. She is a widow with four sons and one daughter. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a security guard and the other two are garment workers.

Savarn is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to use for work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to use for work

loans.name: Phalleang

texts.en:
Phalleang, 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in agricultural for over 20 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their business. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle to use as well as to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. 

Phalleang wants to improve her family’s livelihood and build a fence around her house. With this goal in mind, Phalleang is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate extra income to financially support the family. Moreover, she would like to support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more farming land to grow agricultural crops.

loans.name: La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está formado por seis socias emprendedoras tal es el caso de Emma vende tortilla, cuajaditas, frijoles cocidos cabeza de chancho en su domicilio desde hace dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cabezas de cerdos, maíz, leña, cal, cuajaditas, frijoles crudos para su negocio, Sandra vende frutas, Meyling vende frutas también, Emma Maricela vende cosméticos, Rosa Angélica vende verduras, piñas y ropa variada, Angélica vende nacatamales ambulante.
texts.en:
This communal bank has six enterprising members.  Emma is one of them.  She’s been selling tortillas, milk curd, cooked beans and pig’s head at home for two years.  She will use the loan to buy pig heads, corn, firewood, lime powder and raw beans for her business.

Sandra sells fruit, Meyling sells fruit too, Emma Maricela sells cosmetics, Rosa Angélica sells vegetables, pineapples and assorted clothes and Angélica sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] from place to place.

loans.use: to buy pig heads, corn, firewood, lime powder, milk curd and raw beans.

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
Cristina siempre ha velado por el bien de los animales, pues todo el tiempo han sido su pasión. Por más de cinco años, ella ha llevado la batuta de establecer una Veterinaria en su pueblo, donde se convirtió en la primera y única, por lo que sus vecinos se lo agradecen. A sus 53 años ella siempre ha trabajado fuerte para salir adelante con sus dos hijos, a quienes ahora mira orgullosamente como grandes profesionales. 
Durante este tiempo, Cristina se ha convertido en una de las personas más reconocida en su vecindario, por la excelente labor como veterinaria empírica. Ahora ella siente que es momento de invertir en su calidad de vida, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para construir un nuevo sumidero y comprar un inodoro, de manera que ir al baño ya no será más un riesgo para su salud debido a que las bacterias y animales que son atraídos por el actual baño. En un futuro desea seguir invirtiendo en su calidad de vida, por lo que planea mejorar su hogar y terminar su carrera como veterinaria.

loans.use: Comprar un inodoro.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives in Vituka, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Halima sells charcoal in a store located near her family house. She has been in this business for six years now. She realizes that depending on only one product as income generating business gives her no chance to improve her standard of living. She is planning to start selling charcoal cookers alongside the charcoal. She expects this new line of business will help her generate more income. She will also need to add more stock of charcoal, pay for rental fees and employ an assistant. The expansion plan will help Halima generate extra income as she has to pay school fees for her two sons who are in secondary school.

loans.use: ADD STOCK OF CHARCOAL

loans.name: Mohammad Azem

texts.en: Mohammad Azem is 40 years old and lives with his family of eight in Kabul City. He sells fuel, gas, petrol, diesel and mobile and he has a small shop near the road where he can sell lots of fuel - more than other pump stations. He wants to buy a tank of fuel for his business so he can sell to other shops.

loans.use: Mohammed would like to buy more fuel for his fuel store

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo is married with 4 children. She has four years of experience in the flower business. She needs a loan in order to diversify her activity. In this kind of business, one of the ways to attract clients is to offer them many types of flowers and other decorations which may entice the customer and spark their creative decorating interests.

She sells flowers to decorate living rooms and cars and also sells toys for children. Half of the loan will be used to buy flowers and the other half will be used to buy toys.

Mrs. Adjo is a member of the group “DJIDJOLE,” in which three people want to receive a credit of $200 each. The total credit solicited by the group is $600.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and other decorations.

loans.name: Mawugné Christine

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Aného, Ms. Mawugné Christine A. is a married mother of three children. Her primary activity is the sale of plastic shoes and ladies’ handbags, which she buys in Lomé and resells in various markets in the vicinity of her town of Afagnan. She is a master of her trade and manages her business with meticulous care. For the purpose of meeting the ever-increasing demand in the markets, she is seeking a loan of $900 to purchase items in bulk and rent a space for a shop. This project will allow Ms. A. to improve her family's living conditions and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978 à Aného, Madame A. Mawugné Christine est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des chaussures en plastique et les sacs de sortie pour dame qu’elle achète à Lomé pour les revendre dans plusieurs marchés avoisinants de sa localité qui n’est outre que Afagnan. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère avec un soin minutieux. C’est dans l’optique de couvrir plus les marchés dont la demande ne cesse de croître qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $900 avec lequel elle compte acheter chez les grossistes et louer une pièce pour en faire une boutique. La réalisation de ce projet conduira Madame A. Mawugné Christine à une amélioration des conditions de vie de toute sa famille et une augmentation du niveau de son épargne.

loans.use: Renting a shop and buying merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Eylin López

texts.en: Eylin is 23 years old, married, and the mother of a beautiful boy. Her son is 3 years old and is going into kindergarten. Her husband has a barber shop, and she sells clothes. Both businesses are run in their house. Eylin and her husband started their business more than two years ago. Eylin has already taken out a loan from our organization, and she used it wisely and repaid it in the time agreed upon. Her husband’s barber shop was made of wood, but she remodeled it with the loan and grew the business. The entrepreneur is now asking for a loan to expand her clothes store. She wants to purchase large amounts of clothes so as to better satisfy her customers’ needs. She’ll also help her husband hire two more hairdressers in the barber shop so they can attend to the customers more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and hire two hairdressers to expand her business

loans.name: Ross

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Ross, 51, has been married since 1981 and has two children. She lives in a modest home south of Phnom Penh along National Road 2. This area is very fertile and well-suited to growing fruit and flowers. Like some women in her village, Ross buys fresh jasmine flowers and bananas from a neighboring village to resell at markets in Phnom Penh. Bananas are a year-round treat in Cambodia and a few different varieties are grown. The jasmine flowers are typically sold to women who make offering arrangements used in Buddhist ceremonies and for jasmine tea.

Ross is requesting a third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase jasmine and bananas in bulk to resell. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy additional products for her daughter, 23, to sell at the mini-mart in front of the family home while she tends to her two young children. Ross' son, 17, is currently studying at the local school and also attending night classes. Ross hopes that this new loan will enable her family to prosper and secure a better future for them all.

loans.use: To purchase fresh flowers and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Pofa

texts.en: Pofa is a married mother with five children, one of them has a job in town, the rest are unemployed. Her business is a taro plantation. Before joining SPBD program in 2004, her family depended only on remittances from overseas (New Zealand and Australia), the reason she needed help from SPBD.  Her last loan was used to fixed the floor of her house and other stuff for her business. To maintain and to improve her business, she is now applying for another loan to buy more farming supplies and also to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Mahkamhoja

texts.en:
M. Mahkamhoja is 54 years old. He and his wife, who is keeps their house, have raised 3 children. The children are already married and have their own kids who adore their grandparents.

Mahkamhuja has been a cattleman for 9 years. He has 1 cow and 2 sheep. His business is stable and generates significant income for the family.

Mahkamhoja has been already provided with several loans by IMON and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower with positive credit history. Today Mahkamhoja requests US$500 to buy one cow and fodder. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zahida N. and I am a widow who lives in the mid-sized city of Multan, Pakistan. I am a mother of three: two boys and one girl. All of my children are under the age of 15 and attend a local school. I am the only breadwinner in my family and run a boutique. My income is just enough to cover my household expenses. I need to expand my business so that I can save for my children’s future and help them continue with their studies.    
The other women in my group are: Naila B., Saeeda  B. and Rani B.. All three run boutiques and are borrowing to expand and improve their businesses. These women work very hard to earn an income for their families. We have been together for one year and have learned to be punctual and responsible during this time.

loans.use: Expand four small boutiques

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the Warac Community Bank. She makes her living selling candy and sodas on Fitzcarrald Avenue of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of S/ 1300.00 ( USD $475) which will be repaid in six installments, she will purchase 50 liters of fruit nectar (Frugos) ,10 cases of mineral water, 8 cases of large containers of soda, 10 cases of small containers of soda, 2 cases of fruit nectars in boxes.

She is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband helps her in her business because he has temporary employment. They both work to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Warac, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y de gaseosas, en la Av. Fitzcarrald del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 50 litros de frugos, 10 paquetes de agua mineral, 8 paquetes de gaseosa grande, 10 cajas de gaseosa pequeña, 2 cajas de frugos en caja,.

Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo la apoya en este negocio porque tiene trabajo eventual, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. For the past seven years, she has had her own small business selling clothing at the Ordzhonikidze central market. She currently sells a nice selection of clothing at affordable prices. Economic expansion in Ukraine has improved the lives of many people and has lead to increased demand for products such as the clothing Lubov sells. In the future, she would like to continue working to develop her business and possibly open a second sales location.

Lubov has requested a short-term loan to increase her business capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. She has developed a good reputation as a client with Nadiya Ukraine, and we are happy to have this opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Sra Angelica is a hardworking woman. As well as being a street vendor in the local markets, she sometimes travels to the provincial markets. On these occasions her husband helps her transport the merchandise. She also takes care of their three school-age children. Her strong desire to get ahead is very clear. Sra Angelica lives in her father’s house where an extra room has been built to give her children more space. The family lives in an area a long way from La Paz. She is currently asking for her sixth loan; her credit history is first rate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La senora Angelica es una persona muy trabajadora ella ambula por las ferias de la zona y en ocaciones viaja a las ferias provienciales, en estas ocaciones es el esposo quien colabora en el traslado de la mercaderia, tiene a su cargo 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, en la cliente se observa muchos deseos de superacion, La señora Angelica vive en la casa de su papá donde construyeron una habitacion para brindar mas comodidad a los hijos ella vive junto a su familia en una zona alejada de la ciudad de La Paz y actualmente solicita el sexto credito teniendo un historial de credito inpecable.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Rizwana M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Rizwana baji is the wife of M. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. She has a two room brick house and is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Rizwana baji is a housewife and prefers to run her household. Her husband is a land contractor and she is applying for the loan on his behalf.

She has been joined in her loan group by four other women, each with her own business. Jhagan baji wants the loan for her fruit business. Suraiya baji will use the loan for her corner drink enterprise. Shahnaz baji will expand her sweetmeat business and Nasreen baji will improve her vegetable business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown children. She owns a small kiosk selling socks and underwear in downtown Nyzhniv, Ivano-Frankivsk region. Close proximity to a busy central market makes it a very favorable location for business growth. Mariya offers low prices and good quality of inventory. Currently, she earns about $700 monthly income from her business. 

Mariya has been working in this business for two years. She used to work as a secretary in Nyzhniv town administration office but she faced some problems with her health and had to quit her job. This is how she took a risk and launched her own venture selling clothing.

Hard-work and tenacity have helped her enterprise reach sustainability and success. Mariya would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to purchase 50 sets of underwear and socks. The extra supply of inventory will help her generate additional income. Mariya is hoping that increased sales activity will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as to meet her family's needs.    

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sets of underwear and socks.

loans.name: Fabian Pedro

texts.es:
Fabian Pedro T. is 59 years old and from the village of Xolsacmaljá in the municipality and city of Totonicapán. He came to the offices of ASDIR to obtain financing to purchase construction tools, specifically for providing his services in masonry and home construction, a trade that her inherited from his father who did the same work for many years. Initially, he built adobe homes, tile or laminate zinc roofs, and cement floors. Currently, he builds block homes with flat roofs and ceramic floors. With financing, he will improve his job and use it to purchase a floor polisher.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Fabian Pedro T. de 59 años del cantón Xolsacmaljá municipio y departamento de Totonicapán. Acudió a las oficinas de ASDIR para poder obtener un financiamiento para la compra de herramientas para construccion , específicamente se dedica a la prestación de sus servicios como albañil, construcción de casa, el cual es un oficio que heredó de su padre quien laboró en la misma hace ya varios años. En un principio se dedicaba a construir casas de adobe, techo de teja o lamina de zinc, piso con torta de cemento, en la actualidad se dedica a construir casas de block, techo de terraza y piso cerámico, con el financiamiento pretende mejorar su trabajo ya que lo utilizará para la compra de una pulidora de pisos

loans.use: To purchase tools for construction.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es: El negocio de compra y venta de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca le permite a Pabla, mejorar sus ingresos económicos, como padre y madre de sus hijos, pone su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación a esta labor  que  viene realizando por más de 15 años,  gracias a este esfuerzo pudo brindarles educación y bienestar a sus hijos.Adquiere su mercadería los días de feria de los distintos pueblitos  aledaños de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, luego de reunir una buena cantidad la vende por medio de un intermediario a una empresa textil, el deseo de Pabla es ofertar su mercadería  directamente a una  empresa textil y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos, para ello requiere aumentar el monto de inversión, con ese proyecto en mente presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
The business of buying and selling wool and alpaca fibre allows Pabla to increase her economic income, as father and mother of her children, she gives her best effort and dedication to this activity that she has been performing for more than 15 years, thanks to this effort she has been able to provide education and well-being to her children. She gets her merchandise during holiday days in the different towns around her city, Juliaca. After getting a good amount, she sells it through an agent of a textile company, Pabla’s wish is to offer her merchandise directly to the company and that way increase her income, to do this, she needs to invest more and with that project in mind she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to sell wool directly to a textile company.

loans.name: Abubacar Taju

texts.pt:
Abubacar Taju I. é natural do distrito de Matola província do Maputo e tem 71 anos de idade, casado, nunca teve filhos e vive com sobrinhos, e sua esposa. Desde a sua infância, vive na cidade da Matola. 

Abubacar é comerciante a mais de 10 anos, gerindo um estabelecimento comercial abrindo das 7:00h e fecha as 18:00h, tem um empregado. Destaca como bom produto a Cerveja que adquira a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 300,00mt. E tem um rendimento diário de 1500,00mt e consegue poupar algum no fim do mes. Vive numa casa própria.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve empréstimo noutras instituições, assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro de forma a tornar mais atractivo o estabelecimento colocando produtos diversificados.
texts.en:
Abubacar Taju I. is from the district of Matola, a province of Maputo. He is 71 years old, married and he's never had any children. He lives with a few nephews and his wife. He's lived in the city of Matola ever since he was a child. For over 10 years Abubacar has worked in the retail business by running a commercial establishment from 7:00am until 6:00pm. He has one employee. He notes that beer is a good product because he can buy a case of it for 230,00mt and sell it for 300,00mt. His store generates 1500,00mt daily and he is able to save a certain amount from that at the end of every month. He lives in his own home. This will be his first loan from Hluvuku and he has never requested loans from any other financial institution. He intends to pay it off in advance so he can request a second loan that will be invested in making his place of business more attractive by offering a better selection of goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchae additional basic goods

loans.name: Aliah Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married with two children; she lives in Musang, a town just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in rearing pigs and farming yellow yams and sweet yams. She plans to use her own savings to rent the land for farming her yams; she will use this loan to purchase all the necessary farming supplies for yams and to begin her pig business.

This is Pamela's third loan from GHAPE. She has never invested in pigs before; however, her husband has experience in this area and has passed his knowledge on to her. She feels she can have large profits in this business because of her husband's support. There is a high demand for yams, both sweet and yellow, in this region of Cameroon; she hopes her yams will fill some of this demand. She also plans to sell some of the manure from her pigs to people in her community.

With the profits from this loan, Pamela hopes to build a proper pit latrine for her family. She also hopes to save some money to purchase her own home; her family is currently living with her brother-in-law. She lost her home due to her brother's debt. She recently remarried after divorcing her first husband; many of those in her family have disowned her for this act. She hopes this loan provides her with enough profit to begin to improve her family's living standards and recoup her losses.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: raising piglets and buying yellow yam and sweet yam seeds to grow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John I. is 31 years old and married with two children. He sells vegetables, such as cabbages, green beans, legumes, watermelon, carrots and cucumbers. 

His wife is a student studying Environmental Health. He travels to Jos to purchase vegetables to sell in Benin City. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 140,000 local currency to purchase more vegetables to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eveling Scarlet

texts.es:
La Señora Evelyn Scarlet G. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Evelyn tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades su hijo menor de 12 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 14 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de diversificar su negocio para de cualquier forma mantenerlo activo sus sueños son de tener otros negocios como lo es una pulpería y una tienda de ropa en general para así obtener mas ingresos para su familia en sus deseos esta darle una mejor preparación a sus hijos para darle un mejor futuro y estos no dependan de otras personas y puedan valerse por si mismos.


La actividad económica la que se dedica es el alquiler de videos juegos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 4 años, al principio inicio con mercadería en general por lo que necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia por lo que decide actualmente ha ampliado un poco y decide instalar un negocio de videos juegos y es así como se decide salir adelante con este negocio y que tiene que proporcionar la manutención de sus hijos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ya que tiene realizar la compras de los diferentes productos como   discos.
texts.en:
Evelyn Scarlet G. is 33 years old. She is single and has 2 children, a 12 year old boy who is in 4th grade in primary school and a 14 year old boy that is in 3th year in secondary school. Her goal is to diversify her business to keep it active. Her dream is to open other businesses such as a grocery store or a general clothes store to generate a larger income for her family. She would like to provide her children with a better education and a better future so they don't have to depend on other people and they can be independent. Her main activity is to sell video games at home. She's been on this business for 4 years. At first, she started selling products in general but as she needed to generate more income to support her family she decided to focus on a specific business and so she opened a video game store. She will use this financing for work capital as she needs to purchase different products, such as CDs or disks.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Солиева Халима живет в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 41 год. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Торгует на рынке "Саховат" города Турсун-заде. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 13 лет. Запрашивает кредит для ввоза нового товара, что поможет увеличить товарооборот , а так же привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Halima S. lives in the city of Tursun-zade. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She completed a high school education. She is a seller at the Sahovat market in Tursun-zade. She has 13 years of experience in this field. She is requesting a loan for import of new goods, which will increase stock turnover and thus attract new customers. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Kul S., 48, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She makes about $7 per day by growing yams and selling them in the market, while her husband earns around US$ 15 by working as a taxi-driver. She and her husband have five children, four who are employed as taxi drivers and one who is in school.

Mrs. Kul S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a small truck for her husband to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: purchase a truck for transport

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to acommondate all her family members.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Cristina,

texts.es:
Cuando aun vivía en su antigua casa, Cristina se dedicaba a vender menús a los trabajadores de la fábrica de bebidas gasificadas con una marca reconocida. Como a esta fábrica le iba bien decidieron cambiar de lugar para ampliarla. Razón por la que los trabajadores también se mudaron y con ello, Cristina perdió a sus principales clientes.

Un tiempo después ella también decidió mudarse de hogar. Con esta mudanza ella vio una fuente de ingresos si se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Es por esto que compro ya hace cuatro años su puesto y vende todos los días. Un año después de haber empezado ese negocio se pensó que seria bueno si aprovechaba también su tiempo por las tardes, pues a veces el negocio de las verduras no era suficiente. Por ello todas las tardes vende en el paradero principal de su casa, anticuchos, pollo a la parrilla, entre otros platos.

Ella ha sido madre soltera de tres hijos que hoy tienen veinte, dieciocho y dieciséis años. Por quienes siempre esta en constante busca de otro negocio que pueda ser mas rentable. Por ahora, solo desea aumentar la mercadería de su puesto de verduras.
texts.en:
When she was still living in her old house, Cristina dedicated her time to selling menus to the workers at the soda factory with a well-known label. They decided to move the factory to expand it. Because of this, the workers also moved and so Cristina lost her principal clients. Some time later, she also decided to move away from home. With this move, she saw a source of income if she dedicated herself to the sale of vegetables in the town market. Because of this, she bought her place four years ago and sells everyday. A year after beginning this business she thought it would be good if she also took advantage of her time in the afternoon since sometimes the vegetable business is not sufficient. Every afternoon she sells kebabs, grilled chicken, among other dishes, in the principal area near her house. She has been a single mother of 3 kids that are now 20, 18 and 16 years old. She's always constantly in search of a more profitable business. For now, she only hopes to increase her merchandise for her vegetable sales.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A roof for a shop in the market

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells drinks and pepper soup.  She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and ingredients to cook more pepper soup. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya is married with two children. She has been running a family business with her husband for nine years, selling used clothing and shoes. They rent a store in a good location and this helps to bring in many customers. Nataliya does not charge high prices for the clothes so her customers get good clothing for reasonable prices – something that is really relevant in the current climate. Nataliya is requesting a loan of 4000 UAH to purchase stock. She hopes to make more profit so that she can help her son, a college student.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing stock

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Кулдашева Гулнора-женщина 42-х лет,замужем,имеет 2-х детей. Вместе со своим мужем Азимовым Баходуром она на протяжении 10 лет занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Её муж покупает млодых бычков на скотном рынке за низкую цену.Гулнора откармливает их дома и на пастбище 3 или 4 месяца,затем продает мясникам по хорошей цене.Таким образом она вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет.Кроме того её муж зарабатывает таксистом.
texts.en:
Gulnora K. is a 42-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. For the past ten years, she and her husband Bahodur Azimov have raised and traded in cattle. Her husband purchases young steers at the cattle market for a low price. Gulnora fattens them for three or four months at home and in the pasture, and then sells them to the butchers for a good price. This is her way of contributing to the family finances. In addition, her husband earns a living as a taxi driver.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir K. runs a small grocery store, selling a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. He has been in this business for about twelve years. He is married and has three children. One of his goals is to be able to remodel his apartment and improve his living conditions.

Mazakhir has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of his goods. The loan will help him increase his income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gloria Carlos

texts.en:
Gloria Carlos C. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She currently resides in Boane, but was born in Maputo. She went to school until she became pregnant for the first time and was forced to drop out to attend to her children. Her children are aged 7, 16, 19, and 23; all are in school except the oldest, who now works.

Gloria has her own retail operation, specializing in the sale of children's clothing. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku. She intends on using the loan to diversify her product line. Over time she hopes to continue to further grow her operation and become more profitable

loans.use: buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
K. Nusrat is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Nusrat cooks national meals like plov, lagman, and oriental dumplings. Nusrat is a very experienced cook. The income from the business is used by Nusrat to improve the living conditions of his family. Now he is planning to make a major repair of the café to attract more new clients and keep the old ones. For this, he requests 2000 Somoni. Nusrat thanks all for their support and promises to be precise in the loan payment.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repair his cafe

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dionicia es viuda, y tiene 04 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, lo hace D. manera ambulatoria, caminado por las calles D. su ciudad. Dionicia solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles,  los cuales quiere invertir en su negocio y así seguir ahorrando para poder comprara una carreta donD. ofrecer sus productos, y así ya no caminar tanto. 

Aurelia es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Aurelia aprovecha las visitas que le hace a su esposo en la mina donD. trabaja él, para llevar granos y venderlos. Ella, gracias a sus préstamos a podido incrementar las ventas D. su negocio. Ella, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra D. granos, con cuyas ventas podrá seguir ahorrando para la construcción D. su casa, lo cual tanto anhela.

Eulalia es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Eulalia se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, las cuales vendía en un triciclo que tuvo que vender porque cayó enferma. Ella ya recuperada sigue trabajando con sus golosinas. Eulalia solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles, con los cuales apoyara a uno D. sus hijos en la venta D. ropa. Ella quiere seguir ahorrando para poder obtener un puesto fijo para sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a widow and has four children. She is involved in the sale of candy and snacks, which she does in a peddling manner, walking the streets of the city. Dionicia is requesting a loan of 300 soles, which she wants to invest in the purchase of a cart from where she could sell her products. This way she would have to walk less. Aurelia is married and has one child. She takes advantage of visits to her husband's mine, where he works, to sell grains. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her business' sales. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of grains. With its sales, she will be able to continue saving for the construction of her home, which is her big wish. Eulalia is married and has two children. Eulalia is involved in the sale of candy and snacks. She sells her merchandise off a tricycle that she had to give up, when she became sick. Now recovered, she continues selling candy and snacks. Eulalia is requesting a loan of 300 soles. With it, she will assist one of her children in the sale of clothing. Her wish is to continue saving in order to purchase a permanent stall for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of Bancomunal La Esperanza request a loan to invest in their business

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a member of the Mtazamo borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 37 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children Her children are aged 10,9, and 5 years.she also cares for 1 other dependent.

Mwanahamisi started her own business selling crops 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwanahamis second loan from BRAC_Tanzani,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mwnahamisi hopes to save more money and expand he business

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Uwimpeta

texts.en:
J. Uwimpeta is 28 years old, is married, and she takes care of two orphans, 21 and 18 years old.

J. has owned a hardware shop for the past two years, working eleven hours a day, though the items to sell are still few.

After realizing that she has few items in her hardware shop, she is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to purchase more items to sell.

Through accessing this new loan, J. plans to help her husband buy a house and help her two orphans attend university.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.en:
The committee Kuña Guapa is an excellent committee formed on March 17th, 2009, comprising of 20 women of the city of Ita. This Group was formed by Gloria G., who decided to get together with her neighbors and friends from the Neighbhorhood San Antonio and create a program for Women Entrepreneurs. They are now operating in the third cycle of their program. They are all very happy because thanks to their joint work, they can move forward with their work and continue to make their lives better. The majority of the members began with the credit granted by Fundacion Paraguaya. 
	The credit given to the committee is 575,000 Gs. The members of the group are using the loan for different activitives such as the sale of ingredients for food preparation, parchase of dry goods for grocery stores (sugar, rice, baked goods, dairy, meat, etc.) products for manicures and pedicures, selling jewelry, lingerie, clothing, drinks, dressmaking, etc. 
	They are a very active group, and all members demonstrate solidarity and fellowship, attending weekly meetings and fundraising activities conducted for the common good of the group. It is one of the best program working with Fundacion Paraguaya. 
Nancy N. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Leidyd G. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Evelin G. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Ida F. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Gloria G. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Laura G. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Liliana G. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Zulma O. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Esperanza G. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Isabel G. wants to use her loan to sell candies. 
Eustacia C. wants to use her loan to buy products for manicures and pedicures. 
Isabel R. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Myrian I. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Carmen J. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Eulalia R. wants to use her loan to sell drinks. 
Esmilda P. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Deysi M. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Lucina G. wants to use her loan for tailoring. 
Liz M. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Mirna V. wants to use her loan to sell footware.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Oladoku

texts.en:
Oladoku is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For the past eight years, she has been in the business of selling various provisions. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 ($350) to purchase additional provisions in order to meet the demands of her customer base and to expand her business. She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand and to expand her business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 33 years old and is married with two children aged 2 and 4 years old. He lives in the Kayonza district where he has been working as a wholesaler, selling a wide variety of goods depending upon his clients' needs and wants. As his photo indicates, his shop is full of different items. This is his thirteenth year in that business working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. 

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his shop through adding some new goods for wholesaling: specifically soap and shoes. If his strategy is successful and attracts customers, he hopes to earn more profits, which will help him to build a more secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes and soap

loans.name: Kikoni Ambulire Jennifer Group

texts.en:
A. Jennifer is 31 years of age, married, and blessed with three children, all of whom go to school. She is the group representative of this loan group.
Jennifer has been running a pub business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to purchase items for the pub, such as crates of soda, beers, wines, boxes of water, and so on. She wishes to increase the stock in her business to make more profit.
Jennifer is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soda, beers, wines, boxes of water, etc. for her pub

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Bayambasuren J. is 48 years old and living with his wife and two sons in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a “ger” in Uvurkhangai Province in central Mongolia. He operates a coal and firewood trading business in his town. Bayambasuren started his business in 2003 and has built a consistent operation over the years. Today he is well-established in the local business community and has a strong customer base.

Bayambasuren is an open-minded businessman and works hard to achieve his goals. He has many plans to continue his business growth and recently purchased livestock in order to start selling meat in addition to coal and firewood. Bayambasuren is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase wood to sell in his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Меликова Зебунисо проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 38 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Меликова Зебунисо работает более чем 4 лет в области торговли. Она покупает товар и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zebuniso M., a thirty-eight-year-old widow with two children, lives in the Khuroson region. She has a secondary education. For over four years she has worked in sales, buying merchandise to sell from her stand. She'll use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Sirodjiddin

texts.ru: Абдулмаджидов Сироджиддин проживет в районе Вахш. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Абдулмаджидов Сироджиддин растениеводством занимается более 12 лет. Он выращивает разные виды растений. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Sirodjiddin A. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. Sirodjiddin has been involved in horticulture for over 12 years. He grows various types of plants. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Konotièyelen Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Konotièyelen, 5 mariées et deux veuves,  ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de l’habillement,  des ustensiles de cuisines en plastique et des calebasses.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  7 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Konotièyelen sont à leur 8 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des  paquets de condiments alimentaires  tels les tomates fraîches,  les oignons et les sels de cuisine, les feuilles vertes, les calebasses et les ustensiles de cuisine en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  en gros en condiments alimentaires et en ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  sur place auprès des paysans en calebasses. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Konotièyelen (five married and two widowed) average 40 years of age and four children each.  They all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they do commerce in a variety of goods, such as condiments, clothing, plastic kitchen utensils, and calabash bowls. After having properly repaid the seven preceding loans, the group members are now on their eighth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy packs of condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, onions, salt, green leaves, calabashes, and plastic kitchen ware.   Supplies of condiments and the plastic ware are gotten in bulk in Bamako (capital of Mali).
