As for the calabashes, these are gotten locally from farmers.  Sales are made at the Konobougou City market and at the surrounding fairs.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: J. Joice is currently in the business of selling bread and beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Joice is 38 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina sells tubers of yam and has been in this business for nine years. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 47 years old and married with two children. One of her children is a graduate while the other child is still in school. Regina has been using the proceeds of her business to support her family and to reinvest in her business.

Regina hopes to become a major supplier of tubers of yam. She is requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Olateju

texts.en: Olateju sells clothes, shoes and bags to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profits. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN120,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María M. de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Es soltera con hijos ya mayores de edad y casados.

Comenzó con un fogón de madera en las afueras de su casa vendiendo almuerzos por la necesidad de mantener estudiando a sus hijos ya que ella era el único sustento en su hogar. Poco a poco con los ingresos que tenia fue ahorrando y comprando mesas y sillas para adecuar mejor su lugar de trabajo.

En la actualidad ella tiene su propio restaurante de comidas rápidas en la que trabaja sola desde las 06:00 am cocinando platos como arroz con pollo, pescado apanado, churrasco y arreglando el local. La preocupación que tiene es que trabaja sola y por el sector donde vive hay mucha delincuencia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, aceite y arroz para preparar más comidas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su restaurante.
texts.en:
María M. is 48 years old. She lives in a suburban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is single with children who are already grown and married.

She began with a wood fire outside of her home, selling lunches because she needed to keep her children studying and because she was the only one supporting her home. With her profits, little by little, she was saving and buying tables and chairs so that she could better adapt her workplace.

Now, she has her own restaurant serving quick meals where she works alone from 6:00am, cleaning and cooking meals such as rice with chicken, fried fish, and pork. Her worry is that she works alone in an area where there is high delinquency.

With this loan, she wants to buy sugar, oil and rice to prepare more meals. In the future, she would like to improve her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil and rice

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Atenas del Ecuador está formado por un grupo de mujeres visionaria, dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias como la señora  Olga Álvarez es socia de éste banco hace diez años, vive en su casa propia aunque pequeña con su esposo que trabaja conduciendo un taxi y sus cinco hijos de seis ya que la mayor es casada y vive independiente, sus hijos de 26 y 24 años trabajan y aportan económicamente para la casa,  sus tres últimos hijos estudian en la Universidad y colegio respectivamente.  Este banco se encuentra en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en el año 1999. 

Nuestra socia es dueña de una tienda de víveres hace veinte años, labora en su negocio desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. se siente  muy contenta de formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres ya que durante todos estos años han llegado a tener lazos muy fuertes de compañerismo y amistad  con todas  las socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que reciba del credito solicitado  va a comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, artículos de limpieza y cuidado personal para abastecer su tienda.

Su meta es llegar a ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
The Atenas Communal Bank of Ecuador is made up of a group of visionary women, like Olga Álvarez, who are prepared to help their families get ahead. Olga has been a member of this bank for ten years. Her house, although small, is her own, and she lives there with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and five of their six children. The eldest daughter is married and lives elsewhere. Her 26- and 24-year-old work and help support the family, while the three youngest study in college and high school respectively. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, capital of the Azuay Province, which is located in the southern part of Ecuador's Andean mountain range; it is the third most important city in Ecuador and is known for maintaining the tranquility and beauty of an ancient city. Its historic center was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1999. Olga has run a grocery store for 20 years. She works from 6 am until 9 pm. She is very happy to be part of this beautiful group of women since through the years they have all developed strong ties of companionship and friendship. With the loan money, she will buy rice, sugar, salt, pasta, cleaning products and personal care products to stock her store. Her goal is to be able to add on to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, pasta, cleaning products and personal care products to stock her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, D. 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa que es  propia.Tiene 15 años D. experiencia en L. crianza D. animales, y también en el cultivo D.  papa, maíz y alfalfa. Toda su familia participa activamente  en  las diferentes  actividades laborales,  es por esta razón  que en las mañanas salen todos a  llevar a pastar a sus animales  al campo. Además en su casa también les brinda el cuidado adecuado  y los  alimenta con L. alfalfa que  extrae D. sus terrenos cultivados, y después D. varios meses  venD. sus animales a buenos precios, que  en su mayoría son toros (vivos o sacrificados).Esta muy satisfecha porque este negocio le genera buenas ganancias. Otra forma D. ganar dinero  es  arrendando sus toros para el arado, necesidad que tienen todos sus conocidos, es por esta razón que para mas adelante desea  tener más cabezas D. ganado.Es L. octava oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Francisca tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en L. compra D. un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and their 5 children in their own home. She has 15 years of experience raising animals and cultivating potatoes, corn and alfalfa. Her whole family participates actively in the different activities, and in the mornings they all go out to graze their animals in the fields. They also offer adequate care on their land, feeding their animals with the alfalfa that they get from their cultivated fields and after various months they sell their animals at good prices. The majority are bulls (live or slaughtered). She is very satisfied because this business generates good earnings. Another form of generating income is to rent her bulls for plows, something that all their colleagues need, and for this reason she would like to have more heads of cattle. This is the eight opportunity that she has had to have a loan from MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. Furthermore, she thanks all the people that maD. this loan possible, as it will be very useful to progress her business. Francisca has plant to invest the money in the purchase of a small bull.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a small bull

loans.name: Mwanajaa

texts.en:
Mwanajaa, a married mother of four children all attending school, supplies building materials to potential customers from her quarry site, a business she has been operating for four years. Mwanajaa's customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality and high transport costs and therefore joined Yehu in order to qualify for loans to deal with those challenges. With the Ksh 30,000 loan she is requesting, Mwanajaa intends to pay the laborers and the costs incurred transporting building materials ready for sale.

Mwanajaa lives in a rental house, with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To pay for quarry site, wages for quarry miners and transport to her home.

loans.name: Nathaline

texts.en:
Nathaline M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a little restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock cakes and bags of sugar.  Nathaline is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock cakes and bags of sugar

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 63 years old. He is married with 8 adult children. He has been farming for 20 years in Kisii town in Western Kenya. Simion's products are tea, milk and trees, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market.

Simion recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo.  He has requested this loan of KES 40,000 to purchase farm supplies to plant tea and coffee and to buy a dairy cow. He believes that through this investment, he will earn income from the sale of milk and tea and the health of his family will improve.

He has been challenged by crop and animal diseases, which affect his income.

In the future, Simion would like to improve his farming techniques and expand his farm to take advantage of economies of scale. He appreciates the financial help that has improved the lives of his family members.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem S., 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. and her husband are hired to grow mushrooms for an income of $2.50 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a farm growing mushrooms.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin V., 29, and her husband, Mr. Vanh Sroeun, 31, married in 2001 and have two young children (pictured above). The family lives across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophoin sells fruits and her husband is a taxi driver. Besides these businesses, the couple also grows rice and lotus on their farmland in the village.

Sophoin is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her farm

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine was born in 1975 and is married with seven children aged between 2 and 10. Her husband is a driver and both work hard for the purpose of providing all the basic needs of their children.

Claudine has owned a small business selling fruits for ten years. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day.

Claudine is now requesting a Kiva loan for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more sacks of fruit. This expansion will allow her to attract more customers which is the way to earn more profits. With the extra money expected, she will pay her children’s school fees and improve their living conditions as well.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of fruit to expand her business

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel Alarcón vive en casa propia en la calle moxos de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su hija menor, es una persona de la tercera edad y la actividad que realiza es la confección de trajes de varón,  con esta actividad el se solventa sus gastos de alimentación y otros ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, ya fue cliente de Kiva en dos oportunidades es cliente de Impro desde hace 5 años y esta satisfecho con las condiciones que se otorga el crédito.

Por tener un buen historial y por la actividad califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel Alarcón lives in a house that he owns on Moxos Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. He lives with his young daughter. Fidel is an older man, past retirement age, but he still works as a tailor, making men's suits. The income from his work is his only source of income and it covers his basic living expenses. Fidel has been an Impro client for 5 years. He has received two Kiva loans before and is satisfied with the terms of the loans. Fidel has good work and borrowing histories, factors that qualify him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus suegros, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que la ayudado a mantener su economía estable. Es así que ofrece sus productos por medio de catálogos a vecinas o amistades que están interesadas en arreglar su apariencia. Ahora esta interesada de implementar la venta de otros productos, con el fin de aumentar sus ganancias, en este caso vende calzados y de acuerdo al pedido que le hacen ella lo consigue. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es que sus clientes son muy cumplidos con el pago. En adelante desea que su negocio crezca y se diversifique en la venta de calzados y prendas de vestir. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal, le tienen mucho aprecio, por lo amable y responsable que es. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comercializar juegos artificiales para la temporada navideña que se acerca.
texts.en: 42 year old Beatriz is a hardworking mother. She lives with her in-laws along with her husband and two children. She sells beauty products, and this helps her to keep economically stable. She sells her products from catalogs to neighbors and friends who want to improve their appearance. Now she is interested in selling additional products so that she can increase her income. For instance by selling shoes to order. What she likes most about her work is that her clients are very good with their payments. For the future, she wants her business to grow and diversify to include shoes and clothing. This is her 8th loan from MFP, which means that the loan will be very beneficial in developing her business. In her community group, she is appreciated greatly for her kindness and responsibility. She will use the loan to sell fireworks for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy fireworks that she will sell

loans.name: Kimmy

texts.en:
Kimmy A. is from the village of Lower Cogon, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Kimmy is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Kimmy owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale and she also has a charcoal business. Kimmy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Kimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additonal products to sell. Kimmy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Kimmy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad,se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 10 años, uno estudia en colegio y el otro en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8 hasta las 13h00 ya que allí tiene que llegar a atender a sus hijos, en estos días  entrega y realiza los cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra por quincena. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa por lo que este fin de semana va a viajar a Guayaquil a traer más mercadería. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco y por la ayuda recibida de parte de la institución.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
In the El Progresso neighborhood of Portoviejo the Ilusiones community bank meets every two weeks.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal urban area of the city which is known as 'the prison sector' because the Portoviejo women's prison is located in this area.

This is where we find Ana who is 35 years old, married and has two children aged 14 and 10.  One is studying in high school and the other in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Ana sells all types of clothes door to door.  She works every day from 8.00am to 1.00pm because after that she has to look after her children. She delivers her clothes and collects payment for them because she leaves them with her customers on credit and takes payment every two weeks.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil every two weeks or every month depending on what orders she has.

This loan will be used to buy clothes as she will be traveling to Guayaquil this weekend to buy more goods.  This is her third loan cycle with the community bank and she likes it because her fellow bank members are responsible and she has received support from the organization.

Her dream is to have her own clothes warehouse.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tienen 52 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 2 años posee una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, negocio que se encuentra instalada en el interior D. su casa. Es así que cada mañana atienD. a sus clientes, en ocasiones son muchos por lo que sola no se da abasto, pero es cuando sus hijos la apoyan en este trabajo. Su negocio es uno D. los pocos que existen dentro D. su localidad por lo que sus ventas son estables y con el paso del tiempo ha sabido captar la necesidad D. su clientela, por ello procura abastecerla D. diversos productos y D. mayor demanda. Por ahora su anhelo es incrementar D. mercadería su tienda. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería y tener mayor variedad D. productos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Elva is 52 years old.  She lives with her 2 children in her own home.  She has owned a small convenience store for 2 years.  Her business is insiD. her home.  Every morning she serves her customers.  Sometimes she has a lot of customers and can't serve them all herself but her children support her in her work at these times.  Her business is one of the few that exist in her town which means that her sales are stable and over time she has known how to understand her customers' needs and she tries to keep her business stocked with different products and products which are in most demand.  For now her wish is to increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

This is the first loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people and very supportive of one another.  She thanks the people who will help to fund her loan since it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  With her loan she will invest in the purchase of merchandise and have a wider variety of goods in her store.

loans.use: To stock up with products to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Neiva Maricela

texts.es:
Neiva de 29 años, cría y vende pollos. Vive con su hijo en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 6 años se dedicaba a criar pollos pero por falta de capital dejo el negocio y si dedico a otra cosa. Pero hace un año atrás ella retomo el negocio de los pollos con unos ahorros que tenia porque son rentables y les gusta criar animales comestibles. Ahora tiene un criadero de pollos en su casa y su mama le ayuda a darles la comida en la mañana a los pollos desde las 06h00am hasta que ella atiende a su hijo de 9 años para que vaya a la escuela. Trabaja en las tardes hasta las 20h00pm vendiendo los pollos grandes que pesan de 6 a 7 libras. Para tener más ingresos ha comenzado a vender artículos plásticos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para tener más animales para vender y plásticos para tener otra fuente de ingreso. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y tener un local para vender pollos.
texts.en:
Neiva is 29 years old.  She raises and sells chickens.  She lives with her son in Playas canton.  This is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and it is noted for it wide variety of seafood.

Neiva began raising chickens 6 years ago but because she lacked capital she left the business and turned to something else.  However, a year ago she returned to her chicken business with some savings which she had built up because it is a profitable business and she likes raising animals.  Now she has a chicken nursery in her home.  Her mother helps to feed the chickens in the mornings at 6.00am because Neiva has to look after her 9 year-old son and gets him off to school.  She works in the afternoon until 8.00pm selling the big chickens which weigh 6 – 7 pounds.  To make more income she has also started selling plastic goods.

Neiva will use her loan to buy chickens so that she has more animals to sell and also plastic goods so that she has another source of income.  In the future, she would like to have her own home and have premises from which she can sell her chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens and plastic goods

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su hijo; la actividad que realiza es el flete de joyas a las señoras que bailan en las fiestas tradicionales, pero con sus ahorros instalo una pequeña tienda donde puso dos puntos de llamadas telefónicas, con cuyos ingresos complementa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más joyas y no perder clientela.


Es cliente de Impro desde noviembre del 2009 y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alicia lives in her own house in La Paz’s Villa Nuevo Potosí zone with her son.

Her business is renting jewelry to the women who dance at traditional festivals.  She used her savings to set up a small store where she installed telephone services to earn extra income.

She will use the requested loan to increase her capital to buy more jewels so as not to lose customers.

She has been an Impro client since 2009 and she pays well.  Therefore, she can have access to a new loan.

loans.use: To buy more jewels to rent to the women who dance at traditional festivals.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 25 years old. Maricel is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods & canned goods. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods & canned goods

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is forty years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Pangalalan within the municipality of Sindangan, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Evelyn sells a variety of different products from her sari-sari to the local community. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 30,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory for her shop and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mamasuluv

texts.en:
Mamasuluv B. is a 49-year-old mother who lives with her husband and six children. 

Mamasuluv and her husband make a living by planting and cultivating crops like onions, corn and grain in their field. They both work very hard. This couple is striving to work almost day and night in their field plowing, cultivating and fertilizing soil to grow more crops due to a great demand in the market. 

They hope to use a loan to make more and better crops and in the end to earn more money. 

In the future, they hope to save more money to buy more land so they can grow a wider range of crops for additional income. Mamasuluv hopes one day she will have enough money to send her children to a local school.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda D. L. C. is from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is 46 years old.  Luzviminda is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Luzviminda from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 37 years old. Rachel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Rachel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling products for daily use such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rachel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rachel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Milagro, tiene 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Mercedes Umaña, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia y dos hijos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, ella tiene un taller D. sastrería, trabaja D. lunes a domingo, la confección que ella prepara son en su mayoría uniformes para los centros escolares.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales D. costura, como hilos, ciper, brochas, telas D. diferentes colores, agujas, esta compra le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario para la ejecución D. su trabajo, además que así será capaz D. realizar cualquier pedido D. sastrería, dándole una mejor estabilidad al negocio y su economía.
Las aspiraciones D. doña Milagro es continuar incrementando el negocio, trabajar con financiamientos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro, 42, lives in Mercedes Umaña, Usulután department with her family and two children who are 18 and 22 years of age.  She has a tailor shop.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  The items she manufactures the most are school uniforms.

She is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies like: thread, zippers, clasps, fabric in assorted colors and needles.  This purchase will help her have everything she needs to do her work in addition to making it possible for her to accomplish whatever tailoring job might arise providing her business with more stability and income.

Milagro’s hopes are to continue growing in business, to work with loans and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like: thread, zippers and fabric in assorted colores.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch C. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to purchase equipment to produce rice wine. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy equipment to produce rice wine

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La sra. Rosa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales los fines de semana en su casa de habitación donde es bien conocida entre sus vecinos los cuales compran el producto
Utilizara este crédito para mejorar su casa donde quiere cambiar los pilares los cuales se están hundiendo y con la compra de los perlines mejorar la vivienda 
Este es el quinto crédito que trabaja con ceprodel donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado ya que con los créditos ha logrado mejorar su negocio 
La señora vive con dos de sus hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan para los gastos de la casa y alimentación
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa sells ‘nacatamales’ [maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves] on the weekend at her home. She is well known by her neighbors who buy her products.

She will use the loan to make her house better. She wishes to change the posts because they are sinking and to buy metal sheets to make the improvements. This is her fifth loan from Ceprodel. She is grateful for the support given because through the loans she has been able to improve her business. 

She lives with two of her children who work and help her with the house expenses and the cost of food.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and bags of cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of clothing for her business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, reside en Usulután, vive con su familia y su esposa y su hijo de 5 años, él se dedica a la venta de abarroterías y bebidas, desde hace 5 años y lo heredo de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, especialmente bebidas (licores), ya que es su fuerte en el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a diversificar la licorería y atender de la mejor  manera a los clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar los ingresos de su familia y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
José lives in Usulután with his family, his wife and five year old son.  He has been selling groceries and beverages for five years; he inherited it from his father.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, especially beverages (alcoholic beverages) since they are his best sellers in the store.  This loan will help him diversify his stock of liquor and better serve his customers.  His goal is to improve his family’s income and grow in business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, especially alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieva works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Nieva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Nieva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nigogo

texts.en:
Nigogo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.ru:
Гагик родился в 1961 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Неркин Анд (Nerkin Hand). Женат с 1998г и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 12 лет, младшему 10 лет, оба учатся в сельской школе. Жена работает бухгалтером.
С 1982 г Гагик занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота, пчеловодством и земледелием. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (мед, говядина, молоко, пшеница и т.д) он продает на рынке своим постоянным клиентам. 
Гагику необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения сена и для организации уборки урожая пшеницы.
texts.en: Gagik was born in 1961 in the city of Kapan and currently lives in the Nerkin Hand village.  He has been married since 1998 and has two sons, the oldest of whom is 12 years old and the youngest is 10.  Both of them attend a village school.  Gagik's wife works as an accountant.  Since 1982, Gagik has been involved in breeding cattle, beekeeping and agriculture.  He sells his agricultural products (honey, beef, milk, wheat, etc.) at the market to his loyal customers.  Gagik needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram in order to buy hay and organize harvesting activities.

loans.use: to purchase hay and organize harvesting

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Yedi; el socio tiene 27 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El  socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la compra al por mayor de Cds, el socio luego los vende al por menor en su stand del mercadillo de Tica tica, el socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de CDS de películas y venderlos en el mercadillo al por menor en unidades. El socio solicita  el préstamo para invertir en la compra de CDS al por mayor.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Yedi, 27, is a member of the “Imasumac II” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

He has a spouse and a son.  He buys CDs at wholesale and then sells them at retail in his stand in the Tica Tica market.  He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of DVDs to sell at retail by the unit.  He wants the loan to buy CDs at wholesale.

He is grateful for the support granted and commits to be very disciplined with the payment of his installments.

loans.use: to buy CDs at wholesale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She has been running a clothing store since 2006. She sells women and children's clothes. She has a good number of clients passing by her shop because she always presents the newest collection. Her business income is vital for her family. She is supportive of her parents. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory with the new summer collection. In the future, she is hoping to add woman shoes to sell from her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Mirian Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos casados y 2 hijas en etapa escolar; Mirian se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para la venta; dedicándose a este negocio por más de 10 años, siendo madre soltera se dedico al negocio para mantener a sus hijos; la Sra. Mirian gana como un aproximado de S/ 300 soles semanales por la venta de sus cerdos. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo padrillo para poder así preñar a sus cerdas,  su principal desafío es el estar trabajando con cerdos  con lo cual esta  expensa a coger alguna enfermedad.  Su  sueño es comprar un terreno para hacer crecer su chanchería y así abarcar mas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian is a single mother with four children. Two of them are married and the other two are in school. Mirian raises pigs to sell and has been in this business for more than 10 years. Being a single mother, she started this business in order to support her children. Sra. Mirian earns approximately 300 PEN each week from the sale of her pigs.

This loan will be invested in a male pig so that she can impregnate her sows. Her greatest challenge in working with pigs is the expense related to treating diseases. Her dream is to buy a piece of land so that she can build a butcher shop and expand her market base.

loans.use: to purchase a male pig.

loans.name: Anuna

texts.en: Anuna is 30 years old. She has three children. All of the children are in school. She is a married woman. She requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more distilled alcohol to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita vive en la localidad de la guardia,  es casada  tiene 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son independientes y  uno esta a su cargo, su esposo es albañil hace unos 30 años, La Sra. margarita trabaja en el mercado la ramada de la ciudad de Santa Cruz vendiendo dulces de forma ambulante, aproximadamente hace unos 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, el destino del crédito es para la compra de variedad de dulces, chicles por mayor para surtir su mercadería, se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico que le brindo la institución.
texts.en: Mrs. Margarita lives in the town of La Guardia. She is married with five children, four of which now live independently and one is still in her care. Her husband has been a mason for about 30 years. For the past 15 years Margarita has worked at the Ramada market in the city of Santa Cruz, selling candy in the streets. The purpose of this loan is for Margarita to purchase a variety of sweets and chewing gum in bulk, to supplement her stock of merchandise. Margarita is grateful for the financial support she receives from the institution.

loans.use: to purchase sweets in bulk

loans.name: Laura Sebina

texts.es:
Laura de 30 años, empezó con una carreta de comidas rápidas, la cual aun mantiene para vender los fines de semana. Luego poco a poco empezó a comprar sillas, mesas cuando logró reunir un dinero.
Su trabajo lo realiza con 2 ayudantes de cocina, y su horario es de 18:00  hasta 12:00 am ósea parte de la tarde. El sector donde tiene su local fue pavimentado recientemente y esto le ha ayudado para aumentar sus ventas. Laura es  madre soltera tiene 2 hijos estudiantes y 1 que todavía es un bebé.
Para seguir su negocio Laura necesita un préstamo y comprar carne, pollo, pescado y utensilios de cocina.
A largo plazo entre sus planes está agrandar su negocio y  que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Laura is 30 years old and has a fast food cart that she maintains so that she can sell on the weekends. Gradually over time, she began buying chairs and tables whenever she had the money. She completes her work with the help of two kitchen assistants. Her schedule is from 6pm to midnight.

The area where she sets up shop was recently paved, which has helped to increase her sales. Laura is a single mother with two children in school and another who is still a baby. To move her business forward, Laura needs a loan to buy meat, chicken, fish, and cooking utensils. Her long-term plans include expanding her business and helping her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, fish, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Carmen tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión y tiene dos hijos. 

Carmen vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles y postres. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. 
En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como azucar y maquinas para hacer pasteles. Su sueño de Carmen es que sus hijos se han profesionales.   
 
El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in Cusco Department.  Currently, she’s 57 years old, married and has two children.  Carmen lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She makes cakes, pastries and desserts to sell.  She’s been doing this for 20 years now and does very well.

On this occasion, Carmen needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar and machines to make cakes.  Carmen’s dream is that her children become professionals.

The “Comuzone IV” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is here.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sugar and machines to make cakes.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. 

Fatima and her husband work as school teachers with decent salaries. 

Fatima also has her own project, which is a grocery store. She wants to purchase more groceries to have a better collection for sale to increase her income. But the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Fatima gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more groceries and have a better collection to enable her to compete and sell more. This will increase her income and enable her to provide better life conditions for the family. 

Fatima is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to have better collection for sale.

loans.name: Dany Rosibel

texts.es: Dany, utilizara un nuevo préstamo en la compra D. maíz, tomates, papas, queso, para el fortalecimiento del negocio, los anteriores le han ayudado para mantenerse y además para mejorar las ventas a los clientes. Su condicion en la familia ha mejorado, al igual que el negocio, espera que con este nuevo pueda cancelarlo oportunamente para continuar recibiendo este apoyo.
texts.en: Dany will use a new loan to purchase corn, tomatoes, potatoes, cheese to strengthen her business. The previous loans have helped her maintain her business and also improve sales to customers. Her family condition has improved as has the business. She hopes to repay the new loan promptly so as to continue receiving this support.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, potatoes and cheese.

loans.name: Ranie

texts.en:
Ranie is 42 years old and single. She was involved in a sari-sari store business before, but now she opts to have a clothing business where she sells ready-to-wear items like jeans and shirts for both male and female. She has had this business for almost one year. She requests a loan for 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional variety of clothing for children and for adult wear.

Ranie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ranie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell, like ready-to-wear items such as jeans and shirts for both male and female.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) and her husband, Vin, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have three children- one son and two daughters. Two are garment workers and the other one is in school. 

Bunthan is hired by her villagers to farm. She gets paid with fees. Her husband is a fisherman and does construction work. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to repair the house where she lives because the house is old and breaks in some part. She will also use a part of the loan to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat and fishing nets.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and married to Benson. They have one child. Elizabeth has been operating a boutique for the last three years in Emali town. 
Elizabeth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of shoes and clothes for resale.
In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and buy a plot for setting up business premises.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 05 enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de boissons depuis 2003. Elle  achète les produits à Lomé. Elle a un bar.
Ablavi a requis son cinquième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente afin de satisfaire plus la demande.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 46 years old and the mother of 5 children. She is married to a driver and has been selling drinks since 2003. She has a bar and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Ablavi is requesting her 5th loan from WAGES so that she can restock on drinks. In the coming years, she would like to open more sales outlets in order to be able to better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to restock on drinks.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años de edad; él tiene un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de reparación y montaje de equipos de oficina y electrodomésticos, negocio que aprendió desde sus 12 años de edad cundo frecuentaba el taller de su tío quien hacia reparación y mantenimientos de rokolas y posteriormente aprendió este oficio técnicamente en una academia, donde se preparó como técnico electrónico y cuando finalizó sus estudios emprendió su propia aventura, haciendo reparaciones a grabadoras y equipos de sonido, pasando por televisores y cuando aprendió electrónica digital amplió su rango de acción y continuó con el mantenimiento y reparación de computadores y microondas. Simultáneamente trabajado como empleado durante 6 años en una empresa complementó su aprendizaje y experiencia, aunque en la actualidad ofrece estos servicios a esta empresa, pero además ha logrado nuevos clientes empresariales de muchas empresas que aun lo reconocen y le pagan por el mantenimiento cada  8 o 45 días En la actualidad está planeando un mayor crecimiento de su negocio en infraestructura, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará repuestos y materiales, como discos duros, memorias, puentes de alimentación entre otros necesarios para el servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Hector is 48 years old, lives in the city of Barranquilla, and has two children, ages 9 and 15. He has a business where he offers repair and assembly services for office equipment and domestic appliances. He learned this trade at 12 years old, when he frequented the workshop of his uncle, who did repair and maintenance on jukeboxes.

Later he learned this job technically in school, where he was trained as an electrical technician. When he finished these studies he began his own venture, doing repairs to recorders and sound equipment, then moving onto television sets. When he learned digital electronics he expanded his level of ability and continued with the maintenance and reparation of computers and microwaves. 

Working at the same time as an employee in a company for six years complimented his training and experience. Although he actually offers these services to the company, he has gained new business clients from many companies who now know him and pay him for maintenance every 8 or 45 days. In reality he is planning a major growth of his company's infrastructure. 

This is the reason why he is turning to the loan organization, his first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan he will buy parts and materials, like hard drives, memory, and power sources, among other items necessary for the service he offers.

loans.use: to buy parts and materials, like hard drives, memory, and power sources, among others.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Жумагул 45 лет, замужем. Жумагул работает учителем начальных классов в местной школе и известна как взыскательный и профессиональный педагог. Свою любовь к образованию Жумагуль смогла привить и собственным пятерым детям, трое из которых получили высшее образование, две младшие – школьницы. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Жумагул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 2 коровы и 4 овцы, также она возделывает земельный надел с пшеницей и кукурузой. Будучи энергичным человеком, Жумагул выращивает в собственном саду  черешню, абрикосы, яблоки и малину.
  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумагул обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, Жумагул хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Jumagul is 45 years old and married. She works as a primary school teacher in the local school and is known as a demanding and professional pedagogue. Jumagul was able to impart her love for education to her own five children, three of whom have received higher education, while the two youngest girls are still in school. While looking for a source of additional income for her family, 5 years ago Jumagul started her own business raising livestock and growing crops. Today, her farm contains 2 cows and 4 sheep, while she also works a plot of land with wheat and corn. An energetic person, Jumagul also grows cherries, apricots, apples and raspberries in her garden. 

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle. In the future, Jumagul would like to grow her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 65-years-old and married to Stephen. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling milk for the past two years with a monthly income of Kes 4,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Tabitha will use the loan to buy more milk for selling. With the anticipated profit from the business she will venture into the green grocer business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more milk for selling.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 52 years old and married to Nelius. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET for KES 20,000. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child.

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has been in farming for 7 years with her milk and egg products being sold in the local market.  She is 40 years old and married with 3 year old child.

Evaline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.  She says the 7 years of experience in farming has helped her acquire good skills and she hopes her business will continue to grow.  She added a dairy cow to provide milk both for family consumption and resale to provide other family basic needs.

She says animal diseases remains a challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is a 34-year old married man with two children who are 10 and 2  years old. One of the children goes to school. Isa has been operating a retail shop since 2007. He sells daily household items and works throughout the week from Monday to Sunday. He started his business so that he could earn income to sustain himself and his family. His main clients are people within the area of his business location. Isa will use this particular loan to buy stock for his retail shop. He hopes to expand this business to a wholesale shop when he accumulates enough income. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital to buy in bulk to meet all the needs of his customers. Isa describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Nafi's Group

texts.fr: ce groupe a été crée le 29 Août 2012 et regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village. Les membres du groupe sont unis par la solidarité et l’entraide.  Faty est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 garçon. Elle fait du petit commerce de chaussure local. Elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans cette domaine. Elle vend dans son village. Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter  12 pairs de chaussures à 2000 francs. Elle est la seule à faire cette activité dans le village. Avec ses bénéfices elle va aider son mari dans la maison et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was established on 29 August 2012 and is made up of women who live in the same village. They share a sense solidarity and a feeling a mutual support. 

Fatou is 42 years old. She is married and a mother of five children, of whom one is a boy. She works by selling shoes in her area. She has a lot of experience with this business. 

With this loan, she plans to buy 12 pairs of shoes for 2000 francs each. Fatou is the only one to sell shoes in her village.

With her earnings, she is going to help her husband support their family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Lanny

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lanny works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Lanny is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing net and tackle for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing net and tackle

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe, who is married and is mother of two underage children, is a highly responsible person, strong and proactive. The household income has never been stable, as her husband has an occassional type of employment. Given the situation Guadalup started selling shoes by catalogue 4 years ago, for to help her family secure more income and this way be able to cover the tuition costs of her little ones.

Today she requires a loan in of $375 to be able to cover the strong demand for her products she is currently seeing and also to provide more variety for her clients. She plans to repay the loan in full in a term of approxiamtely 6 months. You can ensure the wellbeing of this family. They needs you and with your support they will manage to improve their living conditions and overcome their adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de dos hijos aun menores de edad, es una persona altamente responsable, fuerte y proactiva. Los ingresos del hogar nunca son seguros en su hogar, pues su esposo posee un trabajo eventual. Es por esta situación por la que Guadalupe, hace ya 4 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, para de esta forma poder tener un poco más de ingresos y así logar hacer frente a los gastos de educación de sus pequeños.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de 375 DLLS para poder cubrir el fuerte pedido que tiene ahora y además de poder surtir más mercancía que ofrecer a sus clientes, mismos que planea regresar en su totalidad en un plazo de 6 meses aproximadamente. Tú puedes asegurar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan, con tu apoyo lograran vivir mejor y vencer las adversidades.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Parascovia

texts.en:
Parascovia is a very strong-willed person, someone who has found ways of overcoming the problems and obstacles with which she has been confronted in her life. She comes from a family of farmers and as a young person tried in many ways to advance herself and to reach for a better life. After graduating from the high school in her region, she entered the university in the nearby city of Cahul, but having had limited financial support from her parents she was unable to finish her studies.

She began working as a sales person at the outdoor market as an employee of a business owner. The income which she was receiving was very small and was enough only to meet the most basic needs. Two years ago she decided to try something else and applied for a permit to open a small business, rented a place in the market and started to work independently. Parascovia sells clothing and currently her sales are going very well, due in large part to her keen sense for what customers want and her willingness to explore new fashions. She is requesting a loan to extend her operation, specifically to rent the spot next the one she currently uses and to purchase initial inventory.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa weaves alpaca wool into sweaters and gloves, which she sells in market fairs in El Alto. Her husband is a salaried chauffeur. Their two children attend the state university. She lives in the Los Andes section of El Alto. She would use the loan to buy raw materials (alpaca wool). This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her repayment history is good: She paid off her installments on the dates specified in her contract, and she is a good candidate for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es tejedora en lana Alpaca y fabrica chompas y guantes de lana que comercializa en ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo es chofer asalariado, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la universidad estatal. Vive en la zona los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (lana de alpaca). Es el segundo crédito con Impro. El primer credito ha sido pagado en las fechas acordadas en el contrato y este buen antecedente le faculta acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Neyo

texts.fr:
Mrs D. is 43 years old, she is born in the village of d’Agbanakin in the County les Lacs. Very resourceful, she has never been discouraged in spite of the financial difficulties she faces. Her main activity is the purchase of fresh fish that she then smokes for resale. The rudimentary state of her equipment does not allow her to make a profit. This is why she is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a new wood stove and other equipment. This will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions. Her family consists of five (5) children, three (3) little sisters and her husband who is Ill.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Agée de 43 ans, Madame D. Néyo est née dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la Préfecture des Lacs. Très entreprenante, elle ne s’est jamais découragée malgré les difficultés financières qu’elle traverse. Sa principale activité consiste à se procurer de poissons frais et les fumer après pour revendre. L’état rudimentaire de ses matériels ne lui permet pas d’obtenir un bon profit. C’est alors qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un nouveau fourneau et du matériel de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille composée de cinq (5) enfants, de trois (3) petites sœurs en plus de son mari qui est malade.

loans.use: Purchase of a new wood stove and other equipment

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: I have been stitching clothes for the past twenty years so I have a lot of experience. My husband is a company driver at a local company in Karachi      ( the biggest city in Pakistan ) for a pay of $65 a month. At times he is not able to send us a single penny for he has to make his own living as well in that expensive city. I wish to educate my child  who is not yet of school-going age. Before that time comes, I need to have a steady source of income. I therefore would like to buy a new stitching machine for myself that costs $175 so I can generate more income.

loans.use: buy a stitching machine

loans.name: Sunkari

texts.en: Sunkari M. is twenty-eight years old and married with three children.  She started her business six years ago on a very small scale. In 2005, she joined SMT, and has so far obtained loans three times.  Sunkari expanded her business by including the sale of millet, pigeon peas, wheat flour and spices.  Her husband helps her purchase the items either in Freetown or from farmers in various villages.  Sunkari will complete her current loan repayments in December and would like to take more loans to expand her business.   She is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: Expansion of her market stall by purchasing additional food stock

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Mrs. Chung S., 37, is a labourer and lives with her husband who is now unemployed in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a labourer, earning only about $2.5/day. She has one child who is now at school. Mrs. Chung S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business to help her and her family generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Mugongo B1 (B) Group

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells milk for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy milk cans.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her milk business

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en: Gordana is 41 years old and lives in the village Šušnjari, near Laktaši. Her husband is permanently employed and earns a monthly income of 900 KM. The family also earns an additional 200 KM a month from agricultural work. They have one child, who goes to secondary school. Gordana owns a boutique, but needs a loan to buy clothing to sell to her customers. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her family's income and build a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell in a small boutique.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun S., 26, and her husband, Sok Deam, married in 2001. They have two children; one son and one daughter. Their daughter is in school and the son is still young and stays at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Samoeun is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production in 1996. Samoeun taught her husband to be a silk weaver since they have been married. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village.

Mrs. Samoeun is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Ms. Gladis R. has no children and lives in her own home on Juan Carrillo Street in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz. She has a silk-screening business (printing logos and advertising on clothing, hats, etc.) that yields moderate profits, which is why she decided to start a second business: clothing sales. She has been able to earn sufficient income to survive, but not enough to start saving.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric for her silk-screening business because due to her many years of experience, she now has many customers who order her high-quality products.

Gladis has good credit history, which qualifies her for a new loan. She has previously obtained 3 loans and repaid them by the due date. She has been our customer since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladis es mujer sola no tiene hijos vive en casa propia en la calle Juan Carrillo de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la serigrafía (actividad de imprimir logos y propaganda en t-shirts, en telas, en gorras, etc.) y gana moderadamente por lo cual decidió iniciar una segunda actividad paralela: vender ropa, negocio con el cual ha logrado completar sus ingresos a un nivel bueno, pero no lo necesario como para comenzar a ahorrar.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela para la serigrafía ya que como trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo tiene muchos clientes que la conocen y realizan sus pedidos debido a la muy buena calidad de su trabajo.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Gladis ya ha recibido tres créditos anteriores y los ha cancelado en sus fechas establecidas; es cliente nuestra desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for silk-screening business (stencil and embroidery)

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria is divorced with five children. When she separated from her husband, she was in a very difficult economic situation because she lacked money and the financial aid she received for food was not enough. She had the skill to bake because her family has always had bakeries. She started by making white bread, then sugar loaves, and now she bakes an even greater variety. Her efforts have allowed her to prosper.

Now, Maria needs a loan of $600 that she will repay in six months to buy an industrial mixer. With your contribution, Maria will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

María es divorciada pero tiene 5 hijos, cuando se separo de su pareja vivió un situación económica muy difícil debido a la falta de dinero, ya que con la pensión alimenticia no era suficiente, su familia siempre ha tenido panaderías, por lo que ella sabia ese oficio, empezó haciendo pan blanco, luego de azúcar, y luego mas variedad, ha logrado prosperar a base de su esfuerzo.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una batidora de uso industrial. Con tu contribución María continuara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of an Industrial Mixer

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of Noshair A.. She has been married for the last 25 years. She is a mother of one son, who is not of school-going age. Her husband is a cook and runs his own small hotel. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband’s hotel business.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members; Shamim baji, who wants to expand her food business; Zeb baji wants a loan to expand her paint business; Haleema baji wants a loan to buy a fruit business; Sharfan baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1966, Mrs. Adjo K. left her studies very early. Not having been encouraged ahead in her studies, she turned to working the earth and like her husband she is particularly involved with the cultivation of cassava. A mother of eight (8) children, she manages to provide for the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to increase her cultivable land. This will allow her to increase her income. She will therefore be able to secure a suitable life for her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966, Madame K. Adjo a quitté très tôt le banc des classes. N’ayant pas été bien poussé dans les études, elle se livre au travail de la terre notamment la culture du manioc de même que son mari. Mère de huit (8) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir au besoin de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable. Ceci lui permettre d’accroître ses revenus.
