Il pourra alors assurer convenablement la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase her cultivable land

loans.name: Joyce's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 8 and 12. She has owned her own grocery store since 2001. Every day, she begins work at 6AM and finishes at around 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $350.

Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to expand her current stock. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Sriv

texts.en: Sriv S., 64, works selling Khmer cake to the local people to earn a profit of around US$2.5 per day. The cakes are made from rice, and their cores are bean with sugar palm. In Khmer language these cakes are called "Nom Krouch." This kind of cake is one of the favorite foods among Cambodian people, especially people who live in her village. Her husband, Sut Sat, 70, is a rice farmer and earns US$3 per day. This couple has two children, both of whom are employed. Mrs. Sriv is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her business selling Khmer cake and also to help purchase a water pump to irrigate the crop and rice field.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to irrigate the crop and rice field.

loans.name: Belmiro Fabião

texts.pt:
Belmiro nasceu em Gaza, tem 25 anos de idade estudou ate 7ªclasse vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos: a primeira de 5 anos e o segundo de 1 ano. A mais velha é que vai a escola, mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia com a sua tia devido a doênças frequentes que o atacavam naquela região.
Belmiro chega a Namaacha e não consegue vaga para continuar com os estudos, no ano seguinte  a tia da-lhe um fundo para ele poder iniciar o seu próprio negócio, começa com a venda de bolos adquiridos na swazilândia e revendidos ao lado de uma barraca de refrigerantes na fronteira, o seu negócio teve um impacto positivo quando os alfandegarios decidem retirar a barraca de refrigerantes e consequêntimente além de bolos passa também a vender refrigerantes e a fazer câmbio de divisas, assim Belmiro conseguiu contruir a sua própria casa. Anos depois junta se com a sua esposa e sai da casa da tia e aos poucos construia sua própria barraca na sua residência para aumenter a renda familiar, seu melhor produto e a( farinha de trigo, arroz, peixe e massa) compra o kilo a 20.00.mt e revende a 28.00.mt, o saco a 500.00.mt e revende a 625.00.mt, a lámina a 350 e revende a 700.00.mt e a caixa de massa 200.00.mt e revende a 350.00.mt consecutivamente. Trabalha das 7h as 20h tem rendido um valor de 6000.00.mt mensalmente consegue poupar 2.000.00mt por mês, para além dos filhos Belmiro responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Gaza mandando lhes uma sesta básica de 1.000.00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Belmiro na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de 15.000.00mt usou para reforçar o negócio de bolos e refrigerante, conseguiu pagar o emprestimo dentro do prazo determinado e pede este segundo de 12.000.00mt para comprar mercadoria da sua barraca. Tem como objectivo ampliar a sua barraca e pedir um novo empréstimo para comprar uma viatura que lhe possa facilitar nos negócios do seu dia –dia.
texts.en:
Belmiro was born in Gaza, is 25 years old, and studied through seventh grade. He is married and the father of two children: the first is a 5-year-old daughter who goes to school, and the second is a 1-year-old son. Belmiro moved with his aunt to Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland, to avoid the frequent illnesses to which he had been subject in the Gaza area.

Belmiro arrived in Namaacha and was unable to get a spot in school to continue his studies. The next year, his aunt gave him money to enable him to start his own business. He began by selling cakes he bought in Swaziland and reselling them next to a soft drink stand at the border. His business benefited when customs agents decided to shut down the soft drink stand; consequently he started selling soft drinks in addition to cakes and started exchanging currency. Through this, Belmiro was able to build his own house. Years later he got together with his wife and left his aunt’s house.

Little by little he built his own shop in his house to augment the family’s income. His biggest products are wheat flour, which he buys at 20 meticais (MTn) and resells for 28MTn per kilogram; rice, buying at 500MTn and reselling for 625MTn per sack; fish, buying at 350MTn and reselling for 700MTn per plate; and pasta, buying at 200MTn and reselling for 350MTn per box. He works from 7am to 8pm and earns 6,000MTn monthly. He is able to save 2,000MTn per month. In addition to his children, Belmiro takes care of his parents in Gaza, sending them 1,000MTn for basic goods each month.

This is Belmiro’s second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used the first loan, of 15,000MTn, to strengthen his cakes and drinks business and repaid the loan on time. He is asking for this second loan, of 12,000MTn, to buy merchandise for his shop. His goal is to grow his shop and request a new loan to purchase a vehicle to facilitate his day-to-day business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Miryagub

texts.en: You can see in the picture Miryagub's wife. Miryagub was born in 1954. He has 5 children. 10 years ago he started a farming business. The A. family lives in the Khachmaz region the Charkhi village. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides for improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #3 Group

texts.en: Francisca A. is a hardworking mother of seven children. She has to work hard just to feed those seven children, which can be challenging at times because she never learned to read. She came to Esperanza International with no job and no education and needed help. She took out a small loan and started a small business selling bread in her area. She has since grown her business and is hoping to receive her fifth loan! She now sells other types of baked goods and is finally starting to earn a good income. She can afford to feed her children each day and is so excited to have something of her own. It's her business! She wakes up each day with purpose, and for the first time in her life is starting to imagine a better future for herself and her family. She wants to go back to school someday and turn her business into a thriving bakery! She is a hardworking women and knows that she is going to reach her dreams someday.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Mr. Chen Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Andoung Chros village, in Kampong Chhnang province, have formed a village bank loan group. Mr. C. B. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small plot of land and cultivates rice to earn for living. His wife, Mrs. Khum Lay, works in a garment factory and contributes a small salary to the support of the family. Although they work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. C. B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. C. B. is 29 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. Mr. C. B.'s wife is shown in the picture.

Two members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a breeding business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells electronics and phone accessories. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more electronics and phone accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Dunyakhanum

texts.en:
Dunyakhanum M. is a 52-year-old woman who runs a retail shop where she sells bath accessories. She started this business more than 10 years ago when her husband passed away, and she was left alone to raise her young son.

Now her son is grown, and Dunyakhanum is paying for his studies at the university. It is very hard to cover all his expenses, and she has no hope that someone will help her. Dunyakhanum realizes that it is solely her responsibility to pay for his education. She would like to expand her business for this purpose, so she has applied for a 1200 USD loan. Dunyakhanum is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase bath accessories for her shop

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra B., 52, and her husband, Mr. Ry Sut, 58, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a garment factory worker and the other two children attend school.

Ra has been selling porridge and fried banana for 15 years. She buys ingredients to cook from Koki market, which is about 17 kilometers from her village, and sells in front of the village school. Ra earns about $3.75 per day. Mr. Ry Sut has been a teacher for 30 years. Ra is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a water pumping machine for her daughter to use in growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her daughter to grow vegetables and to use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. operates a grocery store and she sells tapioca, milk and sugar, in Cape Coast, She has done so since 2000.

She is married with two children and her husband is a mason. Elizabeth is responsible for paying school fees, food and utilities.

Her loan will be used to expand her trade in the groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Pay school fees and buy land.

loans.name: Mamadali

texts.en:
Y. Mamadali, 68 years old, is married with three children. Mamadali sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 11 years.

Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan: any hostess will have dried fruits on hand for serving in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, dried fruits are served as a rule during all family occasions, such as wedding parties, birthday parties, and other events.

Considering the constant demand for his goods, Mamadali's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for the family. Now Mamadali wants to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. For this purpose, he requests $800 for the term of 9 months. He is going to use the loan to purchase dried fruits, like raisins and apricots, as well as nuts, like almonds and pistachios, with the purpose of increasing his range of goods for sale.

Mamadali has already demonstrated himself to be a dependable client with positive credit history. He would like to thank all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits and nuts in order to increase his range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz T. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Vino Tinto, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Beatriz es profesora de educación primaria en una unidad educativa de La Paz y su esposo es oficial militar y se encuentra destinado en la actualidad en el extranjero.
El crédito solicitado es para la demolición de una habitación que por su antigüedad se encuentra en peligro de derrumbe, así mismo se construirá una cocina en el mismo lugar ya que su vivienda no cuenta con este ambiente.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz T. lives with her son, in her own home, located in the Vino Tinto neighborhood, in the outskirts of La Paz. She is an elementary school teacher at a school in La Paz and her husband is a military officer currently posted outside the country. The loan she is requesting is to be used to pay for demolition of a room in her house which, due to its age, is in danger of collapse. At the same time, a kitchen will be built on the site of the demolished room since her home currently lacks a kitchen. This is the first time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic study which was done indicates that they qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Demolition of a room and construction of a needed kitchen for her home.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: Mrs. Jacquiline C. has already been a member of Paglaum Co-op for two years. She is a good member and active in all co-op activities. She is 31 years old, married to Ernie, a fisherman. They are blessed with three children. She has requested her third loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase fishing materials and fishing accessories.  Jacquiline helps her husband by selling the fish he catches.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials and accessories

loans.name: António Naftal

texts.pt:
António Naftal M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de Vestuário
Empréstimo: 16,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

António de 27 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até nona classe. Casado maritalmente com três filhos, todos menores.
Nacceu e viveu em Boane até hoje, é comerciante e fotografo de profissão a mais de nove anos.
Actualmente dedica-se a venda de refrigerantes e sua actividade tem mais movimento a partir das 17hrs, altura que maior parte da população trabalhadora regressa para suas casas e nesta altura precisaram de refrescar suas mentes. 
Seu rendimento diário varia entre 2,000.00MT  - 2,500.00MT. vive na casa própria junto com a esposa e três filhos.
Com o empréstimo de 16,000.00MT, pretende reforçar seu stock para responder a demanda.
No futuro sonha ampliar seu negocio  e comprar um meio de transporte para o negocio e passeios com a família.
texts.en:
António, 27 years old, was born in the Boane district, Maputo province. He studied at school until ninth grade. He is married with three children, all minors. A native of and still living in Boane, he has been a merchant and professional photographer for more than nine years. Presently he works selling soft drinks. His peak hours are after 5:00 p.m., when the majority of the working population returns home and they need, at that point, to refresh and clear their minds. His daily income varies between 2,000 MT and 2,500 MT. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. With the loan of 16,000 MT, he plans to build his stock in order to respond to demand. In the future, he dreams of growing his business and buying a mode of transportation for his business and for drives with his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi N. is married to a commercial driver and has three children. She has received no formal education. Since 1999 Esi has sold provisions such as milk, Milo, sugar, soap and rice, at Kormantse, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees. Esi will use her loan to purchase more groceries to fill her grocery store. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to take care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy is an engaging and hard-working married woman with 4 children. She found herself needing to start her own business to support her family and provide them with the basic necessities. Tursunoy sells fabrics used for sewing traditional dresses. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. Now she is thinking about expanding the inventory of the fabrics and in that way, increasing her income. She requires a loan of 775 USD. 

Tursunoy hopes that this will help her increase her sales and allow her to expand her business. She is grateful for your help and your generosity.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Las ganas de progresar de Rosa son una de las prioridades en su familia, por lo cual trabajan cada uno de los miembros por el bienestar de su hogar. Su don es la cocina y también su mejor estrategia de trabajo, ya que en comparación con las diversas vendedoras, busca brindarles a sus clientes platillos de calidad que agraden a su paladar, lo cual hasta la fecha ha resultado. Sin embargo, el móvil de comida donde trabaja se ha ido deteriorando y perjudicando su negocio, ya que es la única forma de trasladarse a las diversas calles de su ciudad, siendo esta, una de las limitaciones que tiene ahora. Su ritmo de trabajo demanda mucho esfuerzo, empieza a las 6 de la tarde hasta la 1 de la madrugada, horario  que es de gran demanda de comida en su localidad. Ahora Rosa espera seguir trabajando, ya que sus anhelos son de conseguir pronto un puesto estable de comida para dejar de salir a las calles y vivir una vida más tranquila. Rosa ya ha trabajado con MFP 30 préstamos, los cuales le permitieron desarrollar su negocio y conformar un buen equipo de trabajo con sus compañeras de grupo, con quienes está muy acostumbrada a trabajar. Con los 2000 soles que viene solicitando reparará su móvil de comida, pues requiere seguir trabajando con normalidad vendiendo sus platillos de comida.
texts.en:
The desire to get ahead is one of the priorities for Rosa’s family. Everyone in her family works in order to support each other’s well-being. Rosa has a talent for cooking and it is also the best way for her to earn a living. Compared to other food vendors, she tries to offer her customers quality dishes that appeal to their tastes. So far, she has been able to meet those expectations. However, the mobile food cart that she uses for her work has been deteriorating and is hindering her business. This is the only way for her to move through the different streets of the city, so this is a major limitation that she faces right now. Her work schedule demands much effort, starting at 6pm and finishing around 1am. During this time, there is a great demand for prepared foods in this location. Rosa hopes to continue working and desires to get a stable job as a cook so that she can quit street vending and live a quiet life.

Rosa has worked with MFP on 30 previous loans. This has helped her develop her business and build a good support team with her fellow communal bank members with whom she is very accustomed to working. She will use her loan of 2000 soles to repair her mobile food cart so that she can work normally and continue selling her prepared dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her mobile food cart

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: mareme D. est parent beneficiaire de la zone de camberene depuis 2003.elle est surtout specialisee dans le commerce de tissus principalement ,de chaussures et d'autres produits divers.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond afin de mieux diversifier les produits qu'elle commercialise.son objectif est de satisfaire sa clientele d'accroitre ses benefices et de mieux participer a soutenir son mari a l'entretien de la famille.
texts.en:
Mareme D. has been a parent beneficiary in the Camberene zone since 2003. She specializes mainly in the sale of cloth, shoes, and various other products. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her funds in order to better diversify the products that she sells. Her goal is to satisfy her customers, increase her profits, and better participate in supporting her husband in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Hae Bofo Group

texts.en: Mary is 55, divorced and has three children. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a trader and the leader of a trust bank group called “Hae Bofo”, which literally means creator of light. The members in this group are mainly engaged in trading activities. They normally sell in their community market and trek to sell in other communities as well. They procure their stocks from Accra and nearby towns. The experience these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their business scope, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Mary, is on the left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is fifty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. Elizabeth trades in utensils. She sells at the local market and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell. Elizabeth buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of utensils in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married with two adult children. He has a retail business selling vegetables and animal food. He has a large storage place next to his home and sells his products right outside his gates. Vitaliy has been in this business for ten years. He has a very good business location—by a busy road—and many repeat clients. Vitaliy uses his truck to buy and transport the produce.

Vitaliy is requesting a loan of 11,124 UAH to buy more produce for sale. It is the high season for sales now, and he wants to take advantage of it to increase his profits. His ultimate goal is to purchase a newer and bigger truck to help him further develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase more produce

loans.name: Shafiqullah

texts.en:
This is Shafiqullah, the 25-year-old son of M.. He lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Despite the fact that he is so young, he has a great deal of responsibility to help care for his family members. He lives with his family, which consists of seven people, including his father and mother. He explains that he is the oldest son in his family.

Shafiqullah owns and operates a general store where he sells a variety of products. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghani ($1,025) to purchase additional, high-quality materials for his shop. In fact, his ultimate goal as it pertains to this loan is to attract more clients and to be able to purchase products which are in high demand. In turn, he hopes to continue to make needed changes to his business. He is confident that he will repay this loan on time, and he expects to apply for a second loan soon after he fully repays this loan in the near future. He would like to extend his deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional, high-quality goods

loans.name: Joyce Angelina

texts.en: Joyce Angelina M. is married to a banker and has three children. She has been through commercial school. Since 1999 Joyce Angelina has been selling second-hand textiles, such as towels, bedspreads and curtains, at Elmina market. She uses her profits to support her husband in paying the utility bills and children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bails of second-hand textiles. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy bails of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells groceries in her retail stall to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to own a super market in the future.  Marian is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries for sale. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Thigingi

texts.en:
Thigingi is married with a six-month-old daughter. For the last five years, he has run a business selling Safaricom mobile phone airtime scratch cards wholesale. He also runs a food kiosk. Thigingi was previously employed as a sales representative for Safaricom. He describes himself as hardworking and industrious. Due to Faulu's training, Thigingi says he has become focused on business and started saving.
Thigingi has requested a loan for 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to purchase scratch cards in values higher than 250 KES each. In the future, he would like to be a registered reseller with Safaricom and expand to branches elsewhere in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime scratch cards for resale

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S., 47, is married and lives with her three children and husband (pictured) in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Since 2001 her husband has operated his motorbike as a taxi, earning an income of 7 USD per day by providing his services at a local market in town.

Len is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. Because her husband’s old motorbike often breaks down and consumes a lot of gasoline, she would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

Len and her family members would like to improve their standard of living and generate more income. With a new motorbike, Len’s husband will be able to attract more customers and so make more money. In the future, Len hopes she will be able to send the children to a good school and become a motorbike dealer herself.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina C. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Magdalina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalina plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $157 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her venture. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sharifkhudja

texts.en:
H. Sharifkhudja is 26 years old. He lives in Isfara town. Sharifkhudja processes and sells dried fruits in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruit. He purchases fruit from local farmers at a wholesale price, and after processing sells it to his customers. 

Because Sharifkhudja buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Sharifkhudja to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for his family. 

Currently, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Sharifkhudja expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for his dried fruit business.

loans.name: Sherlyn Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sherlyn y tiene este nombre porque la hija de la presidenta que tiene un mes de nacida se llama así.  Está ubicado en la comunidad de El Refugio en el estado de Hidalgo de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que realiza un crédito con CrediComún. 

Mercedes M. A. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta el 6to año, es de clase media-baja y tiene en total 2 hijos (mujeres).  Ella se dedica a la venta de recaudería y abarrotes que inició hace 1 año. Se solicita el préstamo para invertir un poco más en abarrotes. Sus clientes piensan que vende la fruta y verdura más fresca de la localidad.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con el gran compromiso para con la empresa de no fallar en sus pagos.   Quiere este crédito para acrecentar su negocio hasta convertirse en una tienda grande.
texts.en:
This group is called SHERLYN, and is named after the president's one-month-old daughter. The group is located in the community of El Refugio (The Refuge) in the state of Hidalgo, Mexico. It is composed of 11 members and this is the 1st time they have requested a loan through CrediComún. Mercedes Martínez A. is the group's president. She is 25 years old, attended school through the 6th grade, is from the lower middle class, and has 2 daughters. For the last year, her store has collected district taxes as well as selling groceries. She requests the loan to invest in some more groceries. Her customers think she sells the freshest fruit and vegetables in the locality. Upon requesting the loan she expressed an obligation to her business not to fail in her payments. She needs the loan to expand her business, which she hopes to make larger.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRUITS, VEGETABLES, AND GROCERIES TO SELL

loans.name: Agnes Habel

texts.en:
Agness is separated from her spouse and is the mothet of two children, Habel and Fumbi. She has been selling charcoal for two years now in Maweni-Malindi and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16,000. She also supplies coconuts in Malindi town.

Agnes was introduced to Kadet by her sister and she joined. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy sacks of charcoal, purchase coconuts in bulk and set up a store. She hopes to start building on her newly-acquired plot with the extra income from this loan.  

Agness is a woman who describes herself as aggressive and determined to achieve her dreams of building a complete residential house on her new plot.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal and coconuts in bulk, and to set up a store

loans.name: Jeremias Valentim

texts.pt:
Jeremias Valentim N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 16, 14, 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca mudou de cidade, apenas saiu de um bairro para outro quando formou a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, conta com 2 empregados que lhe ajudam no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo com o Banco Oportunidade e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2º empréstimo no valor 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos e outros) para reforçar a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na obra de construção da sua residência e aplicar outros no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jeremias Valentim N. was born in the city and province of Maputo, which is in the south of Mozambique. He is 35 years old, and is married with 3 children who are 16, 14, and 10 years old. All of his children attend school. He attended through 9th grade himself, but did not continue due to a lack of finances. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else. He never moved from the city, but he did move from one neighborhood to another when he started his family.

He has had his own business for more than 8 years and he has two employees who help him. He earns a monthly income of about 9,000MT which he uses to pay for his household expenses and saves some to his bank account. He had a previous loan with the Banco Oportunidade, but decided not to continue with them. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, for 20,000MT, and he plans to use it to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, and others) to reinforce his merchandise. The previous loan was for 12,000MT and was used for the same purpose. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to use additional loans for construction in his home and for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products like beer, soft drinks, and others

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in the small city of Raiwind in Pakistan. She has a two-roomed brick house where she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.
Kosar is a very enthusiastic lady. She operates a business embroidering dupattas (a garment worn with traditional dresses in Asian countries). She embroiders them and then sells them at the clothes markets. She does this work to support her husband, M. N. Khan, who works in a dairy business. He gets milk from his dairy cow and sells it to milk shops. He earns approximately 15,000 PKR per month. Kosar is applying for a loan to buy another dairy cow to expand her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Help Your Self Group

texts.en:
Oretha W., 45, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty. She is involved with the sale of charcoal and has been doing this business for the last 21 years. Her business is located in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia. She started this business through the help of a family member. She is married with seven children whose ages range from 12-23 years old and are currently in school. She also helps to take care for two siblings.

The challenge she faces is that there are so many vendors selling charcoal in the market. Oretha plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more charcoal to improve the business. Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Cristo Vive 1,2 Group

texts.en:
R.MariaR. R.isR. R.theR. R.coordinatorR. R.ofR. R.herR. R.groupR. R.CristoR. R.ViveR. (R.ChristR. R.LivesR.), R.andR. R.herR. R.storyR. R.isR. R.representativeR. R.ofR. R.herR. R.groupR. R.andR. R.herR. R.childrenR.. R.SheR. R.wouldR. R.alsoR. R.likeR. R.toR. R.buildR. R.aR. R.bathroomR. R.inR. R.herR. R.homeR.. R.SheR. R.thanksR. R.youR. R.allR. R.forR. R.yourR. R.supportR..

loans.use: to buy women's and men's shoes, skirts, pants and shirts to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Juliette N. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Vélingara dont elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, de sucre cristallisé, de jus de fruits naturels et d'huile de palme. Son crédit lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de se procurer plus de bénéfices afin de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Juliette N. is a 46-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children who are in her care. She is a member of the Banc Villageois for Catholic women in Vélingara, and she has been a member of its management committee for six and a half years. She is developing a small business selling vegetables, crystallised sugar, natural fruit juices and palm oil. Her loan will allow her to get supplies more easily in order to procure a profit for herself and help her husband out with the different family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her income-generating activities

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning T. is an optimistic businesswoman who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. As a busy woman, Luningning is a determined entrepreneur.  With this loan, Luningning will purchase additional fish to sell and other raw materials of her fishing business.  

A model member of ASHI, Luningning has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and timely loan repayments.  As a hard working businesswoman, she is thankful for the opportunity to earn income independently. Her long-term goals are to have a successful fish farm business, to fund the college education of her 5 children, and support her family economically.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial venture.

loans.use: Purchase of additional fish to sell

loans.name: Recardina Nelma

texts.pt:
Recardina Nelma S. vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. Tem um negócio próprio de compra e venda de roupa nova diversa. No empréstimo passado foi possível comprar a mercadoria que esteve previsto, mas não foi suficiente para a quantidade desejada devido a alteração do preço no mercado de aquisição.
Conseguiu pagar a sua letra de acordo com o seu calendário e o seu negócio tem andado bem ultimamente. Com o rendimento do seu negócio conseguiu melhorar as condições de habitação no seio da família.
O presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar mais mercadoria (blusas, saias, calças e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do stock. O empréstimo foi satisfatório, melhorou bastante a sua vida, por isso pretende solicitar mais crédito para comprar um míni bus para transportador público.
texts.en:
Recardina Nelma S. lives in Boane, Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She has her own business buying and selling various new clothing. With her previous loan, it was possible to purchase the merchandise she thought she would need, but it was not enough for the quantity she wanted due to the price changes in the market where she bought it. She managed to pay off her loan in the proper time, and her business has been going well lately. With the income from her business, she has managed to improve the living conditions of her family. With the present loan in the amount of 25,000 MT, she intends to buy more merchandise (blouses, skirts, pants, and other items) to increase the quantity of her stock. The loan was satisfactory, it improved her life a lot, and for this reason she intends to ask for more loans in order to buy a minibus to offer transportation service to the public.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of more merchandise (blouses, skirts, pants, and other items)

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba B. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a reçu 06 fois de suite de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de riz, d'huile végétale, de sucre, de thé etc.. et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'escompter de bénéfices plus intéressant. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diénaba B. is 42. She is married with three children. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007, and has had six loans that she had no problem repaying. She has a small business selling rice, vegetable oil, sugar, tea and so on. Her new loan will allow her to build her inventory so as to make more profit. Her goals are to help improve her family's standard of living and save more.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build working capital

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus U. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Venus is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Venus from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben N. lives in Tsamakasar village near Talin city, Armenia. After serving in the Army, he found himself involved in growing cattle food, which he sells to the neighbors. The income supports him and his parents. The land that he is currently cultivating is being rented. With the help of this loan, Ruben is planning to purchase his own piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase his own piece of land

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 23 años, vive en casa de un familiar con su tía y sus primos. Desde su niñez empezó a labrar la tierra, siendo ésta heredada por sus padres. Actualmente y con la ayuda de su familia, puede cubrir toda la extensión que tiene cultivando papa, de esa manera puede alcanzar sus objetivos de generarse sus propios ingresos, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata la mano de obra para que le faciliten la extracción de sus productos. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en el campo, por ser su única fuente económica, además que esta actividad lo independiza y por tal espera continuar así con la esperanza de intensificarse más. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de sus actividades. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para continuar sembrando papa.
texts.en:
William is 23 and lives in the home of a family member with his aunt and cousins. As a child, he started working the land that he inherited from his parents. Currently, with the help of his family, he is able to cover all of his land with potato crops, thus achieving his goal of generating his own income. However, when it is harvest time he hires labourers to help with the harvesting of his products. He says that he enjoys working in the fields, as this is his only source of income; furthermore, this activity has made him independent, so he hopes to continue farming more intensively. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, and he is grateful to be part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. He thanks those who will lend money toward this loan; it will be very useful in the progress of his activities. With the loan that he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer in order to continue sowing potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer to continue sowing potatoes

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: La señora Llaqui tiene 32 años y vive en la zona M de Huaycan, lleva a año trabajando con Edaprospo y es una de los ocho miembros del grupo “Gotitas de Amor” el cual se conforma por sus amigas y vecinas, unidas con el propósito de alcanzar sus metas en conjunto. Por su parte Laqui lleva tres años vendiendo especerías para sostener su hogar colaborando con su conviviente, espera poder arreglar su casa para vivir con mayor comodidad y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le haga más habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Llaqui is 32 years old and lives in District M of Huaycan. She has worked with EDAPROSPO for the past year and is one of eight members of the group called “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love), which consists of friends and neighbors who are working together to achieve their goals.

Llaqui has been selling spices for three years in order to support her household along with her common-law husband. She hopes to remodel her house so that her family can live more comfortably. For this reason, she needs assistance from EDAPROSPO to make these renovations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra F. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Alejandra is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Alejandra makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes. Alejandra has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This loan will be Alejandra's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which enables its field partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora Hilda este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le agrada el Banco por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera,  tuvo cuatro  hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, su hija vive con ella ya que también es madre soltera y tiene una hija que también vive con ella.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, allí vende de todo ya que también vende artículos de bazar y medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00 que se va a descansar ya que trabaja sola y en lugar hay un poco de inseguridad y prefiere cerrar temprano y así evitar los robos. Sus productos los compra en el centro de la ciudad y algunos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir aun más su tienda y sus sueños son llegar a tener un mini market con todas las comodidades y que haya más seguridad en su sector.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones communal bank meets every 15 days in the El Progreso area of the city of Portoviejo. It is a marginal, crowded urban area in the city known as “the prison sector” because the Portoviejo women’s prison is located in this area.

For Hilda, this is her second loan cycle with the communal bank. She enjoys the bank because of the benefits that the lending institution provides. She is 61 years old and a single mother. She has four children and all of them are now adults. Her daughter lives with her because she is also a single mother and has a daughter that also lives with her.

Hilda has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of things, as well as market goods and medicines. She works every day from 6am to 7pm, at which time she goes to rest because she works alone and it is a bit unsafe, so she closes early to avoid robbery. She buys her products in the city center and receives some at her store.

This loan is to further stock her store. Her dreams are to have a mini market with all types of commodities and for there to be more security in her area.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, medicines and market items.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 59 años, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos y nietos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos y cuyes que cría en su granja. Cada 15 días los vende en la feria ganadera de su zona, asimismo los vende  a los restaurante y algunos clientes que acuden a su misma casas para comprar dichos animales. Le agrada criar animales y dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que le permite ser independiente y mejorar sus ingresos. Adicionalmente a esto también arrienda cuartos  que es una entrada mas que favorece su economía por lo que  desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar y ampliar la infraestructura de su casa  en donde  tendrá más espacio para su granja de animales.
texts.en:
Cristina is 59 years old.  She lives with her partner and their 4 children and grandchildren in her own home.  She has been raising and selling small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs for 10 years.  She raises the animals on her farm.  Every couple of weeks she sells them in her area's livestock market.  She also sells them to restaurants and some customers who come to her house to buy them.  She likes to raise animals and do this work since it allows her to be independent and improve her income.  In addition to this, she rents out rooms which also helps her financial situation.  For this reason, she would like to improve her house's infrastructure.

This is the first loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all of its members are people who she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of building materials to improve and expand the infrastructure of her house in which she will have more space for her farm of animals.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve her house's infrastructure and expand her farm

loans.name: Angel Remigio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Josue Omar; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de policía, el trabaja particularmente porque es cesante de la policía nacional del Peru, el socio quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Josue is 58 years old, is married and has four children.  He is a police officer who works for private entities because he is a former member of the Peruvian National Police.  He wants to open a grocery store and is asking for this loan in order to make some improvements to his home.

He appreciates those who help him achieve this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old. He runs a bodaboda (motor cycle transport) business in Nairobi. This business is two years old and he employs one person. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to repair his motorcycles. He was previously operating a transport business with a bicycle. 

He is married and hopes to have a matatu (a van for transporting people) in the future. In five years time, James hopes to divest into real estate. Through Faulu Kenya loans, James has acquired a motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair motorcycles

loans.name: John Mwangi

texts.en:
John is 42 years old married to Miriam Wanjiku, who contributes to the family income. They have five children. He has a cyber café that has been in operation for about two years and earns an income of Kshs. 13,000 per month.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to buy computer hardware and accessories. He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming and poultry farming to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy computer hardware and accessories

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Francisca is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Francisca is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a direct selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products such as talc powder, lotions and make-up kits in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida P. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Leonida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Punta. She is 45 years old and married with two school-aged children. Lilia has a store selling cosmetics. She also has a snack and peanut-butter vending business. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.
In 2008, Lilia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for her peanut butter and snack-vending business. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food-vending business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business and a fish vending business.  She lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Maura is borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase fishing gears and equipment. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maura aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo De Jesús se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, pues ha sido una persona muy responsable. El inicio este medio de vida para sobrevivir con su esposa e hijos. Guillermo tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo, el es un padre que busca la forma de enseñarles a sus hijos como ganarse la vida de una manera humilde. Este crédito es para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, detergentes entre otros productos que sus clientes llegan a solicitarle.
texts.en:
Guillermo De Jesús has a store that he has managed for more than five years. He is a very responsible person. Guillermo started to earn a living in this manner in order to support his wife and two dependent children. He is a father who teaches his children how to live in a humble manner.

This loan will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, and other products that his customers request.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, and other products

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head-on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Mercy J., twenty eight, does just like that. Mercy is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT*. She is married to a driver, Romy, and mothers her only child, who is now in high school.

Mercy runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in an extension of their house. Everyday, she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of items they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they deserve. Monthly, Mercy earns PHP14,560, on average.

She has applied for a loan worth PHP12,000 to help for the growth of her business. She intends to meet the demands of her customers. As needed, she will buy more stock of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items. 

Mercy acknowledges that no challenge is too hard to meet. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store to grow. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store, like sacks of rice and  grocery items.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda Isabel su negocio es un cafetín. Tiene 7 años en este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, ya que se siente muy agradecida pues es así que su negocio ha progresado. Inicio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso es así que obtiene este trabajo diariamente por lo que le gusta mucho el hablar con sus clientes pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con pagos. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de sopas, pan, galletas, refrescos, golosinas, café, sándwich, hamburguesa, hot dog entre otros productos.  Sueña con su hijo logre finalizar sus estudios, para sentirse orgullosa.
texts.en:
Yolanda has run a small café for 7 years. This is not the first time that she requests a loan. She is very grateful for prior loans, which have helped her business grow. Yolanda’s business began out of her need to earn an income. What she really enjoys about her daily job is talking with her customers. 

Yolanda has proven to be very responsible with payments. The purpose of this loan is to purchase soup, bread, cookies, drinks, candies, coffee, sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs and other products. She dreams that her son will finish his studies, making her very proud.

loans.use: To buy food for cafe

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Mi nombre es Mercedes, yo tengo una pequeña tienda en la localidad de san Francisco tlalchichilpa, vendo refrescos, jugos, papas, y dulces. Las dificultades que tengo en mi negocio es que no tengo para poder estar invirtiendo en mas productos y poder mejorar por eso solicite el prestamo para que me ayude a tener mi negocio mas grande con mas producte y con mejores ganancias para que gane mas dinero, mis metas son que poco a poco pueda ir creciendo y tenga la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio y tambien de poner otro local con cremeria y mejorar mucho, no darme por vencida para que mis sueños se puedan cumplir, tengo una niña que va a la escuela, tengo 44 años y de casada 27 años, la cosa donde vivimos es propia y me esposo trabaja en el campo.
texts.en:
My name is Mercedes and I have a small shop in the town of San Francisco Tlalchichilpa.  I sell soft drinks, juices, potatoes, and sweets.  The difficulty I have in my business is that I have to invest in more products to improve it.  This loan request will help me to attain a larger business with more products, which will earn better profits.  My goals are to gradually grow and have the opportunity to expand the business and also to install another location with dairy products.  I can not give up because I have dreams to fulfill.  

I am 44 years old and have been married for 27 years.  I have a child who goes to school.  We live in our own house and my husband works in the fields.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, bread, and snacks.

loans.name: G.s. Jerusalen Ii Del El Viejo Group

texts.es: Jerusalén II Del El Viejo lo conforman Jasmira Del Carmen, Luz Amanda y Sady Del Socorro. Luz Amanda se dedica a una pulpería, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar sus diferentes productos. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes, ella y sus amigas decidieron realizar este financiamiento para poder mejorar los ingresos de sus negocios. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, grano básicos entre otros productos.
texts.en: The group, “Jerusalén II Del El Viejo” is made up of Jasmira Del Carmen, Luz Amanda, and Sady Del Socorro.  Luz Amanda has a general store where her customers go to buy different products.  She’s a very enterprising woman who enjoys interacting with her customers. She and her friends decided to request this loan in order to be able to increase their earnings.  This loan will be used to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and basic grains among other things.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Eleseo

texts.en:
Eleseo is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 40 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Eleseo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector buying & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling breads, biscuits & pastries in the local community. Eleseo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eleseo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleseo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, sugar & eggs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eleseo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, sugar & eggs

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the third is not yet old enough to go. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past two years, she has made a living by selling water door to door from her hand cart. Her customers are water vendors in her area. Mwanaharusi's biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of her business, because during the rainy season few people need to buy water. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying water wholesale. She has applied for a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy another hand cart for her water-selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase another hand cart for her water-selling business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a soft drinks selling business, selling by retail and from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers needs in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of soft drinks and mineral water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of soft drinks and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines está conformado por tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Ines quien desde hace 5 años vende perfumes de todo tipo y marca de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.
