El credito lo requiere para comprar mercaderia y cumplir con los encargo que tiene. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Jenny Vanessa propietaria de una pequeña tienda de ropa y Kenia Valesca quien comercializa productos variados desde ropa, accesorios, cosmeticos...etc.
texts.en:
The group "Lose Bailarines" is made up of 3 hard-working and entrepreneurial members. The group coordinator, Maria Ines, has been selling all types and brands of perfume at the request of her customers for 5 years now. She needs the loan to buy merchandise and complete the orders that she has.

The other members of the group are Jenny Vanessa, owner of a small clothing store, and Kenia Valesca, who sells varied products likes clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita has two children, one of which is in school.

Teresita has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell. Teresita has been in this business for four years. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ysabel; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa y carteras, ella vende en forma independiente y junto con su hija realizan este negocio, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como instituciones o al publico al general, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y carteras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, chompas, carteras y casacas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ysabel, 57, is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling clothes and purses.  She sells independently with help from her daughter.  She takes her wares to various institutions or to the general public.  She is able to support her children through this small business.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy polo shirts, sweaters, purses and jackets at wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Habibatou

texts.fr: Madame Habibatou  est une femme mariée de 36 ans. Ella 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 14 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 2000 et gère une cantine dans un marché de la place. C’est dans le souci de lutter contre l’oisiveté   qu’elle a choisi cette activité. Aussi c’est une activité qu’elle aime beaucoup. Les périodes les plus favorables  pour  son activité sont les veilles de fêtes de tabaski et de korité. Elle est sociétaire de L'U-IMCEC depuis aout 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans l’intention de renforcer son fond de roulement ce qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux rentabiliser sa cantine. Plus précisément le prêt sera destiné a l’achat de tissus et d’habits prêts  a porter dans le but de pouvoir répondre  a la forte demande de veille de fête de korité. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité, augmenter ses bénéfices   pour satisfaire elle-même ses besoins personnels et éviter la dépendance vis-à-vis de son mari.
texts.en:
Madame Habibatou  is a married woman of 36. She has four children whose ages vary between seven and 14. She has been in business since 2000 and manages a shop in a local marketplace. She does this so as not to remain idle. Also, it is an activity she likes a lot. 

The most favorable period for her business is the days just before the (Muslim) feast days of Tabaski and Korité. She has been a member of the branch at Yoff since August 2010. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to bolster her working capital which will allow her to buy merchandise so as to make her little shop profitable. 

More precisely, the loan will be used to buy cloth and ready-to-wear clothing so that she can be ready for the unusually great demand just before the Korité feast day. This loan will allow her to better develop her business and increase her profits so that she can be responsible for her own expenses and not be dependent on her husband. .

loans.use: to buy cloth and ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es: La Sra. Ana es casada, tiene un hijo de un año de edad; ella trabaja en su propio negocio de venta de comida, gana aproximadamente S/. 300 nuevos soles semanal,  trabaja todos los días y comparte su tiempo con el negocio y el cuidado de su hijo. El crédito lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su negocio ya sea en la compra de sillas y utensilios de cocina, su principal desafío es el estar pendiente del cuidado de su hijo y cocinar; su sueño es poder tener su propio restaurante y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is married, with a one-year old child.  She works in her own business selling meals.  She earns approximately 300 New Soles weekly.  She works everyday and divides her time between her business and caring for her child.

She will invest the loan in improving her business by buying chairs and cooking utensils.  Her main challenge is being responsible for the care of her child and for cooking.  Her dream is to be able to have her own restaurant, and so provide a better quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying chairs and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira, vive junto a su familia que está conformada por su esposo, dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 12 años, ambos estudian, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, pero además elabora hamacas, cortinas, matatas, su esposo le apoya mucho y su horario es de 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente ella quiere invertir un préstamo en materiales como hilo de seda de diferentes colores. Con esta ayuda estará contando con mercadería para confeccionar las hamacas y ofrecer  a los clientes.
Las aspiraciones de Yanira es que por medio de su trabajo apoyar a sus hijos, en sus estudios, que estos puedan culminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Yanira lives together with her family that is made up of her husband and two children aged 8 and 12 who both are in school. She sells fruits and vegetables, but in addition she makes hammocks, curtains, and tote bags. Her husband helps her a lot and her workday is from 8:00am until 5:00pm. 

Currently she wants to invest the loan in materials like silk thread in different colors. With this help she will have merchandise to make and offer hammocks to her customers. 

Yanira's dreams are to help her children in their studies by way of her work so that they may have a career. ,

loans.use: to buy silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi has displayed a few plantains as her stock was yet to arrive. She sells plantain and cassava, which she has done for about five years now. She is a widow taking care of five children. Having to provide for the daily needs of these children has not been easy. She needs a loan to purchase bags of plantain and cassava to sell to be able to take proper care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of plantain and cassava to sell

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Аскару 57 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей.  Аскар долгое время работал учителем в школе и известен как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек.  Большой опыт и преданность своему делу позволили Аскару стать директором средней школы села Ой-Булак .   В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1991 году Аскар начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Стартовав с 18,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса Аскар вложил в оплату за образование своих детей.   Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства,  Аскар обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Аскар планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и ремонта хозпостроек.
texts.en: Askar is 57 years old, married and has three children. Askar has worked as a school teacher for a long time and is known as an honest and kindhearted man. His experience and dedication has allowed Askar to become the director of the Oi-Bulak school. To supplement his family income Askar has also started a livestock raising and feeding business in 1991. He started his business with 18,000 som (KGS) and currently his business is making a profit of 15,000 som (KGS monthly. His business' profit Askar has allocated towards improving his children's education. To further improve and expand his livestock business, Aksar has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) which he will use to buy more cattle. Askar is planning to use the profit from the loan to further expand his herd and repair the barns.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married and has 4 children. She has received a junior high education. Comfort cooks wakye (beans and rice) at Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase beans and rice to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Glenrose

texts.en:
Glenrose is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Glenrose has a sari-sari (general) store and has had this business for six years. She earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

Glenrose is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock for her store.  She has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 39 years old, and married with 3 children. For the last 20 years, she has been earning her living as a farmer. She also plants cassava for additional income. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to cultivate her rice paddy and plant cassava. With this loan she hopes to increase her crop yield which enables her to earn more income to feed her family, and have some savings for the future.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice paddy and plant cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and three siblings. Despite his young age, he has been running his own business since 2009. He sells agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, from his shop. Today, he is asking to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional pesticides and fertilizers to sell. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop by adding more agricultural supplies to sell, such as plastic tents.

loans.use: to purchase additional pesticides and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children. Loreta has a shop that sells snacks, like rice cakes & banana cue. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.  Loreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old and is a married woman with nine children. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 21 years old. Divina has been selling fish for five years. She also sells seashells and dried sea cucumbers. Divina does her best to support her family. She says that she and her husband really work hard to send all their children to school.

Divina has requested a loan to buy more fish, shells and sea cucumbers to sell. She hopes to have a stable business that will help sustain her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shells and sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Saney

texts.ru: Саней 50 лет, вдова, воспитала шестерых детей. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Саней начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 5 голов коров, позволяющее зарабатывать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также она возделывает 3,5 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саней обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, Саней хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Saney is 50 years old, a widow, who raised six children.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, she started her own animal husbandry and farming business five years ago, with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, her farm has five heads of cattle, allowing her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of milk and dairy products.  Saney also works on 3.5 hectares of arable land, where she grows beans.  In order to further develop her business, Saney requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  In the future, Saney wants to grow her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells second-hand clothing in Efutu. She is married to a police officer and has five children. Araba has been selling second-hand clothing for the past seven years now. She assists her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for sale.  With her new profits, Araba will acquire a shop to sell the clothing.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 44-year old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 9 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a retail shop where she sells food products such as wheat flour, sugar, rice, salt, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat. Monica's business goal is to be a wholesaler in her town area within five years.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married with six children and has a bakery shop business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melinda has been in this business for 29 years now, and also earns additional income from water refilling station.

In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi  would like to buy chickens

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Antie Doris sells charcoal to her customers in her community. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has benefited from the organizations product for several loan terms. She needs a loan of $800.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old and has been separated from her husband for three years. Her husband abandoned her and hasn't been heard from since, leaving her to provide for their three children. She sells popular regional dishes (dough filled with beef or chicken) door to door in her neighborhood at night. Dolores is part of a collective with Leonor Gomes, who makes tamales and also sells them door to door. They are requesting the loan together so they can purchase cooking utensils and ingredients that will allow them to make their products in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

DOLORES TIENE 42 AÑOS SEPARADA DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS CUANDO SU MARIDO LA ABANDONO Y NUNCA VOLVIO A SABER DE EL, TIENE 3 HIJOS, ELLA VENDE ANTOJITOS QUE SON PRODUCTOS TIPICOS DE LA ZONA QUE CONSISTEN EN MASAS RELLENAS DE CARNE O POLLO Y TAMBIEN MASAS DORADAS EN ACEITE A LAS QUE SE LES COLOCA ENCIMA FRIJOL EN LAS NOCHES LAS SALE A VENDER PUERTA A PUERTA EN EL SECTORE DONDE ELLA VIVE . PERTENECE AL GRUPO BUENAVISTA 3 , JUNTO CON DOÑA LEONOR G. G. QUIEN HACE TAMALES (HOJAS DE MAIZ RELLENAS CON CARNE , VERDURAS O POLLO ) Y LAS VENDE EN LA SEMANA PUERTA A PUERTA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO QUIEREN AMBAS COMPRAR MAS UTENSILIOS DE COCINA PARA PREPARAR MAS CANTIDAD DE SUS PRODUCTOS Y PODER ADEMAS ABASTECERSE DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE LOS ANTOJITOS Y TAMALES

loans.use: Purchase cooking untensils and ingredients

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
“My husband drives a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) and my two boys work at a printing press where they bind books. Due to financial constraints, we were unable to send the boys to school and it seems like my two daughters will also be deprived of this right.

A loan will enable my husband to expand his transport business. With his business doing better, perhaps my children will be able to attend school and my boys could one day read the books they have been binding for so many years.”

Nazia B., Pakistan

loans.use: For the maintenance of a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is a 38 year old, single woman. She has four children of her own and takes care of two others from her immediate family.

She has a small store that is reachable by a path in the Rubaga District of Kampala. Rubaga is made up of a maze of paths so one could easily get lost there. Her store is only about 12 feet wide and four to five feet deep.

When you arrive at her store, there is a bench outside to rest and visit. A small plank of wood leans precariously and on it are a few small tomatoes and onions. You don’t really “enter” the store, but instead, you sort of step up and face it. In front of the store are wall-to-wall bars of welded rebar with a rebar door you can duck under. This is constructed so that when she leaves, she can “lock up”. Very neatly arranged on the back wall are domestic items such as toothpaste, sodas, sugar, muffins in bags, etc. There is a small cooler for soft drinks and soap comes in long bars which she cuts to the requested size.

Rose has operated at this location for seven years and she has been a client of the Rubaga Women’s Lending Group for one and half years. She carries herself with respect and authority. You can tell she is an important member of her community. With her loan,she hopes to hire someone to operate this shop and to open another shop of the same nature.

(If you would like to learn more, please check out the Fellows Blog: The Women of Rubaga)

loans.use: To hire someone for her store and open another store

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the district of La Peca, in the province of Bagua in Amazonas. She works selling every day grocery items and fresh vegetables. She began her business to increase her income so that she would not be financially dependent on her husband. Her business is growing faster every day, enabling her to cover her needs and those of her family, while still continuing to invest in the business. Her goal is to continue to grow the business, expanding and opening another location and becoming a serious business woman. The loan will be paid back in 6 months, and will be used to by rice, sugar, oil and other items. She serves customers who live in Bagua and the surrounding areas.

La señora Herminia tiene 32 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, en el Departamento de Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Corazón de Jesús. Se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes y verduras. Inició su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y también para no depender económicamente del esposo. Su negocio esta creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades y de las de su familia, además seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliar y abrir otro local en la parada (ubicada en la misma localidad) y de esa manera convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Su reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($ 266.00 aprox.), que será cancelado en 6 meses, le servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite, entre otros. Atiende al público en general que residen en Bagua y alrededores.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of bananas to open a new location

loans.name: Nabaziza A (I) Group

texts.en:
Ths group has been together or one year. Kevin and Ponsiano both have poultry businesses. Christine has a bar business. Victoria sells charcoal for a living. With the extra business profits, Kevin intends to construct another poultry house and also buy more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in poultry business

loans.name: Makete B Group

texts.en:
Kezia Fungo, age 25, owns a salon business which she started 7 years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm daily, and is able to make a monthly profit of about $779.

In the past, Kezia has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy equipment for the salon. She hopes for a new loan for further business expansion. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of groceries, clothes and poultry, and a restaurant.

In the picture Kezia is in the middle.

loans.use: For further business expansion

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.ru:
Gulinor M. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. Her business is agriculture. She rents a piece of land on which she grows wheat and potatoes. When the crop is ready, she keeps a small portion of it for her own family and sells the rest. She has been in this business for about 5 years now. Right now is the perfect time to plant. Gulinor needs money to purchase potato seeds, wheat seeds and fertilizer. The loan will allow her to purchase high quality seeds, which in turn will yield a high quality crop. This will attract additional customers and help sell the entirety of the crop. Gulinor plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мисонова Гулинор проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года . Замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием., который засеивает картофелем и пшеницей. Она берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. После того как получает урожай , часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Занимается этим видрм деятельности клиентка уже около5 лет.Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому она запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Señora Ana María P. Pérez is 45 years old and has three years of secondary education. She has five children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She lives in the district of Salaverry, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru.

Señora Ana sells food from her kiosk to people in her neighbourhood and to passers-by. She also sells cakes and pastries. In the past she delivered food and provided board and lodging to workers from various factories. For the last 15 years she has been working in her current business and tells us that before becoming a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción”, she was selling such small quantities that she didn’t have much capital. Now she feels happier because the profits she has earned have allowed her to expand and improve the business. In the afternoons she sells fuel from her house—oil, kerosene, alcohol, and other types.

From the Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” she obtained her previous loan with which she bought tables and chairs in order to provide better service and more comfort to her clients. With the S/.1300 loan, which she will pay back in six months, she will buy ten containers of kerosene and oil. Señora Ana’s dream is to own a large restaurant in the centre of Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria; tiene 5 hijos y 1 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Ana se dedica a la venta de comida en su kiosco a personas de su barrio y a todos los transeúntes, pero además vende pasteles y postres, anteriormente repartía comida y daba pensión a algunos trabajadores de diferentes fabricas ya hace 15 años que se dedica a este negocio nos cuenta que antes de ser socia del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” vendía en menor cantidad ya que no tenía mucho capital, ahora se siente muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han permitido crecer y mejorar su negocio. Por las tardes vende combustible en su casa como: petróleo, kerosene, alcohol y otros.

En su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” obtuvo su anterior préstamo con el que compró mesas y sillas para brindar mejor servicio y comodidad a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/.1300 que cancelará en seis meses comprará:diez baldes de kerosene y petróleo. La señora Ana sueña con tener un restaurante grande en el centro de Salaverry.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more kerosene and oil

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a single woman who is dedicated to selling suitcases, backpacks, and novelty items. She began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity so she could support herself. She began it 10 years ago when she was laid off from the factory she was working in. She used her severance to start this business. Due to her efforts, the business prospered and subsequently she found a space where she formally established her store.

Hilda needs a loan of US $600, which she will repay in 6 months, so she can remodel her shop. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda es soltera, se dedica a la venta de maletas, mochilas y novedades. Inicio este negocio porque no tenia empleo y necesitaba una actividad para mantenerse. Empezo hace 10 años, cuando la liquidaron en la maquiladora que trabajaba y la liquidacion la invirtio para comenzar su propio negocio. En base a asu esfuerzo a propserado y posteriormente rento su local donde se establecio formalmente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Remodel her store.

loans.name: Nengah Rai Magdalena

texts.id:
Nengah Rai Magdalena sells ice cubes to cover her three children's life expenses. Her husband is a driver for a night bus (Denpasar - Jakarta). He rarely stays at home. Rai Magdalena doesn't just sit at home waiting for her husband to come home and give her allowance. Rai Magdalena is running a small business which is selling ice cube. With this business, she can cover her and her children's daily expenses in addition to her husband's income. Since her refrigerator was old and needed to be replaced, Rai Magdalena applied for a loan from Dinari. She used the loan to buy a new refrigerator so she can meet the demands of her customers. Every morning and evening, Rai Magdalena makes the ice cubes. She cooks the water until boiled. After it cools down, she pours them into plastics and put them in the refrigerator. The next day or in the evening, she takes out the ice cubes and delivers them to her customers' kiosks. She gains a net profit of Rp 10,000 to Rp 15,000 and she uses it to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Untuk mencukupi keperluan ke tiga anaknya Nengah Rai Magdalena harus berjualan Es Batu.Suaminya adalah seorang sopir bus Malam Jurusan Denpasar- Jakarta, yang kesehariannya jarang sekali dirumah.Rai Magdalena tidak tinggal diam dirumah sambil menanti suami pulang dengan harapan membawa uang sepulang bekerja.RaiMagdalena mempunyai usaha kecil-kecilan yaitu berjualan Es Batu. Dengan usaha inilah Rai Magdalena dapat mencukup keperluan belanja harian bersama ketiga anaknya selain dari penghasilan suaminya. Karena lemari es yang sudah tua dan perlu diganti, Maka Rai Magdalena mengajukan pinjaman dana pada Dinari. Denga dana itulah dipakai untuk membeli sebuah lemari es yang baru agar dapat menuhi kebutuhan pelanggannya. Setiap pagi dan sore Rai Magdalena mebuat es, caranya terlebih dulu dengan merebus air hingga matang. Setelah dingin mulailah air tesebut dimasukan kedalam plastik dan dimasukan kedalam lemari es. Esok hari atau sore hari barulah mengambil es yang sudah jadi untuk dipasarkan ke warung-warung langganannya. Dengan penghasilan bersih sebesar Rp.10.000,- s/d 15.000,- dapat diterimanya yang dapat dipergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya bersama ketiga anaknya.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 32 and married. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past seven years. Rachel is a very skilled and talented hairdresser who adds beauty and style to the hair of her customers. She believes in the efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to provide quality service to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings and include the sale of cosmetics. She is a member of the community group called “Nyame ye odo” (God is love) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a social collateral to access loans and help each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Salma's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old, married, and has 1 child, age 2. She has owned her own clothing business since 2006. Every day, she works from 10AM to 8PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $65 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothing items to expand her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothing, cosmetics goods, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Soueng

texts.en:
Soueng S., 29, of Kampong Cham, Cambodia, has a business selling rice and coffee outside of her home, yielding her about $3.50 in profits per day. She is assisted by her husband in this enterprise. The couple has four children, one of whom is a student. 

Soueng is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her business through the purchase of more chairs and tables. Despite the problems posed by the high cost of commodities, she plans to build a bigger stand and increase the amount of rice and coffee offered for sale

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to expand her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 38 años de edad, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo. Anteriormente trabajaba en una compañía de su zona, pero perdió ese trabajo, con lo ahorrado, se compró un motocarro, herramienta de trabajo que le es de mucha utilidad. Él es padre de 4 hijos, los mismos que estudian y son su inspiración de seguir adelante, su esposa Orfelina lo apoya mucho, pues gracias a los ingresos que le brinda el transporte, ella vende por las noches comida.   El deseo de  José es tener en buenas condiciones su motocarro, sin embargo, necesita de una cantidad de dinero para comprar repuestos y mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo. Apoyemos a este padre trabajador y luchador.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and has been dedicated to transporting passengers for a long time. Previously, he worked for a company in his region, but he lost that job. With the money saved, he bought a motocart, a piece of work equipment that is very useful to him. He is a father of four children who study and they are his inspiration to move forward. His wife, Orfelina, supports him a lot. His transportation business offers them a good income and she sells food at night. José's desire is to have his motocart in good condition; he needs a quantity of money to buy spare parts and send it in for repair. Let's support this hardworking and fighting father.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and send his motocart in for repair.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. Diana M. is a married woman who is 27 years old. Since 2006 she has owned a photo studio. She takes picture at different functions and of individual people. She is assisted in her business by her husband and one employee.

Currently Diana is able to make a make a monthly profit of 300 USD. She is requesting a loan of 825 USD in order to purchase additional cameras and other equipment so that she can open the same business in another place. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cameras and other equipment

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #6 Group

texts.en: Miguelina S. has a small business selling clothing. She is hoping to receive her third loan and continue growing her business. She came to Esperanza International about a year ago hoping for some help out of her situation. She is a single mother who was living in extreme poverty. Before she started her small business she had no form of income and was barely able to feed her child. She felt alone, as if she had no purpose. Once she started her business selling clothes she was able to provide for her child, and for the first time felt like she had a purpose each morning. She has been growing the business since that first loan and has plans for further expansion. She dreams of being able to send her child to a university someday. She now feels like she is going to reach that dream someday, and is ready to work to get there!

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one people from the village of Kandal Kraom in Kandal Province formed a group to apply for a village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chantha T. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. However, she does not have enough rice seeds to grow on her land. So she decided to request a loan for this purpose, and will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. PH. Phally, sells icecream in the local village. Mrs. Chantha T. is 42 years old and the mother of four childR., one of whom helps with the father's business while another is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael L. sells pepper soup and drinks. The demands for her pepper soup and drinks are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. To do so, she needs a loan of 100,000 naira (USD$675) to purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients.

Rachael is 46 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is an undergraduate at the university of Ibadan.

In the photo, you can see Rachael standing with her husband. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and soup ingredients.

loans.name: Faiziddin

texts.ru: Шарипов Файзиддин житель города Вахдат. Возраст 26 лет, холост. Имеет высшее образование. Но по профессии не работает. Занимается бизнесом. Имеет продуктовый магазин . Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.  У Файзиддина большой ассортимент товара, но тем не менее он хочет увеличить товарооборот , чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Faiziddin S. lives in Vahdat. He is 26 years old and is a bachelor. He has a college education, but does not work in his profession. He works in business and owns a food store. He has been in this business for 10 years now. Faiziddin plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He will be able to pay back the loan over 18 months. Faiziddin has a large product assortment, nonetheless he would like to increase his inventory in order to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie N., who is 23 years old and single, is a meat processor who makes longaniza in her community. Longaniza is a Filipino food delicacy made of ground pork meat mixed with ingredients and rolled with dried and emptied pig intestine. She learned this skill from her fiancee's father. They agreed to start this business as an income-generating project. She is hoping to display these foods by constructing a food stall for the walk-in customers at their place. HSPFI assisted her with a loan of PHP 5,000 and she hopes this will continue for future expansion of the project.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for meat processing (longaniza)

loans.name: Marina,

texts.es:
Hace un año que Marina se dedica a la venta de ropa bajo pedido, tanto de segunda mano como de primera. Anteriormente a este trabajo ella era obrera en una fábrica de frascos matizados. Estuvo ocho años aquí hasta que decidió retirarse pues el trabajo era muy pesado, trabajaba doce horas al día, la empresa no cubría seguros de vida y no tenia quien cuide de sus hijos.

Por este motivo pensó en que independizarse y trabajar por su cuenta seria mejor. Previo a su trabajo en aquella fábrica ella le dedico veinte años de su vida a su trabajo como conserje en los laboratorios Farmalab. Trabajo que abandonó luego de que la empresa quebrara. 

Ahora, a pesar de las dificultades de la fábrica de frascos, trabaja eventualmente aquí, cuando los ingresos por su negocio de ropa no le son suficientes. 

Marina tiene siete hijos, de los cuales cinco ya son independientes. Solo esta su cargo sus hijos de quince y de diez años.
texts.en:
For one year Marina hs been dedicated to selling cheap clothing, both second hand and new. Before this work she was a worker in a bottle factory. She was there eight yeers until she decided to retire because the work was very heavy, she worked twelve hours a day, the wage didn't cover her living expenses, and she didn't have anyone to take care of her children. For these reasons she thought about becoming independent and working for herself would be better. Before her job in that factory she had dedicated twenty years of her life to her job as a caretaker in the Farmalab laboratories, a job which she left after the factory closed. Now, despite the difficulties of the bottle factories, she still works there when the income from her clothing business is not enough for her. Marina has seven children, of whom five are already independent. She is only responsible for her five year old and ten year old children.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes

loans.name: Lawrenta

texts.en: Lawrenta J. sells kerosene by the gallon. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is thirty-two years old and has five children. She wants a loan of $350 to purchase more gallons of kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is the owner of a business where she makes and sells a variety of textile products and also a group coordinator for the bank called "Jesus Nuestra Esperanza."  With this loan, her second through Esperanza, Maria plans on buying more supplies and items to use in her business.  Maria and her partner Pedro G. are the parents of four children, ranging in age from 5 to 12.  One of Esperanza’s goals in all of our work is to free children out of poverty, and we believe that providing loans to women with children is a way to achieve that.

Maria said that her first loan really helped her business and family which is why she decided to take out another.  She dreams for her business to grow bigger each day and also hopes for God to continue to protect her children.  When they are older, Maria would like them to be smart people.  

In the little free time she has apart from her business and kids, Maria enjoys reading the Bible.  Pictured are these five members of "Jesus Nuestra Esperanza" along with their loan officer and two other members of Jesus Nuestra Esperanza.

On behalf of Maria B., Jesus Nuestra Esperanza, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and support in fighting the global issue of poverty!


Note -  As there are eight people in this picture, we wanted to specify who the additional individuals are: The gentleman on the far right is the group's loan officer. In the back row, the first and third people from the left are members of another Esperanza International sub-group, but are not borrowers of this loan.  Thank you!

loans.use: replenishing supplies for textile business

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Anunciacion T., 64 years of age, is married with four children, all of whom now live with their own families. The main source of her family income comes from the carpentry wages earned by her husband.

Anunciacion sells snacks and engages in backyard gardening on her own to earn additional income. She became a member of Paglaum three years ago and has been able to maintain a good credit record.

She has now requested another loan in the amount of Php 6,000, which is intended as additional capital for her snack vending activities as well as to help finance the expansion of the vegetable garden in her back yard.

loans.use: To finance her snack-vending and gardening activities

loans.name: Eusébio Gilberto

texts.pt:
Eusébio Gilberto M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Eusébio nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, estudou até decima primeira classe. Casado e tem seis filhos todos maiores de idade, cinco dos quais ainda vão a escola.
Viveu em Manjacaze e aos dezassete anos foi para cidade de Maputo para continuar com estudos onde veio a casar em 1980.
É técnico de saúde de profissão e reformado na mesma área. Depois da reforma optou por aprender negocio de modo a aumentar a renda familiar e ocupar a tempo inteiro.
A sua renda mensal incluindo a pensão de reforma é 5,000.00MT.
Este é o quinto empréstimo com a Hluvuku e com este valor tenciona melhorar a residência familiar. 
Seu grande sonho é ter sua habitação concluída e equipada.
texts.en:
Eusébio was born in the Manjacaze district, Gaza province. He studied at school until grade 11. He is married with six children, all of whom have reached the age of majority, and five of whom are still in school. He lived in Manjacaze, and when he was seventeen years old, he went to the city of Maputo to continue his studies. He married there in 1980. By profession, he is a health technician, and when he retired he was still in this profession. After retiring , he chose to learn business as a way to augment his family income, and so he would be occupied full time. His monthly income including his retirement pension is 5,000 MT. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, and with this sum he intends to improve his family home. His big dream is to have his home finished and furnished.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing film and wood for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is one of FATEN's oldest clients; she has received more than 8 loans from FATEN. She raises goats and sheep in addition to raising bees. Since she joined FATEN, her business has expanded from 3 hives to more than 25 and from 2 sheep to 13. 

Her business is the only source of income for the family; she works together with her husband on it.

She appears in the picture at her farm with her sheep.

loans.use: Purchase sheep and bee hives

location.town: Taqou' Village, Bethlehem City, West Bank

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Mr. V. Chean, age 30, has been a fisherman for three years. In addition, he works in house construction. His wife sells the fish that he catches in the local market. Some of his fishing materials have broken down, disrupting his business. So he is applying for his first loan of $500 to purchase fishing nets and a boat for his business.

V. and his wife, Mrs. Hoy Hamm, age 24, live along National Road No. 6, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2002 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Besides their children, they also have his mother living with them.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and a boat

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a member of the utulivu borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 10 years.she also cares for other 6 dependents.

Aziza started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Aziza`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Aziza hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Serious Business People Group

texts.en:
Serious Business People is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Famata A., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Famata is 43, married and has 3 children, from newborn to  3.  Famata was unable to attend school although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Famata’s business is retail dry goods, including biscuits, salt, maggi cubes (soup product), and macaroni, which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.  She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory of things that sell well in the rainy season.  Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the market.  With the profits from her business Famata dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase biscuits, salt, and maggi cubes

loans.name: Obanla

texts.en: Obanla sells clothes, shoes and bags to make a living. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. sells smoked fish and gari (couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Elmina, which she has been doing since 1989. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the seamen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes from washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

Efua is married and has no formal education. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills and for their apartment. Efua will use this loan to buy more fish to smoke and gari to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and gari to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cultured oyster products known as "talaba" in the local community. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Criselda joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 14,0000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 38-years old, married and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend school, while her last born is still breastfeeding. Constance trades in rice cereals, lace items useful in room and office decorations, textiles, and clothing. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys a few items and sells through hawking. She believes that, with her nine years of experience in sales, she will be able to grow her business to the expected level. With this loan, she wants to purchase lace items, rice cereals, and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Laurinda Joao

texts.pt:
Laurinda João M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de 20, 17, 13 e 1 anos de idade, os mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido ao casamento pré maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Moçambique para Suazilândia seguindo o seu marido que trabalhava naquele pais no ano de 1988. Após a morte do marido, regressou aos pais e iniciou uma actividade comercial. É comerciante e dona de seu próprio negocio, trabalha das 06h as 23h com ajuda dos seus filhos. Vende mais refrigerantes, vinhos e outros produtos de restaurante, consegue render cerca de 1.000.00 a 1.200.00mt por dia e poupa através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve um empréstimo de 15.000.00mt na Associação Guê-Gue-Gue para o comércio, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos e decidiu aproximar. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo nesta instituição no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes, vinhos, Whisky, e outros) para reforçar a mercadoria do seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00mt para comércio e Habitação.

No futuro pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio e terminar a construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Laurinda João M. was born in the distric of Boane, Maputo province. She is 39 years old, widow, and a mother of four children, who are 20, 17, 13 and 1 years old. The older go to school. She did only up to the 6th grade at school. She did not continue due to her marriage at young age. She lives in her own house with her family, and supports two grandchildren who live with her.

She left Mozambique to Suazilândia accompanying her husband, who used to work in that country in 1988. After her husband's death, she came back to her parents' house and started a trading activity. She is a trader and the owner of her business. She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. with the help of her sons. She sells sodas, wine and other restaurant products. She is able to earn an income of MZN 1,000 to 1,200 a day, and she saves money through the traditional savings system called Xitique.

She had a loan of MZN 15,000 with the Associação Guê-Gue-Gue for her business. Later on, she learned about Hluvuki through her neighbors and decided to get in contact. This is her 5th loan with this institution, of MZN 15,000. With the loan, she intends to buy merchandise (sodas, wines, whisky and others) in order to improve her stock. The previous loans were of MZN 6,500; MZN 10,000; MZN 15,000; and MZN 15,000, for her business and for housing.

In the future, she intends to request new loans to develop even more her business, as well as to finish her house construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and selling of sodas, beverages and others

loans.name: Mirla Manuela

texts.es:
Mirla es una mujer dinámica  y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali- Perù. Tiene 57 años, es madre de 3 hijos (todos mayores de edad)y cuenta con una bodega de abarrotes, donde vende al por menor la cual està ubicada en su casa. Trabaja junto a su esposo quien es comerciante,  el cual también apoya en los gastos económicos de sus 2 hijos que están en la Universidad  de la ciudad de Huánuco. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal "Las  Lomas de Yarina" desde hace cinco años.
El primer crédito que recibió en este banco fuè de 300.00 soles, los que le permitieron invertir en lencería(ropas interiores femeninas). 
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500.00 soles que le permitirán invertir en artículos de abarrotes para surtir su bodega, ya que va creciendo progresivamente, por lo que ahora cuenta con màs productos para ofrecer a su público. 
La meta de Mirla es ampliar su negocio y también tener artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mirla is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman who lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 57 years old and the mother of three adult children.

Mirla operates a retail grocery store located in her home. She works with her husband, who is a merchant, to provide financial support for two of their children who attend the University of Huánuco.

Mirla joined the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina” five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which allowed her to invest in lingerie. Now she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy grocery items to restock her store, which is growing steadily, and offer more merchandise to the public.

Mirla’s goal is to expand her business by also offering housewares.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with more groceries

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Ms. Febelyn D., 25 years of age, is single and is a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has one minor dependent (shown in the photo). At present, she is receiving support from her live-in partner who is a coco land (coconut plantation) laborer and caretaker.

Febelyn joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

Now, Febelyn is given the privilege of obtaining 4,000 PHP as her first loan to start her new business which is a sari-sari (variety) store and dried-fish vending business. Her future plan is to build a stall for her sari-sari store business and to expand the market for her dried-fish vending activity.

loans.use: To use as starting capital for her sari-sari store and dried-fish vending business

location.town: Tangub-Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Mindanao

loans.name: Abdumurod

texts.ru: Кенджаев Абдумурод проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Кенджаев Абдумурод имеет среднее образование. В области животноводства он работает 3 года. Кенджаев Абдумурод откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
K. Abdumurod lives in the Khuroson region. He's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. K. Abdumurod has a high school education. He has been breeding cattle for three years. He fattens and then sells the cattle. He's asking for a loan in order to buy new cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon is 34 years old and lives in Isfara city, Tajikistan with his family. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for foreign cars. He has been involved in this business for more than four years. He provides the cars with spare parts and his family with food and other needs. Gafurjon has a great demand for his spare parts, thus he wants to buy more goods in order to be in requisition of his clients. He wants to take out an individual loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop inventory.  Gafurjon is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for the trust and support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Claudia Isela

texts.es: Claudia Isela R. M. de 30 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a ambos padres y un pequeño hijo de un año de edad, el cual es su mayor incentivo para seguir adelante. Claudia posee una venta de frutas, la cual esta ubicada frente al punto de buses de la ruta 113, lugar muy concurrido, en el que a toda hora del día transitan muchas personas. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, la cual inicia su trabajo desde las 6 de mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, una larga jornada gracias a la cual puede brindarle techo, alimento y todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo, el cual depende únicamente de ella, ya que Claudia es madre soltera, quien debe esforzarse el doble por seguir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, de manera que tenga más cantidad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
. Claudia Isela R. M., 30, lives in Cojutepeque, Cuscatlán department. She lives with both her parents and her one-year-old son, who is her greatest incentive to succeed in life. Claudia is a fruit vendor; she has a stand in front of the route 113 bus stop; a very busy site that has much foot traffic all day. She is a cheerful and enterprising woman that starts her work day at 6am and goes until 5pm, a long work day that provides a roof over her head, food and everything her young son needs. He depends completely on her because Claudia is a single mother that must work twice as hard to get ahead. She is asking for funding to buy fruits and vegetables so that she will have a greater amount of product to offer her customers thus increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
EL EDEN

LA Alcancía Comunal “EL EDEN” está formado por 9 socios, que cursan su sexto ciclo, todos son trabajadores y buscan cualquier circunstancias para salir adelante ya que con su esfuerzo diario pueden brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Los socios realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, comestibles, comida, golosinas y otros socios brindan servicios D. mototaxi y costura.
La presidenta del grupo es Juana, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y especerías en el mercado hace varios años, es casada y tiene dos hijos  por las cuales tiene que trabajar ya que su objetivo es la mejora D. su situación económica, el crédito recibido lo invertirá en comprar productos para mejorar sus ganancias.
Como tesorero Juan es una persona responsable en el grupo así como también con su familia, él es electricista hace 15 años negocio que le ha ayudado a aportar con los gastos en casa. Eso para el no es suficiente así que en esta época escolar abrió una librería juntamente con su esposa, esto le  permitirá mejorar la economía en su casa.
Nuestra socia Candelaria se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en su casa hace 1 año, este tipo D. trabajo la favorece ya que es una persona D. avanzada edad, además cuenta con la ayuda D. sus 4 hijos que están pendientes D. ella. Ellos están orgullosos ya que mediante este trabajo pudieron salir adelante.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Eden” consists of nine members who are beginning their sixth loan cycle. They are all hard workers who look for any opportunity to get ahead. Already, through their daily efforts, the members have been able to proviD. a better future for their children. They engage in different businesses selling vegetables, groceries, prepared foods, and candy. Others proviD. services such as motorcycle transport and tailoring.

Juana is the group president. She has been selling vegetables and spices at the market for a number of years. She is married and has two children, which is why she has to work. Her main objective is to improve her financial situation. Her loan will be used to buy products to help increase her earnings.

As the group treasurer, Juan has demonstrated responsibility within the Communal Bank and also with his family. He has worked as an electrician for 15 years, and his business helps to pay for his household expenses. At the moment, his business income is not enough. Since the school year has started, he and his wife have opened a bookstore to help improve their finances at home.

Candelaria is a group member who has been selling candy at home for the past year. This type of work is well-suited for someone who is a bit older. She also has the help of her four dependent children. They are proud of the fact that their work has helped them to move forward.

The members are grateful for this loan and promise to complete their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Naceke

texts.en:
Naceke E. is currently in the business of selling tea by the street during the evening times. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and chairs for sitting. Naceke is 40 years old and married to a policeman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more sugar and chairs for sitting

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu F. is 38 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Americo forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 36 años, es casado  y tiene dos hijos (Estefani y Traici). El brinda servicio de transporte en un taxi que el alquila. Ya son 18 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Americo es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para ahorrar el dinero y después juntar $12000 para comprar un carro de segundo uso. El anhelo del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.  El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Americo is a member of the Los Diamantes village bank. He is 36 years old and married, and has two children, Estefani and Traici. He is a taxi driver with a rented taxi. He's driven the taxi for 18 years and it's gone very well because of his commitment to his work. Americo is a hard-working person with a lot of initiative, and he's always looking for ways to improve his situation and offer his children a better future. He needs this loan so he can save up 12000 soles to buy a used car. He dreams of owning a new car. The village bank has been through 10 loan cycles, and Americo says he's very satisfied with the professional development and loan and savings services the group offers. He's very grateful for the opportunity the groups provides him and is committed to paying off this loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save up to buy a used car

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix R. J. tiene 22 años, esta casado con la Sra. Melvy Quispe Villarroel, tienen juntos dos hijos que son muy pequeños para asistir a la escuela. Viven actualmente en la casa de la mama de la Sra. Melvy.

El Sr. se dedica al servicio de mecanica, trabaja en un taller cerca de su casa. la Sra. Melvy cuida su ganado en su mismo domicilio, se dedica a la produccion de leche desde hace unos 7 años. Siendo este su ingreso extra para la sustentacion economica de la familia. Toda la produccion entrega a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. 

Requieren del credito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero para que su produccion incremente y generen mas ingresos. Es segundo credito que solicita al Cidre, anteriormente tuvo un credito que cancelo oportunamente.
texts.en:
Felix R. J., age 22, is married to Melvy Quispe Villarroel. They have two children who are too young to go to school. They currently live in Melvy’s mother’s house. He works as a mechanic in a shop close to his house. Melvy takes care of their livestock at home. She has worked in milk production for seven years. This is an extra income to support the family. She delivers her production to a business that makes all types of dairy products. They need the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase their production and generate more income. This is the second loan he has requested from Cidre. He previously had a loan, which he paid back in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Charim's Group

texts.en: This group loan is made up of four people in Lekh Pram village in the province of Kandal. Mrs. Charim T. is the group leader, selected by all the members, each of whom will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Lach Koem Phey, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Charim T. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is the mother of a child who is seven months old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
48 year-old Elvira N. is happy with the life she has. She never regretted her decision not to get married and to spend most of her time instead looking after the needs of her parents as well as her nieces. At home, she lives with her 71 year-old father and 72 year- old mother. Her two nieces, ages five and 12, are the great source of joy in their house. Elvira’s sister (mother of her nieces) is a housewife and is dependent on her husband’s small income as a hired laborer. Aside from supporting the needs of her parents, Elvira also wanted to help  support her sister and her nieces. 
A way Elvira realized to have a source of income to support her dream of improving her family’s standard of living is by having her own business. With that vision, she joined ASHI in 2004 and has put up a small variety store which sells groceries, foodstuffs and beverages. Eventually, as the amount of loan she is qualified to request from ASHI increased because of maintaining an excellent credit rating (business rating, attendance to center meetings, and repayment rating) inventories of her store increased as well as her profit. Looking back on their lives before she had her own business, now it’s quite different, and financially life has improved. 
With the loan Elvira  is currently requesting, she hopes to enhance her other business which is hog fattening. After four months of fattening her hogs, they will be sold either alive or slaughtered directly to people in their village and/or in the market. Proceeds from this business would augment the proceeds of her store and therefore, Elvira will be able to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: Some portion will be used to purchase a larger volume of grocery items for her store and some will be used to purchase piglets for starting a hog fattening business.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
N. Zaituni is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  One of her children is in school, and she takes care of another child who is also in school.  Zaituni has a business selling fish in Kalisizo.  Zaituni’s business serves the local community in Kalisizo by providing fresh fish to the other people in the village.

To help expand her business, Zaituni is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for purchasing more fish to sell and also a basket to transport her fish to market.  Zaituni hopes to sell more fish in the future and generate profit in order to provide for her family.


Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Buy more fish and a basket to transport fish to market

loans.name: Wilmer Orlando

texts.es:
el joven Wilmer Orlando C. M. tiene 25 años de edad, hace poco contrajo matrimonio, no tiene hijos y  vive en la casa de sus padres que esta ubicada en la aldea el Matiaral San Lorenzo, Valle.
Wilmer se dedica a la venta de achineria desde hace unos 3 años, de San Lorenzo viaja a El Salvador todos los dias a vender su producto.
Wilmer es una persona responsable y honesta, el credito lo utilizara en la compra de achineria.

su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa y ahi mismo poner una pequeña tienda en la cual venda diferentes productos.
quiere prepararse para cuando tenga sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilmer Orlando C. M. is 25 years old and newly married. They do not have any children yet, and they live in his parents' house in the village of Matiaral near San Lorenzo, Valle. Wilmer has worked selling a variety of merchandise for the last three years. He travels from San Lorenzo to El Salvador everyday to sell his products. Wilmer is a responsible and honest man. He will use the loan to purchase general merchandise. His dream is to have his own house and have a storefront in his home where he would sell different products. He wants to prepare a better life for when he has children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 28 years old and is married with two infant children. Arthur owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 23,000 PHP per harvest. In 2010, Arthur joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en: Patrocinia A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 62 years old. Patrocinia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Patrocinia raises crops.
