The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Patricia is thankful she has the farm for the income she gets from it. She hopes to be able to sustain her family through it. Patrocinia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patrocinia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Patrocinia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Patrocinia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI), has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: C4355 Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Delphine is 29 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of this group called Abatoni which is well-known in the business of selling a variety of goods. This is their third successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from early morning until late in the evening.

Delphine and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which they will invest in the purchase of foodstuffs. This, hopefully, will increase their sales as well as their profits. With these profits, each member of this group will improve the living standard of his or her family and, in addition to that, they will keep expanding their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of goods for their store

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are two months old and three years old. Both her children are not yet in school as they are not yet of school age according to the schools in her neighborhood. Eugenie sells a variety of products such as packed water, biscuits, cartons of water, matches, Vaseline etc. and some foodstuffs such as rice and tomatoes. Eugenie is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 41-year-old married mother of five school-aged children. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 20 years and employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, milk, tomatoes, bananas, sugarcane and tea (which she sells at the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority). She also earns income from her salon and barber shop business and from the sale of paraffin.

Jane has requested this loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereals business and horticultural farming. The proceeds from these investments will help her pay school fees for her children and expand her businesses. She plans to expand her banana and sugarcane farming and sell bananas and black sugar large scale. Her biggest challenges are the high cost of pesticides, unpredictable weather conditions, and sometimes her products are not enough to enable her to benefit from the economies of scale.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business and horticultural farming

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico R. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de City. She is 53 years old and single. To make a living, Rico owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rico has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rico is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the fourth loan that Rico has taken out  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 03 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Florentina viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de cuero, lana, carne y productos de la región.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá en la compra de lana, carne y productos de la región para su negocio.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the community bank “Santiago Patrón”, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, in the Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, married and she has 3 children. She has completed her primary education.

Florentina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She tells us that her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles. The money was used to increase her business’ capital, selling leather, wool, meat and regional products.

Florentina is requesting a new loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of wool, meat and regional products for her business.

Her dream is to have more capital for her business.

The things she likes most about her community bank are the punctuality, the responsibility and the savings she earns.

loans.use: to buy products like wool, meat and regional products for her business

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Quingeo está formado por 8 mujeres y un hombre quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera  ciudad más importante del país, se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la belleza de su naturaleza, su cultura y tradiciones, su gente es amable y hospitalaria, tiene una  gastronomía muy variada. Nuestras socias son mujeres quienes luchan día a día en sus diferentes actividades para ayudar a la economía de sus hogares y así brindar un mejor futuro a sus familias pero siempre con optimismo y una sonrisa en los labios.

La Señora. Raquel Álvarez vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Nuestra socia tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre y tiene una niña  de 5 años de edad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Raquel es oriunda de la provincia de Machala, vino a vivir en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 3 años invitada por su cuñado, ahora para mejorar su economía se dedica hace un año a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de la marca Esika, también vende ropa, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas  y conocidas.
Con su crédito va a incrementar su mercadería y va a comprar más ropa y cosméticos. Su  meta es  terminar sus estudios ya que le faltaba el último año de colegio  y luego seguir alguna carrera universitaria.

La Señora Jovita Rodríguez vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, es oriunda de la ciudad de Guayaquil y está viviendo en nuestra ciudad hace 17 años.
Nuestra socia tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 11 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo se dedica a trabajar y ayuda en la economía del hogar y sus dos ultimas hijas  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad y no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar. 
Doña Jovita labora como empleada domestica, actividad que realiza hace 9 años,  labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende a sus amigas y de casa en casa, esta en este negocio hace 2 años.
 En este banco comunal es su primer crédito ya que se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para las fiestas de navidad que se encuentran próximas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Quingeo communal bank is formed by 8 women and one man who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, the third most import city in the country. It is characterized by its beautiful landscapes and nature, the culture and traditions, its kind and hospitable people and its diverse cuisine. Our members are women who struggle each day in their different activities to improve the economic well-being of their households and to provide a better future for their families, always with optimism and a smile on their faces.  

Mrs. Raquel A. lives in the city of Cuenca and this is the first loan she has received from the communal bank. She was invited by a friend to be a part of this group of strong women. She is 25 years old and lives in common law marriage. She has a 5 year old daughter and her husband works as a  security guard. They don't have their own home so they rent. Mrs. A. is a native of Machala province and came to live in Cuenca 3 years ago at the suggestion of her brother-in-law. For the past year she has been selling cosmetics through a catalog company called Esika. She also sells clothes to her friends and acquaintances. With her loan she will purchase more clothes and cosmetics to increase the merchandise for her business. Her goal is to finish her last year of high school and then start studying at the university. 

Mrs. Jovita R. has been living in the city of Cuenca for the past 17 years and is a native of Guayaquil. She is 41 years old, married with 4 children ages 25, 23, 11 and 9. Her eldest son is married and lives on his own. Her second oldest son works to support the household and her two daughters go to public school. Her husband works as a security guard. They live in a relative's house since they don't own their own home. Mrs. R. has worked as a domestic employee for 9 years and works from 7am til 3pm, Monday through Friday. On the weekends for the past 2 years, she has been selling clothes to her friends and also door-to-door. She is reentering the communal bank system, but this will be her first loan with this particular bank. She will use her loan to invest in clothes for the coming holiday season. She dreams of owning her own home someday.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a widow with a grown son named Sergei. She runs a retail sale business in her home town of Zaporozhye. Galina sells women’s clothing and footwear items in the local market called ‘Osipenkovskyi’. She sells turtlenecks, sweaters, imitation leather jackets and coats, etc. Galina’s vending kiosk is well-known for reasonable prices and good quality merchandise. 

Galina has been running this business for 10 years. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. Her gross income amounts to 12,000 Grivnyas. Galina is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. She is planning to purchase additional warm and durable footwear for the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mesias Heriberto

texts.es:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. tiene 51 años. Es viudo, vive con  los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mesias se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. is a 51-year-old widower.  He lives with his children in the San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  He has 6 children.
The members of the communal bank YAGUI GRANDE are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the San Miguel canton.  The members of this bank are short-cycle farmers of corn and potatoes and have been doing this work for a long time.
Mesias sows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in the San Miguel market on Thursdays.
He requests this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizer for the cultivation of  corn and potatoes.  This loan will help him provide household necessities.  He faces challenges from insects, diseases, and the variability of the weather.  His dream is to be able to build a house.
He enjoys sports and spending time with his children.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and feritlizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 21 years old. Elena is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for Elena's business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables like squash, eggplants, tomatoes, amplaya and spices, garlic, and onions in her local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined the Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en:
Soyolmaa P. lives with her husband and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her sons both attend a local high school. Soyolmaa supports her family by operating a shoe making business. 

Since 2002 she used to work as a helper in a cafe, and during the winter months she worked in the shoe making factory as a shoemaker. Based on her previous work experience she started her own business. She will use this loan to buy more supplies and materials for her shoe making business.

Soyolmaa is a modest person and says, "I want to be able to afford to send my sons to the university." She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and tools for her shoe making business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and tools

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en:
Rodelisa S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Rodelisa is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodelisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Rodelisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rodelisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rodelisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam T. P. is 51 years old, has one son and lives in the hamlet of Pho Cho. She makes a living by running a small restaurant where she serves Pho, a very popular local delicacy in Vietnam. She opened her restaurant in 2003, one year before securing her first loan from our organization. She used that loan to buy a refrigerator to keep her beef fresh. Since that time, she has received six additional loans and used each effectively to expand her business. She now earns 3,000,000 VND in profit every month from her work. She is committed to continue repaying loans on time and has applied for a new one, for 8,066,000 VND, to buy the equipment she needs to improve and expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy equipment to improve and expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Komezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Perpetue M. est une commerçant âgé de 32 ans qui habite  au centre de Nyanza en   commune Nyanza –Lac  de la Province de Makamba  au Sud du Burundi. Elle pratique le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les fruits et legumes,le haricot ainsi que du poisson frais du lac, le métier qu’elle exerce depuis 8ans. Elle a fait les études primaires jusqu'en 6e annee. Elle  est mariée avec  3 enfants dont 1 est a l’école. Elle  arrive au 9e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires a vendre a ses clients dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Elle salue l'initiative de Turame de donner de credits aux pauvres car elle a vu son niveau de vie s'ameliorer continuellement avec le business qu'elle a commence.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Komezimbere».
texts.en:
Perpetue M. is a 32-year-old business woman whi lives in the center of Nyanza in the commune Nyanza-Lac in the Makamba province in the south of Burundi. She sells food products such as fruits and vegetables, beans and fresh fish from the lake. She has done this for the past 8 years. She completed primary school up to 6th grade. She is married with 3 children, one of whom goes to school. She is on her 9th credit cycle with Turame Community Finance. 

She is asking for this Kiva loan in order to increase her capital and buy a lot of food products to sell to her clients in the hopes of increasing her savings et grow her business. She thanks Turame for giving loans to poor people since she has seen improvement in her quality of life since starting this business. She is a member of the Komezimbere Group.

loans.use: accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es:
Camila es una pequeña comerciante de venta de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos, a si como electrodomésticos,  en donde lleva más de veinte años en la actividad para apoyar a sus tres hijos.
Primeramente  sus productos los vendía en los departamentos en donde vende más rápido, y había captado clientela, pero luego, se decidió vender solo en Mangua, en donde comienza a expandir mas sus ventas y necesita de mas inversión para cumplir la demanda del  cliente lo que recurre a préstamos en Afodenic por ser de bajos intereses, ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con prestamos en otras bancos.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en ropa, zapatos, cosméticos variados y cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes ya que trabaja con catálogos, siendo productos de buena calidad y accesibles de precios.
texts.en:
Camila is a small business owner selling clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and small appliances.  She has had her business for over twenty years, which has helped her support her three children.  

At first, she sold her products in states where she had quick sales and regular customers, but later she decided to only sell in Managua.  She is beginning to expand her sales and needs to purchase more products in order to meet customer demand.  She has come to Afodenic for a loan due to their low interest rates.  She previously had loans with other banks. 

With this new loan she will purchase clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to fill customer orders.  She sells via catalogs, since their products are of good quality and reasonably priced.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, and shoes to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 40 years old, married and has five children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Her husband works as a farmer.

Anita is also a farmer. She and her husband till their land and prepares it well for planting rice crops. Anita has been engaged in farming for more than 17 years and earns approximately PHP 3500 per month.

Anita's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Eley Yamilett

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comunidad el jicarito y ella es una señora que trabaja como conserje en el centro de salud de telica además con los crédito que ha adquirido le ha servido para efectuarle mejora a su vivienda y ella  también le ha dado sus estudio a su hijos que ella tiene pero ella la apoya su marido  ya que él trabaja en la ciudad de león  lo que sirve con sus in greso para los gastos del hogar, además los hijos estudian en los colegios de la comunidad.
texts.en: Eley Yamilett is originally from the community of El Jicarito.  She works as a janitor at a health clinic in Telica.  In addition, the loans she has acquired have helped her make improvements to her home.  Eley also provides her children an education and supports her husband who works in León.  Their incomes cover the household expenses.  Her children study at the community schools.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and pay for labor to make home improvements.

loans.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es:
José, es empleado y administra una venta de comida típica, reside en San Miguel, él vive con su familia, tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad; La venta de comida la realiza en su vivienda y quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos en su esposa.
Él quiere ofrecer más productos de alimentación y solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar lo suficiente en aceite, frijol, arroz, carnes, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar las ganancias.
José quiere tener un negocio rentable y poseer una vivienda propia para estar con su familia.
texts.en:
José is an employee and runs a business selling traditional food.  He lives in San Miguel with his family.  He has a 9 year-old son.

José sells the food from his home.  It is prepared by his wife.  José would like to offer more food products and he is requesting a loan to buy enough oil, beans, rice and meat.  This purchase will help him to increase his profits.  José would like to have a profitable business and own his own home to live in with his family.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice and meat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is 48 years old and married. She has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo, soap and canned goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

 In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Sukhbaatar is 58 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house in the outer ger districts of the city. His son works at a local trade center and his daughter attends public school. Sukhbaatar is a professional driver, having worked at a local auto company from 1975 to 1997.

Sukhbaatar has been supporting his family by operating a taxi business for the past thirteen years. In 1998, he started his business using an old Russian car called a Moskvich. During the past thirteen years, he has been able to gradually improve his living conditions and has gained a lot of experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another secondhand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the car. His goal is to improve his daughter’s education by paying her education costs.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Ugandan female aged 38 years who needs a loan to pay labourers for weeding her watermelon garden. She hails from Kyenjojo district, a mother of four children aged 16, 14, 12 and 4 years. She dreams of educating her children and setting up other income-generating activities to supplement her income. A farmer of nine years, she acquired her start-up capital from accumulated savings from her rental houses.

loans.use: To pay labourers for weeding her watermelon garden.

loans.name: Mivado Group

texts.fr: MIVADO est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Agnès. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agnès est née en 1970 au Bénin et est mariée à Bonaventure un conducteur auto. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Agnès vend de « l’Akassa » (une pâte préparée grâce à la farine de maïs). Agnès exerce ce métier depuis près de quatre ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Agnès s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce quatrième prêt permettra certainement à  Agnès et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
MIVADO is a group made up of three persons whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is called Agnès. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to increase their working capital, this group is requesting, for the fourth time, a loan from ALIDé. 

Agnès was born in 1970 in Bénin and is married to Bonaventure, a chauffeur. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and living under their roof.  

Agnès never attended school. In order to support herself and her family, Agnès sells « Akassa » (a dough made from maize flour). She has been in this business for almost four years, and it allows her, together with her husband, to cover the various expenses of the family. 

Agnès buys her supplies in a town in Bénin. This fourth loan will certainly permit  Agnès and her group to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of maize.

loans.name: La Luz Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama la Luz , sus integrantes le pusieron así , por que  este apoyo de fundación realidad es la luz de un nuevo amanecer para su familia .El grupo cuenta con una representante quien es la señora  Juana , quien cuenta con la escolaridad de la primaria terminada. El grupo  cuenta con cuatro integrantes las cuales las cuatro son  mujeres, esta  ubicado  en la  localidad de Cacahuatepec estado de Oaxaca ,sus cuatro integrantes viven en la colonia del centro.
La señora  Romelia  tiene  cuarenta y ocho años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jorge Luis tiene 52 años de edad, ellos tienen  tres hijos dos hombres y una niña  quienes se llaman  Luis de trece años de edad, jorge de veinte y Martha la mas pequeña de  diez años de edad .Ella solicito el préstamo  se dedica ala venta de  chivos , solicito el préstamo para  comprar mas chivos  ya que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio, obtiene  muy buenas ganancias y sale a los pueblos ofrecer su mercancía .
Le gusta mucho su trabajo  por que cuando sale a los pueblos  vende muy bien y  así gana mas clientes, por que les da  a buen precio y buen trato para que se queden con una buena impresión y vuelvan  a    comprarles.
Su sueño mas grande con este negocio y este crédito es  que con sus ganancias  salir mas a los pueblos y así  contratar mas personal para hacer mas grande  su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida para  su familia y sus empleados.
Las otras tres integrantes del grupo  se llaman:

Juana- para la compra y venta de  frutas y verduras.
María Antonia- para  la venta de carne de Morano.
Cristina-para la venta de carne de Res. 

Están muy contenta por  el apoyo que les a dado  fundación realidad por el apoyo que les a dado, para mejorar su negocio y así también mejorar la calidad de vida de cada una de las integrantes de l grupo la Luz.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Luz” (The Light).  The members chose this name because the support from Fundación Realidad represents the light to a new dawn for their families.  The group representative is Sra. Juana, who has an elementary school education.  There are four members in this group, all women, who are from the town of Cacahuatepec in the State of Oaxaca.  They live in a subdivision in the central part of town.  

Sra. Rumelia is 48 years old and married to Sr. Jorge Luis, age 52.  They have three children, two sons and a daughter.  Their names are Luis (age 13), Jorge (age 20), and Martha (age 10).  She is requesting a loan so that she can sell goats.  Rumelia plans to buy more goats since she has done very well with her business.  This will enable her to generate more income.  She goes into various towns to offer her animals for sale.  

What she enjoys most about her job is being able to travel to different towns.  Her sales have been very good.  Rumelia is able to gain more customers because she offers them a good price and provides good service.  This leaves a good impression and influences her customers to return and buy more.  Her greatest wish for her business and this loan is to use her earnings to visit more towns.  As a result, she can hire employees to make her business larger.  Rumelia would be able to provide a better quality of life for her family and her staff.  

The other three members of the group are as follows:
•	Juana buys and sells fruits and vegetables.
•	María Antonia sells meat from Morano.
•	Cristina sells beef.

They are pleased with the support provided by Fundación Realidad.  As a result of the assistance they have been given, each member of the group “La Luz” has been able to improve her business and also her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Umoja Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chiza, leader du groupe d’affaire « Umoja Virunga »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de friperie. Son mari est un ingénieur constructeur. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Elle commença son business avec ses fonds propres reçus de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et le nourrir confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Umoja Virunga» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Chiza, who is the leader of the « Umoja Virunga » business group, is a 49 year old businesswoman .She is married with 6 children who are all students and some of whom have their own lodgings. She is a second hand clothes saleswoman. Her husband is a construction engineer. She sets up her wares at the central market in Virunga. She has been practising this profession for 15 years. She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband. This new loan will enable her to stock up on 2 packages of second hand clothes. In addition she intends to send her children to school and feed them comfortably. This client thanks Hekima for their activities in favour of poor women who are excluded from classic banks. It should be noted that the « Umoja Virunga» group is predominantly feminine.

loans.use: purchase 2 packages of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Lesli Zulema

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco se hacen las reuniónes del banco comunal “Solidaridad Tambo Real” y en ese lugar conocimos a la socia Lesli y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la comunidad de Tambo Real, tengo 21 años edad y vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y tengo varias actividad como por ejemplo, trabajo en una botica “FarmaGroup” y estudio la carrera técnica de Rehabilitación y Fisioterapia en el Instituto Superior Antonio Lorena de la ciudad del Cusco”. 

Lesli es técnico en Farmacia y es una joven profesional que es trabajadora y responsable que busca las mejores oportunidades para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su mamá Nancy tienen un negocio familiar que consiste   engorde de ganado. En esta oportunidad Lesli requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales y algunos animales.
texts.en:
The “Solidaridad Tambo Real” (Tambo Real Solidarity) communal bank meets in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Cusco Department.  We met its member, Lesli, there and she comments:

“I was born in Tambo Grande.  I’m 21 years old and live in the city of Cusco.  I have several activities.  For example, I work in a FarmaGroup pharmacy and am studying Rehabilitation and Physiotherapy, a technical career, at the Antonio Lorena Superior Institute in the city of Cusco.”

Lesli is a pharmacy technician and a young professional who is hard working and responsible and who is seeking opportunities to have a better quality of life.  She and her mother, Nancy, have a family business consisting in raising livestock.  On this opportunity, Lesli needs the loan to buy animal feed and to buy a few animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to buy a few animals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years, married to Jonathan, and they have two children. She has been operating food restaurant for the last ten years, making a monthly profit of KES 10,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use as capital to increase stock of food stuff like rice, soft drinks, wheat flour and expand the restaurant.

With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another restaurant and in the near future she hopes to open a classic restaurant at Isinya.

loans.use: To add more stock of food staff like rice, soft drinks, and wheatflour

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio tiene 55 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos, uno de 22 años de edad y otra de 25 años de edad, el varón es soltero, estudiante, ayuda a su madre a administrar una pequeña despensa, la mayor es casada ya posee su ingreso propio.
Silvio comenta que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con otros como ayudante, actualmente trabaja por su cuenta, la mayoría de los trabajos que realiza son obras de construcción como ser colocación de piso, refacción de vivienda, pintura en general.
Comenta que es un trabajo muy duro, ya que implica mucho esfuerzo físico. Dice que todo lo hace por el bien de su familia, ya que ellos son su razón de ser y quiere darles una vida digna. El se considera una persona muy luchadora que no teme a ningún tipo de trabajo. Uno de sus sueños es algún día pode montar un deposito de materiales de construcción donde pueda proveer a otros constructores.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de una mezcladora, la cual le será de gran ayuda en su profesión. Sabe que la misma le ahorrará mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Sr. Silvio is 55 years old, married, and has two children (ages 22 and 25). His son is single, a student, and helps his mother manage a small food pantry. His older child is married and has her own income.

Silvio says that as a young man he began working with others as an assistant, but he now works on his own. Most of his jobs are performed at construction sites and involve floor installation, home repairs, and painting in general.

He says that the work is very hard because it requires a lot of physical effort. Silvio says that everything he does is for the welfare of his family. For this reason, he wants to provide them a decent life. Silvio is considered to be a very determined person who is not afraid of any type of work. One of his dreams is to someday establish a warehouse where he can sell construction materials to other builders.

Silvio is requesting a loan to buy a cement mixer, which will be a tremendous help in his profession. He knows that this item will save him a great deal of effort.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixer for his construction jobs.

loans.name: Las Piedras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Piedras está conformado por la señora Olegaria va a comprar con su crédito tortillas, papa, pollo, verduras, queso, crema para elaborar sus dobladas, la señora Edilia va a comprar huevo, azúcar, leche, jabón, aceite, la señora Oliva va a comprar teleras, jamón queso para preparar tortas, la señora Georgina Bibiana va a comprar chicharrones, paletas, chicles y dulces, la señora Oliva tiene 27 años de edad ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas menores de edad de 5 y 3 años de edad, están viviendo con sus padres y con su hermano, ella vende tortas, gelatinas, perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra, Avon, tambien los días sábados vende pozole y tostadas preparadas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar grenetina, jamón, salchicha, longaniza, teleras, aguacate y jitomate para elaborar las tortas y las gelatinas, ella inicio su negocio hace un año por falta de recursos económicos y para tener ingresos para la alimentacion de sus hijas, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para irse manteniendo ella y sus hijas, a ella le gusta la venta de perfumes y cosméticos porque conoce a más personas y se siente orgullosa cuando recibe premios por sus ventas, su negocio es popular por las marcas de los perfumes y cosméticos que son muy conocidas,en los productos de las tortas y las gelatinas por su buen sabor ya que las prepara con cariño y esmero para que sus clientes regresen a consumir sus tortas y gelatinas, sus sueños y esperanzas son tener su propia casa y que sus hijas tengan estudio y que no les falte  nada. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias, que Dios los bendiga ya que generan empleos propios, gracias por apoyar a las mujeres que queremos salir adelante en nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Piedras and is made up of the following women: Señora Olegaria who with her part of the loan is going to buy tortillas, potatoes, chicken, vegetables, cheese and cream with which to make her dobladas; Señora Oliva is going to buy savoury bread, ham and cheese to make tortas; Señora Georgina Bibiana is going to buy pork crackling, lollipops, chewing gum and candy. 

Señora Oliva is 27 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 daughters, both minors aged 5 and 3. They are currently living with her parents and her brother. She sells tortas, gelatinas (jellies), perfumes and cosmetics by Jafra and Avon. On Saturdays she also sells pozole (a traditional Latin American stew) and tostadas. She is asking for a loan to buy gelatin, ham, sausage, spicy sausage, savoury bread, avocado and tomotoes with which to make her tortas and gelatinas. She started her business a year ago as she lacked the funds and income to feed her daughters. Her business is important as it gives her an income with which to take care of herself and her daughters. She likes selling perfumes and cosmetics because she gets to know more people and she feels proud when she receives awards for her sales. Her business is popular for its well-known brands of perfumes and cosmetics and her good-tasting tortas and gelatinas as she makes them with love and care so that her customers come back  for more. Her hopes and dreams are to have a house  of her own and that her daughters have the opportunity to study and lack for nothing. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you, may God bless you as you generate jobs. Thank you for supporting women who want to succeed with their businesses and want their families to get ahead" (“gracias, que Dios los bendiga ya que generan empleos propios, gracias por apoyar a las mujeres que queremos salir adelante en nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”).

loans.use: to buy gelatin, ham, sausages, spicy sausage, savoury bread, avocados and tomatoes

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie sells cooked rice and serves it with tomato sauce at Abura. She is a single parent taking care of two children. She attended senior high school. 

The loan will be used to buy bags of rice, tomatoes, pepper, salt to cook and to sell. She hopes to build a restaurant from her increased profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, tomatoes, pepper, salt to cook and to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three daughters (ten, sixteen, and eighteen years old).  Anna has a secondary education and has been working as a farmer for fifteen years.  She also supports her relatives living in the cities of Gyumri and Artik with produce grown on her farm.  She is saving money for her youngest daughters to attend university.  She is also currently paying for her oldest daughter’s college education.  Anna dreams of renovating the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat seeds and a calf.  She expects this investment to increase the family’s income by ten percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and also likes the terms and conditions of the loans.  She enjoys her life in Haritch surrounded by her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and a calf

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 44 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, convive con su pareja en su casa propia, fruto de ésta unión  tiene 4 hijos, por quienes educa y alimenta, del mismo modo brinda su apoyo a una sobrina, quien vive también con ella. Ella se dedica a la fabricación de palos de escoba, trabajo que lo realiza en un local que alquila y en donde tiene todos las herramientas necesarias. Tiene 15 años dedicada a dicha actividad, la cual la  realiza con el apoyo de su conviviente y dos ayudantes, de esta manera ofrece trabajo y un ingreso de dinero a otras personas las cuales están muy agradecidas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente muy contenta con el bien que realiza a su comunidad creando empresa y desarrollo, animada por la demanda que tiene su producto se siente con el deseo  de seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio para llegar a otras zonas más lejanas. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, le gusta el grupo que forma parte ya que todos se conocen y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda pasar a los otros. Con el monto solicitado, comprará madera en mayor cantidad y a un menor precio generándole mayor ganancias,
texts.en:
Lucy, age 44, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She and her partner live in their own home. They have four children who they feed and provide an education. Lucy also supports a niece who lives with them.

Lucy makes broom handles and works in a rented workshop where she has all the necessary equipment. She has been in this business for 15 years and has the help of her partner and two assistants. Lucy provides employment, so the people who work for her are grateful that they have an income. What she enjoys most about her work is knowing that she is helping her community and encouraging local development. She is excited about the demand for her product, so she wants to continue growing and expanding her business to other distant places.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Lucy enjoys being part of her group because all of the members know her and are always looking out for one another. The amount she requested will be used to buy wood in large quantities and at a lower price so that she can generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk for making broom handles.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, con sesenta y dos años de edad, reside sobre zona industrial donde en su entorno se hallan fabricas, su grupo familiar lo conforman su esposa quien tiene negocio de tortillas también en el lugar colaborando a la economía de ésta familia; y dos hijas que estudian en la universidad y que además son empleadas y por lo menos cubren sus gastos personales con ello. Roberto cuenta desde hace muchos años con una tienda en su misma casa en la que provee a sus clientes de productos de primera necesidad, Roberto es muy bien referenciado por vecinos y clientes como responsable, honesto y trabajador y en los últimos cuatro meses ha experimentado un incremento en la demanda de sus productos dado que otro negocio cercano al suyo se ha trasladado de lugar y ello ha hecho que los clientes de las fabricas cercanas lo prefieran por contar con las cosas que necesitan como bebidas dulces, pan dulce, medicinas, sardinas, lácteos y embutidos que son los que se están terminando rápido y no quiere quedarse diciendo: ¡no tengo! , quiere satisfacer siempre a sus clientes y llevar a la vez el sustento diario a su familia.-
texts.en:
Roberto, 62, lives in an industrial neighborhood where there are factories.  His family unit consists of his wife who has a tortilla business there also contributing to family economy and two daughters who are going to the university but are also employed and able to cover their personal expenses at least.

For many years Roberto has had a home-based grocery store providing his customers with staple items.  Roberto is well referred to by his neighbors and customers as being responsible, honest and hardworking.  The last four months have seen a rise in demand for his products because a nearby store has moved away so customers from nearby factories prefer him because he stocks the things they need like soft-drinks, candy, sweet bread, medicine, sardines, dairy products and cured meats which sell out quickly and he doesn’t want to have to say “I don’t have any!”  He wants to always satisfy his customers as well as provide daily sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poster paper, electrical appliances and cardboard.

loans.name: Fedelita

texts.en:
Fedelita is married woman and gifted with two children. At her age of 47, Fedelita’s children are between the ages of 20 to 26. 

Fedelita has run a hog raising business for three years. With the profits she earned from the business, she successfully sent her children to college and now already they have work. 

Fedelita still wants to maintain her business even though her children already finished their education. Fedelita wants to maintain the business to have savings. Fedelita knows that she is getting old. She has to prepare for her future emergencies with her husband.

Fedelita is requesting a loan of P20,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of pigs.

loans.name: Ra'fat

texts.en:
Ra'fat is a 23-year-old young man. He is married with two daughters. He wants to improve his situation and provide to his family better living conditions by increasing his income. 

Ra'fat wants to purchase some necessary home appliances such as a stove, refrigerator, etc., and to improve his income, he wants also to prepare for opening a cafe that serves hot drinks such as tea, coffee, etc. Ra'fat hasn't enough money to pay for all these expenses, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Ra'fat gets the loan, he will improve his family's living conditions by purchasing the necessary home appliances, and improve his situation by opening the cafe for better income. This will help Ra'fat to live with his family in better life conditions. Ra'fat is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary home appliances and prepare to open a cafe.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Frankline is engaged in the corn production business to earn and save for his future. He is now 27 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to build his own house and become financially stable before he settles down. 

He plans to expand his corn plantation in order to increase his yields. Although farming is difficult to manage, he has the determination to achieve his goals. 

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used in working out his plan. He mentioned that the loan will be used to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production. He believes that he will have a fruitful harvest if he continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 27 years old and is single. He sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. Jean Bosco would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell in his shop. Any profits will be used to renovate his house and create savings for his future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a seamstress at Benkyadze. She is married to a teacher and has two children. Ekua  uses her income to assist her husband in the general up-keep of their children. Ekua will need this loan to purchase more sewing material  to sew. Ekua will acquire a shop with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more material  to sew.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is more than thankful for KIVA's noble cause of assisting small businessmen like her. Her past loan helped sustain her boat propeller making business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a Php 40000 which she will use to buy more propeller materials needed to make boat propellers that she sells to motor boat owners. Her customers are motor boat owners from the different northern islands in the Phils. She hopes you will again consider her request as this business is their only source of income. 

Rosanna prays for more clients to grow her business. She dreams for a better life this coming new year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for propeller materials and other products needed in ship propeller making.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga is married and is mother of 4 children, and they live in a small house in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Two years ago she dediced to start selling chemical products from the garage of her own home, with the objective of providing her children with a quality education and a better quality of life. This would not be possible with the income earned by her husband, working for a company as a construction worker. This is why Olga struggles more every day, motivated for the great love she has for her children and the loyal commitment she feels for her husband.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $375 that she will put towards increasing the variety of her merchandise that she now sees need. She plans to repay the loan in a term of 3 months. Do not wait and help Olga and her family. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ellos viven en una pequeña casita en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Hace 2 años ella decidió comenzar a vender productos químicos en la cochera de su propio domicilio, con el objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y una mejor calidad de vida. Pues esto sería imposible con el sueldo que gana su esposo desempeñándose como empleado en una empresa constructora. Es por ello que Olga lucha cada día más, impulsada por el gran amor que le tiene a sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 DLLS, que destinará para surtir mercancía que le hace falta en este momento. Mismo que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses. No lo dudes y apoya a Olga y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is one of the most successful small business entrepreneurs in the city of Berdyansk. She is a real expert when it comes to the wholesale buying of quality kids' clothing inventory. Nataliya has been in business for 12 years. Currently, she has about $5,000 in inventory. Her monthly gross revenue amounts to $4,000 and her net profit is about $800 - $1,000 per month. Nataliya is an optimist. Her cheery attitude helps her succeed in business and establish good relationships with her clients. Nataliya has gone through many trials and challenges with her business such as lots of inventory rejects, slow-moving products, and unfavorable market policies. However, she has not only managed to keep her business sustainable but has also increased her sales. Nataliya would like to get a loan of $900 to purchase seasonal clothing for children from wholesalers. She is planning to buy a range of casual wear, sweaters and jackets for boys, as well as various fresh and trendy girls'-wear for the spring season. Nataliya believes that nice quality clothing that is stylish, practical, reasonably priced and easy to care for will make the shopping experience more enjoyable for many of her customers and will best serve their needs.

Наталія – одна з найуспішніших підприємців міста Бердянськ. Вона – справжній експерт з продажу якісного дитячого одягу. Наталія займається цим бізнесом вже 12 років. Зараз в неї приблизно 5000 доларів в товарі. Її щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 4000 доларів, чистий прибуток становить 800 - 1000 доларів на місяць. Наталія - оптиміст. Її привітне ставлення допомагає їй досягати успіху в бізнесі та встановлювати гарні стосунки з клієнтами. В роботі Наталії постійно виникають різні важкі питання: неякісний товар, одяг, який погано продається, невигідна ринкова політика. Однак, їй вдається не тільки підтримувати прибутковість свого бізнесу, але й постійно підвищувати обсяги продажів. Наталія хотіла б отримати позику в 900 доларів для того, щоб закупити сезонний одяг для дітей на оптовій базі. Вона планує придбати різноманітний повсякденний одяг, светри та куртки для хлопчиків, а також яскравий та модний одяг для маленьких дівчаток напередодні цього весняного сезону. Наталія вважає, що високоякісний, стильний та практичний одяг за помірними цінами, про який легко дбати, зробить покупки приємнішими та задовольнить потреби її покупців.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama A. is in a polygamous marriage. She has three children and four other people for whom she is responsible. The whole responsibility for the family, especially the schooling of the children, rests on her. Very courageous, she scarcely rests during the day. Early each morning, she sells balls of cooked cereal, then later works in the fields, her secondary business activity.

Wishing to increase her sales of cooked food, she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy corn, fish, oil and condiments so as to be able to make more profit. That will allow her to improve her agricultural pursuits and do well by her children.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Madame A. Maman est une femme d’un mari polygame. Elle à trois (3) enfants et quatre autres personnes à charge. Toute la charge de la famille voire la scolarisation des enfants n’engage qu’elle seule. Très courageuse, elle ne se repose pratiquement pas dans la journée. Très tôt le matin, elle vend des boules de pâtes comme première activité et l’agriculture comme activité secondaire.

Voulant mieux développer le commerce de boule de pâte, elle sollicite $500 pour s’acheter du maïs, du poisson, de l’huile et des condiments en stock afin de réaliser un bénéfice un peu plus signifiant. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de renforcer d’une part son agriculture et d’autre part à assurer sa responsabilité de mère de famille.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, fish, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
“I am Zarina B. and live in Lahore. I have a daughter and a son, both of whom are married. I live with my husband. My husband worked as a gardener while I take care of the chores at home. I would like to help my husband expand his business. He used to grow fruits but the salary he brought home from this activity was not enough. Recently, we leased a piece of land but do not have enough money to purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits. If you can help us with a loan, we can purchase the necessary materials and hopefully improve our standard of living and provide for ourselves in our old age.” 


Zarina B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits for my husband's farm

loans.name: Phav

texts.en: Mrs. Phav P., age 46, is a housewife near Siem Reap. She has three children, one of whom works in a restaurant and two of whom are students. Her husband, age 45, hulls rice for farmers to separate the rice from the husk, making about $1.50 per day. Mrs. Phav P. would like to borrow $750 to purchase a motorbike to transport the rice from the fields to the rice-huller and also provide her family with transportation. Her husband is pictured in the photo next to his rice-huller.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport rice crops and provide her family with transportation

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Mrs. Teodora Q. lives in her mothers’ house in the area of Las Lomas ladera oeste of the City La Paz with her husband and two children; Teodora is self-employed making artisan shawls that she sells to a company; her husband works as a carpenter. With past loans they have been able to buy a lot (without utilities or building) close to where they live now. This new credit will be used to build one room in the lot that will eventually over time become their new home. This is the eight time that she is asking for a loan and the credit analysis performed shows that she is a favorable candidate and that she should be capable of repaying this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora Q. vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Las Lomas ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y dos hijos; Teodora trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando chalinas artesanales que le son solicitadas por una microempresa textil y su esposo trabaja como empleado en un taller de carpintería. Con créditos anteriores realizaron la compra de un terreno amurallado en su misma zona, la que aun no cuenta con servicios básicos ni habitaciones. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que formará parte de la vivienda propia. Esta es la octava vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build one room

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: My name is Azra P., a resident of Lahore. I am mother of six children, aged between 10 to 18 years. I did a course of midwife ten years ago and opted it as a profession to earn my living. I need a loan of $500 to purchase medicines and furniture for my clinic where I practice. I intend to give a better future to my family, and I know it would materialize only when I am able to establish my business.

loans.use: Buy medicines for the clinic

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (D) Group

texts.en: Sauda S. is 32 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a super market.  She intends to use the extra profits to re-invest in the super market.  K. has a piggery business and wants to use the loan to buy pig feeds. Kirunda K. and Betty Namiremebe both have beauty salons and want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Mary N. wants to use the loan to purchase furniture for her hotel. Sande K. has a market stall and wants to purchase more raw foods for sale. Rose N. has a retail shop business and wants to buy more shop items.

loans.use: To add stock in her supermarket

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Irma, being a single mother, decided to start her own business out of necessity for the sustainment of her 4 children. She opened up a beverage business 12 years ago, with which she covered certain expenses but not in their entirety. That is why Irma decided to seek financing and started selling clothing and perfumes. This activity allowed her to nourish and educate all her children.

With the passing of time, Irma has been able to diversify the products she sells and markets. She still has the beverage business at home, where she also sells ice cream, cookies and candies as well as clothing and footwear. She offers all of these products to her neighbors, friends, relatives and the general public. The goal is to increase her earnings, allowing her to expand her business and improve hers and her family’s living conditions. For that reason, she is requesting a loan that will let her buy fruits to prepare the beverages and ice creams that she creates herself, as well as invest in clothing, perfumes and colognes for men and women.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Irma siendo madre soltera decide emprender su propio negocio como una necesidad de subsistencia en la que debía de mantener a sus 4 hijos e inicia hace 12 años una refresquería, con la cual pagaba ciertos gastos pero no cubría la totalidad,es por eso que doña Irma decide buscar un financiamiento y empieza a comprar y vender ropa, perfume, fue esta actividad la que le permitió alimentar y educar a todos sus hijos.

Al pasar de los años la señora ha podido diversificar un poco los productos que vende y comercializa, en su casa tiene todavía la refresquería, vende helados y galletas, golosinas así como también ropa y zapatos, todos estos productos los ofrece a sus vecinas, amigas, familiares y publico en general. La meta es la de aumentar sus ganancias, permitiéndole de esa forma hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su núcleo familiar. Es por eso, que solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas para preparar los refrescos y helados que ella misma elabora, así como invertir en ropa y perfume para damas y caballero.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, clothing, perfumes and cologne.

loans.name: Holisahon

texts.ru:
Holisahon S. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, is married and has 4 children. Holisahon has a high school education and is a homemaker. She owns a small farming household and works it by herself. Holisahon owns several calves that she fattens and resells, but she is missing a dairy cow.

She would like to purchase a dairy cow in order to provide her family with milk and to sell leftovers to neighbors. This will provide her family with a constant source of milk, dairy products and income and her neighbors who do not own a cow will be able to buy milk at affordable prices. This is her current dream. Because she cannot afford the purchase on her own she is asking for a loan. Holisahon will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Собирова Холисахон Усмонкуловна проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Возраст 35 лет, замужем имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, которым занимается сама. Имеет несколько бычков, которых она откармливает и перепродает , но ей не хватает дойной коровы. Она хочет купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам. Это ее мечта на сегодняшний день. Для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rossy Paola

texts.es:
Mrs. Rossy Paola P. L. is 27 years old and has a high school education. She has one dependent child and they live in the Aurora Díaz neighborhood of Salaverry, located in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

Rossy started her business by selling undergarments to friends and acquaintances and later a friend suggested that she also go and sell in Viru, located about 50 minutes from the city of Trujillo. She sold items made of plastic including tubs, buckets, strainers and ladles. Now she cooks in the mornings and sells the food to her neighbors. Also, in the afternoons she sells items like costume jewelry and hair barrettes in the streets, in addition to making porridge.

Rossy is a member of the “Jerid – Camino al Exito” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan. With that money she traveled to the city of Trujillo to buy undergarments at the wholesale market. With this loan of $450, which she plans to repay in six months, she will buy all of the provisions necessary to prepare different stews. She will also invest in the construction of her house where she will create space to install a kiosk from which to sell her products. Her greatest dream is to open a restaurant in the center of Puerto Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rossy Paola P. L. tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio empezó con la venta de ropa interior por su vecindario, le hacían diversos pedidos sus conocidos y amigos, posteriormente una amiga le recomienda ir a vender a la provincia de Viru a unos 50 minutos aproximadamente de la ciudad de Trujillo, ofrecía material plástico como tinas, baldes, coladores y cucharones. Actualmente prepara comida por las mañanas y ofrece a sus vecinos. Así también por las tardes sale de sus casa para ofrecer por las calles joyas de fantasía collets, ganchos de pelo, etc. Además de preparar mazamorra. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Jerid – Camino al Éxito” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero viajo a la ciudad de Trujillo para comprar ropa interior al por mayor en el mercado Mayorista. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses, comprará todos los víveres necesarios para preparar diferentes potajes, además invertirá en la construcción de su casa en donde ambientara un espacio para instalar un kiosco en el que venda sus productos. Su mayor sueño es poner un restaurante en el centro de Puerto Salaverry.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 45 years old, is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. Her family includes the couple and four children, two are still in school age. She weaves straw mattresses. She uses the funds from her loans to buy straw, the raw material for making straw mattresses. The income is quite rewarding at 150USD a month. After 4 years with the Fund, she has saved enough and been able to build for them a new house. They are all happy for the new life. She is applying for a loan of $375 to buy straw.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con, trong đó 2 con còn đi học. Công việc của chị Thuận là đan chiếu bán. Sau khi vay vốn của Quỹ, chị có thêm nguyên liệu làm nên thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Sau 4 năm tham gia, chị Thuận đã làm được nhà mới khang trang. Vòng vốn dài hạn này chị vay 375USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu. Chị rất phấn khởi vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ mà gia đình chị đã như được bước sang một trang mới. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị Thuận là 150USD.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Faizimo

texts.ru:
Faizimo S. has been selling at the central market in Vahdat for six years. She brings various industrial goods to the market from Dushanbe, Tajikistan's capital, to sell at her stall. Faizimo is the mother of four children and with her husband currently unemployed, she is the family's sole breadwinner. Faizimo wants to increase her sales by bringing in a new assortment of goods. However, to do this she will need a twelve-month loan. This will help Faizimo earn more and improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипова Файзимо торгует на центральном рынке города Вахдат. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и продает со своей торговой точки. Торгует разными промышленными товарами. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Муж нигде не работает , поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью. Хочет привести новый ассортимент товара и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит со сроком на 12 месяцев.Это поможет ей заработать больше и улучшить условия жизни своих детей.

loans.use: To increase her sales

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in 1948 in Kévé in the Avé Prefecture, Mrs. Abra A. is a widow with five children. She has had to manage her household expenses by herself and she inherited a field from her husband upon his death. She has worked tirelessly by farming corn which provides her with necessary funds. Very concerned about the futures of her children, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase fertilizer so she can make her land more fertile, thus increasing her crop yield.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1948 à Kévé dans la préfecture de l’Avé, Madame A. Abra est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Seule devant ces charges, son défunt mari n’a laissé comme héritage un champ. Elle s’est acharnée dans la culture du maïs qui la procure le revenu nécessaire. Très soucieuse de l’avenir des enfants, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter des engrais et fertilisants afin de rendre plus fertile son sol et augmenter sa production.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 26 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 10, 8, and 5 years old, and one is only 3 months old. She has been a clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Mtumwa has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mtumwa now hopes for a loan to buy more items (bedsheets) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for re-sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 47, is a housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family members. She has six children and all of them are employed with different works, most of them are garment factory workers. Mrs. Chea would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start operating a motor-taxi business. This loan would allow the family to increase their profits.

loans.use: Chea would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 28 años, convive con su pareja Elvo, de también 28 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a atención de restaurantes desde hace 8 años, su buena sazón la motivó a ahorrar y decidir poner su propio restaurante hace 1 año y medio, tiempo en el cual se ha dedicado íntegramente a esta labor.  Margarita alquiló un local donde puso su restaurante, trabajando duro todo el día para lograr mejores ingresos económicos, le dedica todo su tiempo y esta labor, que siente que a veces la ata sin poder salir, pero el gusto por la cocina y la atención a la clientela es mucho mayor, haciendo que pueda vencer cualquier dificultad. Margarita se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder conformar una familia en el futuro, y poder brindarles una buena estabilidad económica. Con el dinero que obtenga del préstamo comprará más cantidad de comestibles para poder elaborar sus ricos platos.  En el futuro, quiere agrandar su restaurante, consiguiendo un local propio y contratando personal para la atención.
texts.en:
Margarita is 28 years old and she lives with her partner Elvo, who is also 28 years old. She has devoted her attention to restaurants for 8 years, her good food motivated her to save and she decided to have her own restaurant one and a half years ago, during which time she has been devoted entirely to this work. Margarita rented a place where she put up her restaurant, working hard all day to achieve better economic returns. She devotes all her time to this work, sometimes feeling that she is unable to leave, but her love for cooking and caring for her customers is greater and allows her to overcome any difficulty. Margarita works hard everyday so she can form a family in the future and provide them with good economic stability. With the money she gets from the loan she will buy more groceries to make her delicious meals. In the future, she wants to enlarge her restaurant, owning her own location and hiring wait staff.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food for her small restaurant

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna manages to successfully run her own fruit and vegetable sales business in downtown Korolyovo. She started her business 7 years ago. One of the main secrets of her success is its favorable location in a busy neighborhood. Many customers attend regularly and become loyal clients. Ganna loves her work. She manages all her finances herself. Currently, she has about 15,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her monthly net profit is about 5,000 Grivnas.

Ganna is planning to purchase additional merchandise that would increase her sales and help her earn more. That is why she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas. With the additional profits, Ganna plans to continue developing her business, providing stable and consistent income for her family.

loans.use: To increase the assortment and inventory

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos R., se dedica desde hace 6 años, al rubro del Servicio de Alquiler de camión para distintos usos, entre ellos: para traslados de muebles, traslado de mercadería, traslado de materiales de construcción, etc. Nació en la ciudad de Tarija, Bolivia y vive desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, vive en el Barrio Las Misiones, junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en una pequeña casa propia. Este crédito será destinado para la reparacion del motor del camión, y para el mantenimiento en general.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos R. has been working for 6 years in the business of renting trucks for various uses, such as moving furniture, merchandise, construction materials, etc. He was born in the city of Tarija, Bolivia, and has lived with his wife and children in a small house of their own for 10 years in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, in the Las Misiones neighborhood. This loan will be put toward repairing the truck motor and for maintenance in general.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the truck

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mr. Hom U., 57, is a construction foreman living in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province. Because he needs more construction equipment, he is requesting a loan to make the necessary purchases. His wife, Mrs. Chork Im, is a housewife, and they have two children, one a driver and the other a fruit seller.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Rene Hilario

texts.es:
Rene Hilario M.
