R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Hilario tiene 1 hijo su edad es de 7 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como dependiente de farmacia, sus propósitos son de seguir trabajando para sustentar a su familia y así pagar las deudas contraídas con la Fundación León 2000 sus sueños son de conseguir otra unidad de transporte por que la que posee actualmente no esta en muy buen estado pero debido a la difícil situación económica en la que el país se encuentra es muy difícil cambiar la unidad de transporte además con lo que gana tiene que mantener a su hogar sus sueños son que su hijo logre prepararse lo suficiente para que pueda tener un buen futuro además quiere que su hijo se prepare ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y no le gustaría que su hijo pase por este tipo de situación es por eso que el trabaja muy duro para que su hijo tenga la posibilidad para que sea una persona preparada en el ámbito del estudio.

Su actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, Don Rene inicio este negocio como chofer de un camión de transporte y lo que le pagaban lo conservaba ya que sus intenciones eran las de comprar un carro y lo ocuparía para dar los servicios de taxi ya que este seria el medio de trabajo que utilizaría para mantener a su familia pero debido a la situación no pudo completar el dinero y mas tarde su hermana se encargo de ayudarlo para que Don Rene pudiera comprar su unidad de transporte y es así como obtiene su taxi sus experiencias obtenidas con los clientes al dar este servicio le ha gustado mucho ya que le gusta servir a la población y su familia lo apoyado en lo necesario ya que es un trabajo digno y humilde además por medio de esto es que logra que su familia obtenga lo necesario, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para mejorar la unidad y consiste en la compra de amortiguadores traseros, espirales traseros, foco delanteros y juego de valineras y todas estas cosas las consigue en un buen precio en Managua además agradece la oportunidad del crédito otorgado por la Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones.
texts.en:
Rene Hilario Mondragon Ramirez is 49 years old, married, has one son who is seven years old, and attended school through the fifth grade. His life partner works as a pharmacy sales clerk. His plans are to continue working to support his family and pay the loan from Foundation Leon 2000. He hopes to get another transport vehicle because the one he now has is not in very good condition, but because of the difficult economic condition the country finds itself in it is very difficult to replace the vehicle, since with what he earns he needs to maintain his home. His dreams are that his son is able to prepare himself sufficiently so that he can have a good future. Also, he wants his son to study since he did not have the opportunity to study and he does not want his son to face this type of situation, which is why he works so hard, so that his son has the possibility to be prepared for studying. His work is to provide taxi service, moving around. He has had this business for two years. Don Rene started this business as a truck driver and saved what he was paid since he was planning to buy a car and use it to provide taxi service. This would be the type of work that he would use to maintain his family but due to the situation he could not get all the money together, but later his sister took it upon herself to help him so that Don Rene was able to buy his vehicle and that's how he got his taxi. His experiences with his clients, providing this service, have pleased him a lot, since he likes to serve the public. And his family has helped him as necessary since it is dignified and humble work, plus it is through this means that he assures that his family obtains what is necessary. The financing is for working capital to improve his vehicle and will be used to buy rear shock absorbers, rear springs, front headlights, and a set of ball bearings. All these things can be obtained at a good price in Managua. He is grateful for the credit opportunity offered by the Foundation Leon 2000 and the different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to improve his taxi

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. O. is a 27-year-old married mother of three. She lives in Molem, a small village just outside of Kisumu, Kenya. She recently joined K-MET to become a volunteer Community Health Worker. As a part of the K-MET network, she is now eligible for a loan to help her business.

Esther sells vegetables in her neighborhood in Molem – items such as kale, cabbage, potatoes, cassava as well as "omena", a small sardine-like fish. She started this business in January of 2008. Previously she had been working as a seamstress, but decided she wanted to add to her income.

Now, Esther does commission-based sewing when she is not running her vegetable business. She would like to build a stall to sell her produce from, so Esther has applied for a K-MET loan of approximately 275 USD in order to purchase the construction materials and build the stall.

loans.use: To purchase stall building materials

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
N. Firuza is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. Firuza is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago she got an idea to start raising sheep to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her elder daughter (pictured) helps her with the business. Slowly the number of sheep increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of her animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $ 600 USD for the term of 9 months. Be an important part of the growth of Firuza’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carlota tiene 58 años de edad, reside en San Judas en la ciudad de Managua, con tres hijos, los cuales trabajan para apoyar a su familia, su  negocio es una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzo logro a poner para tener sus propios ingresos ya que es viuda y no tiene un apoyo. Inicio con fondos propios. Su objetivo es comprar mercadería variada para surtir la pulpería con productos enlatados, productos lácteos,  y carnes. Para ofertar  a sus clientes. Sus metas es incrementar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Carlota is 58 years-old and resides in San Judas in the city of Managua. She lives with her three children, who work to support their family. Her business is a general store which with a lot of effort allowed her to have her own income since she is a widow and does not have support. She began her business with her own funds. Her objective is to buy various merchandise to supply the grocery store with canned goods, dairy products, and meats to offer to her clients. Her goals are to increase the volume of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned goods, dairy products, soda, and meats

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Mr. D. has 4 hectares of arable land which he uses to grow corn and peas. He also has 3 hectares of Savinion and Pino vines. Ion also breeds animals, he owns 12 sheep and two pigs, and expects to increase the number of animals this year. He plans to use the loan to buy technologies to increase his breeding efficiency.

loans.use: Increase breeding productivity

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 43 años siempre se preocupó por darle a su familia un mejor futuro, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su única hija, Yudith de 16 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Tiene un restaurante en la ciudad de Puno, en el cual ofrece menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, sus clientes salen muy contentos y alabando la sazón de la cocinera. Juana espera tener un restaurante con ambientes adecuados, donde sus clientes se sientan más cómodos, y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es cocinar y ver como sus comensales disfrutan de la comida que prepara. En los 3 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar presionada por sus clientes y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos sus comensales. Su deseo más grande es brindarle un buen futuro a su hija, a la cual quiere mucho. Este es su préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los 800 soles solicitados planea implementar mejor su restaurante y comprar más víveres para preparar sus deliciosas comidas.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, has always tried to offer her family a better future. She lives in a rented room next to her only child, Yudith, who is 16 years old and the motivation behind all of her efforts. She has a restaurant in the city of Puno that offers an eclectic menu of delicious food which leaves her customers happy and praising the prowess of the cook. Juana hopes to have a restaurant with a better environment where her patrons can feel more comfortable. What she most likes about her business is cooking and seeing how her customers enjoy the food that she prepares. In the three years that she has spent in this business, she has learned to work under pressure, and that is exactly the most difficult part of the job, since she always tries to satisfy all of her customers. Her greatest desire is to offer a good future to her daughter, who she loves very much. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time. She is very happy in her local bank and she keeps herself informed about all the agreements between members. With the 800 Sols she is asking for, she plans to improve her restaurant and buy more supplies to prepare delicious meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve restaurant, buy supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia O. is already 59 years of age, married and blessed with five children, all of whom are married. Her husband is a fisherman and she is a port vendor. She wishes to borrow PHP 10,000 for the acquisition of a new fishing net and accessories for her husband's fishing. She has newly become a member of Paglaum Co-op. But she is very good and pays her obligations in a timely fashion during the meetings.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and battery for her husband's fishing

loans.name: Gulomhaidar

texts.ru: Рахимов Гуломхайдар более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке"Мехргон". Гуломхайдар торгует овощами. Роживает он в районе Явана. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить сезонные овощи для продажи.
texts.en:
Gulomhaidar R. has been involved in trade for more than three years. He has a trade point in the Mehrgon market. Gulomhaidar trades in vegetables. He lives in the Yavana region. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. This client is requesting a loan in order to purchase seasonal vegetables for sale.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hanifa's Group

texts.en: Hanifa K., a tailor in Buwola, is a hard-working lady who is proud of her livelihood since it provides for her family's needs including the school fees for her children. The loans she has been receiving from Pearl Microfinance for nine years have allowed her business to steadily progress.  Hanifa now has three sewing machines, a bicycle, goats and a cow, none of which would have been possible without the loan support. She makes children’s wear, bitenge dresses, and gomesis, and she is blessed that customers go to her for their needs. Hanifa now needs a loan to help buy more clothing materials for sewing.

loans.use: Buying clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G. est une dame de 53 ans, mariée avec à sa charge 5 enfants dont des petits fils. Elle achète des légumes et autres produits qu’elle revend au marché et souvent avec l’aide de ses enfants. Elle souhaite assurer la nourriture, la scolarité, les soins de santé et l’habillement à ses enfants
texts.en:
Mariama G. is a 53 year old woman married with 5 little children at her care. She buys vegetables and other items which she retails in the market usually with the help of her children. She hopes to provide for the feeding, schooling, health care and clothing of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail of vegetables and other miscelleneous items.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez B. is a 49-year-old farmer and mother of seven children. She started helping her husband, Elmer B., on the farm in 1977. They are tilling a 1-hectare farm and this is what provides her whole family the food and money they use to sustain their daily finances at home. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will really help her achieve not just good quality rice and harvest but a bigger income for their family as well.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but education as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Mukhbira

texts.en:
M. Mukhbira sells groceries such as tinned products, sweets, soft drinks and others. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Mukhbira has been selling groceries since 2006. She is responsible for paying food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase her grocery inventory in her store. Mukhbira hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.en:
Sakhavat J. is 58 years old, is married, and has three children. He has devoted his life to agricultural work and on market days he brings his products to the market.

The harvest is what Sakhavat enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the different crops, such as fruits and vegetables, that he will sell because the price will depend on their size and quality. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family - even more when the produce sells for a good price at the market. That is his motivation to continue planting. With this loan of  $2000 USD he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm.

Sakhavat is very grateful to those who support him because they allow him to provide well-being to his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Amarilis Del Establo Group

texts.es:
OLGA LIDIA V. T., A QUIEN APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA SENTADA; TIENE 26 AÑOS, ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE TRES PEQUEÑOS HIJOS QUE SON SU RAZON DE SER Y EL ALICIENTE PARA TRABAJAR DURO,PARA PROGRESAR Y SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ANTICUCHOS DE MANERA AMBULATORIA, UBICADA EN UNA AVENIDA PRINCIPAL, DESDE LAS 3 DE LA TARDE HASTA LAS 11 DE LA NOCHE.
LA SRA. OLGA,ES UNA MUJER QUE DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA HA TRABAJADO APOYANDO A SU PADRE EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO,ES POR ESO QUE AHORA, ELLA HA QUEDADO A CARGO YA QUE SU PAPI TIENE UNA EDAD AVANZADA, Y ADEMÁS PORQUE  NECESITABA TENER UN INGRESO PARA PODER MANTENER A SUS HIJOS.
NOS COMENTA LA SRA OLGA, QUE ELLA SIEMPRE HA SIDO MUY TRABAJADORA, LE HA GUSTADO GANAR SU DINERO CON MUCHO TRABAJO, Y SER INDEPENDIENTE. GRACIAS A SU ESFUERZO HA CONSEGUIDO COMPRAR ALGUNAS COSAS PARA SU CASA, DAR EDUCACIÓN A SUS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS Y MANTENER SU HOGAR SOLA.
SU META MAS CERCANA ES TENER UN LOCAL PROPIO DONDE PUEDA OFRECER Y ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES CON MAS COMODIDAD Y SOBRETODO, PARA QUE SUS HIJOS NO TENGAN QUE ESTAR EN LA CALLE MIENTRAS ESTÁ TRABAJANDO, YA QUE PARA PODER TRABAJAR, DEBE LLEVÁRSELOS CON ELLA PARA PODER CUIDARLOS MIENTRAS TRABAJA.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO, LO INVERTIRÁ EN INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SUS ANTICUCHOS.
texts.en:
Olga Lidia V. T., who appears seated in the photograph, is 26 years old, a single mother of three small children that are her reason for being and her incentive to work hard and get them ahead. She makes a living selling grilled skewered meat at one of the main avenues, from 3 in the afternoon to 11 at night. Mrs. Olga has worked in this business since she was a child, helping her father. She is now in charge, since her father is now older, and she needs to have income to be able to support her children. Mrs. Olga tells us that she has always been very hard working. She likes to make money through hard work and be independent. Thanks to her efforts she has been able to buy some items for her home, provide an education for her small children and support her home by herself. Her current goal is to have her own place of business where she can offer her food and attend to her customers in comfort. Most of all she would like for her children not to have to be on the street while she is working, because in order to be able to work, she needs to take them with her and watch them as she works. The requested loan will be invested in supplies for the preparation of the meat skewers (anticuchos).

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for the business.

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en:
God's Gift is a group of 4 borrowers led by Mary G.. Mary is 40 years old and married. Her 3 children, aged 6-21 years old, are in school, between grades 1 through 9. Mary also cares for 1 orphan. Mary is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in downtown Slipway, Monrovia, Liberia.

Mary's business is selling prepared food. She buys rice and other ingredients, which she cooks and sells to residents of Slipway. She has been running this business for 5 years.

Mary started her business with just Ld$3000.00. She makes delicious food and talks with her customers, in order to encourage them to continue buying her prepared food. Since she has been able to maintain her business and customers, she hopes to be able to establish a restaurant in the future.

The rising cost of food causes difficulties, however, because it reduces her profit. She needs this loan in order to purchase more food ingredients to cook and serve to customers.

Mary dreams of educating her children and preparing them for future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rasikatu

texts.en:
Rasikatu is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

She sells charcoal and palm oil. She has been in LAPO for two years. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more charcoal and palm oil to sell. She says thanks you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and palm oil

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en: Zaher is a 28 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Zaher has been working as a furniture maker since 1996. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work, in the hopes of improving his work. This is the first time that Zaher has requested a loan. Zaher is known for his good work and his clients are his friends and neighbors, among others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Zaher decided to become a furniture maker because he wanted to be able to work independently.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: John Okeyo

texts.en: John N. sells electronics goods and other retail products. He has been in this business for the last 16 years. His customers are those within the bus terminus and travelers.  His business is near the bus terminals at Keroka town and he has one employee. His business challenge is fluctuating demand from the customers.  Besides this, he does small scale farming.  He is using the proceeds of his loan of KES20,000 to buy 25 radios.  In the future, he wants to own a big electronics shop.  John is married with two children and describes himself as hardworking, patient and optimistic.

loans.use: To buy 25 radios

loans.name: Raises Group

texts.es: La principal características del grupo “Raíces” es que sus 12 miembros incluyendo a su presidenta la señora Gisela radican en el mismo barrio, la mayoría de las socias tienen su negocio y otras van con la ilusión de empezar uno nuevo como  la venta de cosméticos y bisutería, venta y compra de movilidades, servicio de transporte público, atención en salón de belleza, venta de comida y otros son empleados de diferentes empresas. Dentro del ámbito de la competencia es alta especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas, existe una gran competencia ya que las socias pudiendo estar ubicadas en un puesto o en algún lugar esperando que sus clientes vengan a ellos, al contrario, ellos salen a ofrecer sus cosas ambulando para así poder tener una buena venta durante su día. El destino del crédito es hacer crecer su negocio con el incremento de mercadería a bajo costo, adquisición de herramientas e insumos para incrementar sus ingresos y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. La mayoría de las socias solo habían escuchado de los créditos solidarios, pero en la capacitación que se les da en el transcurso de crédito, se les informo como era el movimiento y como era lo que desea esta institución para los socios, pero algunas socias ya estaban muy bien informadas de esto, ya que anteriormente habían estado en otra instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The principal characteristic of the Raíces group is that the 12 members, including the president, Gisela, are from the same neighborhood. Most of the members have businesses. Others have the dream of starting a new one like selling cosmetics and jewelry, buying and selling vehicles, public transportation service, beauty salon, and selling food. Others are employed by different businesses. The competition is high, especially in food sales and the sale of cosmetics. Each day every member hopes for a good result in their sales. There is much competition, and the members could stay in a stand or in one place waiting for the customers to come to them. To the contrary, the members travel to sell their things in order to be able to have good sales during the day. The loan is to make their businesses grow with the increase of merchandise at a low cost. It is also to get tools and supplies to increase income. This is to give their children a better education and a better quality of life. Most of the members had only heard of group loans. In the training that they were given about loans they were informed about the movement. They learned what this institution wants for the members. Some members were already well informed about this because they had been in other similar institutions with the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita B. is the struggling mother of four children. Since she has her own family and children to raise, she strives to have her own business and earn her own income to be able to provide for the needs of her family and to bring happiness and harmony into their home.

Norita believes that as a mother and a wife, she should have her own way of earning money and not depend on her husband’s income. During her first venture in a business and all throughout the years of maintaining it since 2005, ASHI has been her great source of financial capital. Despite the struggles she faces both in matters of the business and her family, through credit from ASHI somehow her worries were always eased. Now, she is proposing a loan of Php 30,000 as her seventh loan in ASHI to pay for variety of specialty foods like coconut jam, banana chips, peanut butter, barquillos (wafers), turones (banana fritters), custard pie, pinipig (immature rice), lingua de gata (cat's tongue cookies) and other supplies.

Currently in Norita’s growing business, she would like to request a much larger loan amount to supplement her working capital. Someday she wishes her food retail business will grow large enough to have the capacity to sell wholesale. But in the meantime, the proceeds she makes from her business are saved in preparation for the expense of educating her four children. She hopes that until their graduation from college, she will be able to give her support financially.

loans.use: To buy specialty foods for resale

loans.name: Murodbegim

texts.ru: Фозилова Муродбегим проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Фозилова Муродбегим работаеет в области торговли 2 года. Она приобритает товар и продает в своем собственном магазине. Кредит берет на приобритения тавара.
texts.en:
F. Murodbegim lives in the Khuroson region. She's thirty-nine years old, married and has three children. She has a high school education. F. has worked in the field of trade for two years. She buys goods and then resells them in her own store. She's requesting a loan to buy new goods.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia T. is currently in the business of selling bread, ice cream and groundnut paste in the market and is requesting a loan to open a shop.  Emelia is 33 years old and is married to a village lawyer. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a pharmacy.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia M. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Nelia joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Don Carmelo Z. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Banco del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Justina Flores, tiene 4 hijos, Santos de 42 años, Abelardo de 40 y Francisca de 30, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, unicamente habita con el el menor, Darvis de28 años quien le ayuda a trabajar la tierra y a cuidar la finca.  Don Carmelo esta solicitando financiamiento de su 4to credito para la siembra de 3 mnz de arroz para posteriormente comercializarlos y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria en esta actividad, ya que trabaja sembrando la tierra desde hace mas de 40 años. Tambien siembra maiz, banano, frijoles, tuberculos y se dedica a la actividad pecuaria, ya que tiene unos cuantos animalitos donde obtienen ingresos diarios para el sustento familiar. Se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta, y muy responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Don Carmelo Z. is a small farmer in the district of El Banco in town of El Rama. He is married Sra. Justina Flores and they have four children. Santos (age 42), Abelardo (age 40) and Francisca (age 30) are all married and have their own families. Darvis (age 28) is the youngest child and the only who still lives at home. He helps his father work the land and look after the farm.

Don Carmelo is requesting his fourth loan so that he can plant rice and sell it within three months. This will help him generate revenue to improve the living standards for himself and his family. He has the necessary experience since he has been working the land for more than 40 years. He also grows corn, bananas, beans, and tubers. In addition, Santos raises livestock and currently has a few small animals that provide daily income to sustain his family. He is known as an individual who is hardworking, honest, and responsible in all of his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inputs for planting rice

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad, comprar llantas , batería y otros repuestos, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del auto y poder trabajar con normalidad 

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Pablo lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He has a car which he uses to provide public transport.

The loan he is applying for is for maintaining his vehicle by purchasing tires, a battery, and other spare parts. This will allow him to improve his car’s condition, and he will be able to work consistently. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and makes all his payments, which is why Impro can provide a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires and spare parts for maintaining his taxi.

loans.name: Elvire

texts.fr: Née en 1984 à Sakété au Bénin, L. Elvire est mariée à AKPATA Joseph et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leurs charges. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Elvire vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kpakpakanmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elvire vit dans ce quartier depuis quatre ans et vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges familiales. Elvire est une coiffeuse. Elvire a son atelier de coiffure à son domicile et elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Elvire s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elvire exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. C'est la première fois que Elvire sollicite de prêt à ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Sakété in Bénin, Elvire L. is married to Joseph AKPATA and is mother to two children. The couple have two other children in their care. Some of the children are at school. Elvire lives with her children and her husband in the Kpakpakanmé district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has lived in this district for the past four years and helps her husband to cover the family expenses. Elvire is a hairdresser. She has her hairdressing salon at home and also sells hairpieces and cosmetics. She gets her stocks at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. Elvire has been carrying out this activity for seven years. She is applying for the first time for a loan from ALIDé, in order to expand her activity and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces and cosmetics

loans.name: Zahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen is a 33 year old woman and resides in Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She is a seamstress and offers her services in the community. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a good income. Her customers are very happy with her. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities expenses.

She is a mother of five children: one son and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in school and are getting an education. Her husband's name is S. A., and he has a ready made garment sales business. He purchases the garments from different cities (Multan and Faisalabad) because of cheap prices and good quality. He has been in this business for over 12 years.
 
Zahida has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase more ready made garments to expand her husband’s business. She belongs to a group of four members.

loans.use: To purchase ready made garments to sell.

loans.name: Maryuri Marisol

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Lucha se reúne cada 15 días en la parroquia Picoaza se toma en llegar 10 minutos desde la capital manabita, separado por un puente por debajo de el pasa el río Portoviejo, Picoaza es uno de los sectores con mayor crecimiento comercial, donde es visitada por propios y extraños para realizar sus comprar ya que  aquí es donde uno puede encontrar diferente comercio a precios del por mayor. Es reconocida por las ferias de juguetes en navidad con los mejores precios del mercado.

En esta bella Parroquia conversamos con la socia Maryuri de 42 años de edad, desde hace 37 ciclos  forma parte del banco comunal mujeres de lucha,  es una gran profesional en arte de bordar a mano.
Se graduó en modistería hace tres años, y esta dedicada al trabajo artesanal realizado a mano como lo es el bordado, la señora Maryuri se graduó en un liceo de la parroquia donde vive, y le gusto mucho esta labor que no ha dejado de trabajar, combina la tarea del hogar y sus bordados le dedica la mitad de su tiempo, esta casada tiene tres hijos ya jóvenes.

El trabajo de la socia consiste en comprar el material como tela toalla, hilos, esponjas, piedras, chaquiras, y demás accesorios para dar por terminado su elaboración.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Maryuri comprara todo el material necesario, ya tiene varios pedidos por entregar, como foros de licuadoras de baños y mas, además tiene que ya ir armando los pie de árbol navideño, para ir visitando a sus clientas y ya ir trabajando para que nos e le acumule el trabajo le gusta ser muy responsable a la hora de entregar sus prendas.

El sueño de nuestra socia poder incrementar un buen capital y hacer mucho trabajo para ir a mostrarles a los dueños de almacenes y bazares para entregar al por mayor lo que elabora, así mismo no descarta la posibilidad de tener su propio local para exhibir lo que elabora.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha (Women in Struggle) Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza Parish. It takes 10 minutes to reach Picoaza from the capital city of Manabi, which is separated by a bridge spanning the Portoviejo River. Picoaza is one of the sectors experiencing greatest commercial growth, with visits by its own residents and outsiders to purchase items. Here one can buy wholesale. The area is known for its toy fair at Christmas, offering the best prices on the market. In this lovely parish, we spoke with Maryuri, 42 years of age, who for 37 cycles now has been a part of the Women in Struggle Communal Bank. She is an outstanding professional in hand embroidery. Three years ago she graduated in dressmaking, and she works in the craft of hand embroidery. Maryuri graduated from high school in the parish where she lives. She very much enjoys her work, and she has continued the work, sharing half of her time with household duties. She is married and has three young children. Maryuri’s work consists of buying material such as terry cloth, threads, sponges, stones, beads, and other accessories to complete the item she is making. With this new loan, Maryuri will buy all the material she needs, for she has several orders pending delivery, such as covers for blenders and steam tables. She must also be working on Christmas tree skirts, so as to call on her customers and keep the work from piling up on her. She likes to be reliable when it comes time to deliver her items. Maryuri’s dream is to accumulate a good bit of capital and produce a lot of material, to show to the owners of large stores and bazaars, to sell her work wholesale. She does not rule out the possibility of having her own store to display her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy terrycloth, threads, sponges, stones, beads

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of ten people located in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mr. Thom C. is a 26-year-old married man and he is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mr. Thom C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land on which he cultivates cucumbers and watermelons. His wife, Mrs. Sreymom Mai, is a seamstress in a garment factory where she earns a small salary to support her family. The couple has a child who is 4 years old.

Mr. Thom C. decided to ask for a loan to support his farm crops.

loans.use: To support his farm crops

loans.name: Sicilia

texts.en:
Sicilia U. O. is forty-five years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children.

Sicilia’s business is located at Kongowea market in Mombasa town. Kongowea is a very busy market situated by the roadside. She sells tea leaves to the local people and she has been in this business for the last ten years.

Sicilia says the business is very good except during the rainy season because it is an open air market. In future, she hopes to buy a plot and build a business premises. She describes herself as honest, determined, self-motivated and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Unidas De Potrerito Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité Unidas de Potrerito realizan todo tipo de trabajos domésticos,  tienen su propia huerta, cultivan sus productos para luego venderlos dentro y fuera de la comunidad. Todas ellas son vecinas del barrio y trabajan muy unidades en cada actividad que realizan.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Susana quien se dedica actualmente al servicio domésticos en varias casas de familia, ella realiza trabajo como, lavado y planchado de ropas, limpieza en general  y cocina. Ella trabaja un día entero fuera de su casa por lo su deseo es la de contar con un negocio  que le pueda ayudar con los gastos y a al mismo tiempo pueda quedarse en su casa y trabajar desde ahí.

Es por ello que su ella esta comenzando con la actividad de venta de ropas y por solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas de invierno (suéter, pantalones, camperas) en general con lo que ira aumentando su clientela y al mismo tiempo su ingreso.
texts.en:
The members who make up the committee Unidas de Potrerito [United Women of Potrerito] carry out all manner of domestic labor. They have their own garden plot where they cultivate their products which they sell both within the community and beyond. They are all residents of the same neighborhood and work together closely in every job they do. One of the members is Susana who currently is providing domestic services in various family homes. She does work such as laundry and ironing, general cleaning and cooking. She works all day long outside her home; therefore, her wish is to have a business that helps her with expenses in which she can stay at home and work from there. She is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing (sweaters, pants, jackets) so that she can start selling clothing. In this way, she hopes to expand her income and her client base.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie T. is 36 years old. She is married and has 5 children (ages 1 month - 17 years). She owns a business selling ice cakes, which are flavored ice in styrofoam cups.  Annie has 1 year of experience in this business.  

Annie needs a loan of WST 1000 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial flavoring. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 90 talas or US $38 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Annie joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Annie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for loans from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial flavoring

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel P. is from the village of Quipasa, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 27 years old and single and he has one infant child. Arnel's main source of income comes from providing motorcycle (habal-habal) services to the local community.

Arnel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Arnel joined HSPFI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Arnel is requesting his first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials needed to provide service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Bunawona Women's Group 1, Kayunga

texts.en:
45-year-old N. Elzabeth values highly her hard-work-oriented attitude and it’s for this reason she affirms her business has managed to endure for the last ten years. She operates her food-selling business in Kyabazala market, Kayunga. She began this business on her own and that is one fact she is exhilarated about.

Elzabeth’s easygoing and happy-go-lucky line of conduct has played so much in her favor. Striking that good first impression with clients is always a winning trump card in any business. This mother of two makes 30,000 shillings weekly and with this she has been able to keep her head above water.

Elzabeth is asking for this loan to be able to buy more maize flour, cow peas and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, cow peas and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is currently in the business of selling clothes and linens such as dresses, trousers, and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock shoes and saddles to sell. Victoria is 22 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar for selling beer, hot wines etc.

loans.use: Stock shoes and saddles to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 42 años, está casada y tiene cinco en hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la  hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Victoria, recalca que lo mas importante en un negocio, es “la disciplina, la perseverancia y la creatividad”; ya que con ello su negocio de abarrotes, está teniendo mucha pegada en su querido barrio, además trata de introducir productos de vanguardia, con la finalidad de que pueda diversificar frente a la competencia, es por ello que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos por la calidad y precio accesible de los productos que ofrece. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones escolares recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su rutina de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio. En el futuro ella anhela seguir ampliando su negocio de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que pueda ofrecer productos de vanguardia, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, debido al compañerismo que existe en cada uno de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que atienda la demanda de forma efectiva.
texts.en:
Victoria, 42, is married with five children. The family lives in their own home in the beautiful jungle of Cuzco, located in the town of Quimbiri. Victoria emphasizes that the most important thing in a business is, "discipline, perseverance, and creativity." With that motto, her grocery business is having a large impact on her beloved neighborhood. She is also trying to introduce cutting-edge products with the purpose of diversifying in the face of competition. Her customers are satisfied with the quality and affordability of the products that she offers. She is normally self-employed, but is assisted by her sons during school holidays. Her routine is to work Monday through Sunday from 5:30 am to 9:00 pm and point of sale is done in the same neighborhood. In the future she longs to expand her grocery business to offer cutting-edge products that align with the tastes and preferences of her customers. This is Victoria's fifth loan with MFP and she is committed to continue completing her payments on schedule. She also thanks the community bank because of the camaraderie of each of the members. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase basic products to effectively keep up with demand.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic products to better stock her store

loans.name: Rosa Albina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Albina se dedica la producción de leche cruda, ella cuenta con 36 años de edad, tiene un hijo que tiene 15 años, viven en la zona de la Maica central, localidad ubicada en la periferie de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una zona agrícola.

La señora Rosa cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero de las cuales logra producir 15 litros de leche cruda de cada vaca, con toda esa producción de leche elabora quesillos que los comercializa en los mercados populares de la ciudad de Cochabamba, a precios muy accesibles, siendo así que logra terminar de vender toda su producción todos los días, antes del  medio día, razón por la que no tiene problemas para la comercialización de su producto. La señora Rosa con ayuda de su hijo se dedican solos a la producción y elaboración de quesillos, al cuidado de las vacas, su alimentación y su pastoreo.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosa Albina works with the production of fresh milk.  She is 36 years old and has a 15 year old son.  They live in the central zone of Maica on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba, in an agricultural area.  Rosa has 5 dairy cows that each produce 15 liters of milk that she uses to make cheese to sell in the markets in Cochabamba for a very reasonable price.  She currently sells out of her products each day before noon because she has no problems selling.  Rosa and her son are the only ones who work making the cheeses and caring for the cows (feeding and grazing).

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida T. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old, married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Aida is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase the crop yield. This will be the fourth loan that Aida has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Nellys Maribel

texts.es:
Nelly  de 25 años de edad, vive con su mamá quien le cuida a su niña de  7 añitos y que estudia educacion primaria, es madre soltera pero recibe ayuda econòmica del papà de su hija, labora para el Ministerio de Educaciòn en la Escuela Rubèn Darìo desde hace 6 años de donde recibe sus ingresos mensuales para sus gastos basicos. 

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva con financiamiento  para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, ya que pretende Repellar y ponerle piso a su casita; esta clienta ha demostrado ser una joven responsable con sus pago de sus crèditos anteriores y es bien querida por sus vecinos y amigos. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida que su familia permanezca siempre unida, gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral para poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida ya que son una familia bien humilde.
texts.en:
Nelly, 25, lives with her mother who babysits her 7-year-old daughter who’s in elementary school.  She is a single mother but does get some economic help from her daughter’s father.  She has been employed by the Ministry of Education at Rubén Darío School for the last 6 years where she earns a monthly salary to cover basic expenses.

She is asking for Kiva help to buy building materials and supplies because she plans to seal her walls and install flooring in her house.  This client has shown herself to be a responsible young lady when it comes to repayments and she is well liked by her neighbors and friends.

Her greatest dream is that her family stays together always, to enjoy good health and work stability so that little by little she can improve her living conditions since they are quite a humble family.

loans.use: To seal the walls and install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Heliana Soraya

texts.es: La señora Heliana Santamaría C. es una emprendedora mujer, madre soltera de dos jóvenes de 11 y 15 años. Tiene una microempresa en su casa en la cual elabora deditos, empanaditas, quibbes, caribañolas y arepas de maíz. Estos productos los empaca en bandejas de icopor. Ella aprendió esta actividad por haber laborado durante varios años en una panadería, posteriormente quedó desempleada y consideró que era la hora de crear su propio negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con el producto de sus ahorros compró un pequeño molino manual, tiempo después adquirió un molino eléctrico y otras máquinas para preparar la masa de maíz y la masa de harina de trigo. Desde un principio sus productos tuvieron una gran acogida, al principio ella los vendía directamente caminando por las calles y ofreciéndolos  “puerta a puerta”. En la actualidad tiene dos vendedores y un empleado fijo que le colabora en la producción. Diariamente la señora Heliana produce 100 bandejas que vende a $ 2.500 y $3.000. El margen de ganancia, luego de haber descontado los gastos, es de aproximadamente el 20%. Con la proximidad de las fiestas de fin de año, las ventas se incrementan considerablemente. Este es el primer crédito que la microempresaria tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo así: una parte en  la compra de materias primas como harina de trigo, maíz, queso, levadura, carne, etc. y la otra en materiales de construcción para adecuar el local en el cual funciona el negocio. La señora Heliana se declara una mujer optimista y luchadora que está logrando sacar adelante a su negocio y a sus hijos sin la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Heliana Santamaría C. is an enterprising woman and a single mother of two youngsters, ages 11 and 15. She runs a small business out of her home where she makes finger foods, miniature turnovers, “quibbes” (fried pastries stuffed with meat), “caribañolas” (another type of meat-filled pastry made with cassava dough), and corn arepas. Her products are packaged in polystyrene containers. Heliana learned this trade after having worked several years in a bakery. She later became unemployed and felt it was time to start her own business so that she could support her children. Using her savings she bought a small manual grain mill. Afterwards, she was able to acquire an electric mill and other machines for preparing cornmeal and wheat flour. From the beginning her products have been well-received. At first, Heliana sold her products directly to customers by walking through the streets and going door-to-door. She currently has two salespeople and a permanent employee who helps with production. Each day, Sra. Heliana produces 100 trays that sell between 2500 and 3000 COP. Her profit margin, after deducting expenses, is 20%. With the year-end holidays approaching, her sales will increase considerably.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest the funds in the following manner. Part of the money will be used to buy supplies such as wheat flour, corn, cheese, yeast, meat, and other ingredients. The other part will be used to acquire construction materials to renovate the shop where she operates her business. Sra. Heliana is an optimistic and determined woman who is able to succeed in her business and with her children without the help of a husband.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business & acquire construction materials to renovate her shop

loans.name: Corazón Valiente Group

texts.es:
El grupo Corazón Valiente lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Bernarda Lourdes C. Gómez de 48 años quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 18 años. Ella inicio con el comercio de bananos, luego invirtió en mandarinas, naranjas y poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio. 
C. madre de cuatro hijos sueña con tener un tramo más grande e invertirá el crédito en naranjas y mandarinas.  
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Yohana Isabel Calderón Martinez de 35 años quien vende ropa usada desde hace 4 años y Jaune Carolina L. q	uien tiene una fritanga desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The Corazón Valiente (Valiant Heart) group is composed of three hard working women. One of them is Bernarda Lourdes C. Gómez, age 48, who has sold fruits and vegetables for 18 years. She began with bananas, then invested in tangerines and oranges, and, little by little, added to the inventory of her business.

C., the mother of four children, dreams of having a bigger stall and will invest the loan in oranges and tangerines. The other members of the group are Yohana Isabel Calderón Martinez, age 35, who has sold used clothes for 4 years, and Jaune Carolina L. who has sold fried snacks for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase oranges and tangerines.

loans.name: Mercedes Cristina

texts.es:
Mercedes Cristina A. C. tiene 30 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa.

Le gusta jugar basket y festejar las fiestas del carnaval
texts.en:
Mercedes Cristina A. C. is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar department.  She has 2 children.

The Yagui Grande solidarity group is located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and potatoes.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Mercedes is a farmer.  Shee grows corn and potatoes.  She buys her products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy her own home.

Mercedes likes to play basketball and enjoy Carnival celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en: The Tegal Sari group, with N. Ketut W. as the leader, has 10 members who are applying for a second loan with an aggregate amount  of Rp.15,000,000. With this loan, she is expected to increase her business capital for raising pigs. With the first loan, she managed to obtain a flat gain of Rp.100,000  to 150,000. The profit was used to supplement their daily needs and to pay school fees. She hopes this cooperation continues in the future.

loans.use: Capital for raising pigs

loans.name: Faridahan Mamatova's Group

texts.en:
Faridahan M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a tractor driver. Together they bring up two sons. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Faridahan breeds livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns 5,000 KGS per month. This profit has made it possible for her to save money and purchase construction materials for building a house. With this loan, Faridahan wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to finish building a house for her sons.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarah Njeri

texts.en:
Sarah Njeri is a 46-year-old widowed lady. She has been growing tea for about 20 years with an income of 4,000 KES a month. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. She hopes to buy a car and improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho T. N. is 49 years old and lives in Tuan le village. She has a small grocery shop  in Dong anh Centre market.  Her business earns 80,000 VND per day. This income helps her a lot in managing her family life.

Since joining the credit program in 2004, she has used the loans to expand effectively. With the hope of having a loan of 8,066,000 VND , she plans to  buy more commodities and new products to meet the demands of customers.

loans.use: To buy more commodities and new products to meet the demands  of customers.

loans.name: Marn

texts.en:
Marn M., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

M. is a housewife while her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of $19 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $45 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fishing tools for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools for her husband to improve the business

loans.name: Relia Edelvis

texts.es:
La señora Relia, es socia del banco comunal Carmen Cabrejos, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos D. ellos viven en su casa, su esposo se desempeña como mecánico.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con Manuela  Ramos, préstamos que le sirvió para poder hacer un pequeño capital, con lo cual pueD. respaldar su negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza por catálogo, negocio que le ha servido para poder ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos y también para realizar sus pagos puntuales al banco comunal.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles comprará 4 colonias para hombres, 2 colonias para mujer, 2 polvos para cara, 2 bases D. maquillajes, 2 cuartetos D. sombras, 1 esmalte para uñas, 3 lápiz labiales, 2 lápiz delineadores, 3 cremas para el cuerpo, 1 quita esmalte, 2 bloqueadores, 1 talco. 
Todos estos años ha estado generando sus propios ingresos, con esos ingresos pueD. seguir ayudando a sus 2 hijos que todavía viven en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Relia is a member of the "Carmen Cabrejos" communal bank in the Calleria District in the department of Ucayali.  She is 52 years old, married and has four children, two of which still live at home.  Her husband is a mechanic.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years.  The loans have helped as working capital for her business selling beauty products by catalogue.  Her income allows her to help her husband cover expenses and to make payments on the loan from the communal bank.

With this 1600 PEN loan she plans to buy 4 men's colognes, 2 women's colognes, 2 face powders, 2 foundation make-ups, 2 eyeshadow sets, 1 nail polish, 3 lipsticks, 2 lip liners, 3 body lotions, 1 nail polish remover, 2 sunscreens, 1 talcum powder.  All these years she has been generating her own income which she also uses to help the two children living at home.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Pelex

texts.en: Pelex is a twenty-seven year old, hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda longing to build his own house. He has been in construction for three years and, with the income, he was able to pay school fees for his siblings. Pelex needs the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: María  Jose

texts.es: LA SEÑORA N.  LABORA COMO CAJERO PROMOTOR ,ES SOLTERO , ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA  LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRAR MATERIAL COMO  CEMENTO, ARENA, HIERRO, BLOQUE ,PARA CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO.
texts.en: Mrs. Navaro is single and works as a payment collector.  This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and she is thankful for the opportunity that the institution has given her by approving this loan.  She needs this loan to buy building materials such as sand, iron bars, and cinder blocks so that she can build another room.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Intihuatana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTIHUATANA”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado D. Huaraypata, del Distrito D. Quiquijana,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pascuala: es casada y tiene 38 años D. edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos D. 18 y 14 años D. edad; la socia tiene como actividad principal la venta D. comida y chicha, la socia tiene una tienda en  el poblado D. Huaraypata en una esquina en el que se reúnen todos los socios del banco comunal, en esta tienda la socia tiene una pequeña vitrina en el cual exhibe golosinas, galletas y todo tipo D. dulces, bebidas gaseosas y cervezas y esta tienda a su vez es una chichería, en la puerta antes D. ingresar a esta tienda la socia tiene una meza en la cual lleva ollas y venD. comida casera, generalmente la socia elabora comida casera y en tapar los lleva al colegio para ser vendida a los maestros del plantel D. estudios, el esposo D. la socia es cocinero y trabaja directamente en la región  y ambos cuando están juntos se dan la mano para que prospere sus negocios y puedan educar a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para mejorar sus negocios.

Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta D. flores porque este poblado por el bello clima que tiene da flores D. todo color y ellos pueden realizar un mercado a  base D. esto, también los socios se dedican a al crianza D. animales menores como cuyes, pollos, chanchos, patos, el socio Héctor es maestro, y otras dos socias tiene sus tiendas D. abarrotes.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the communal lender “INTIHUATANA”, located in Huaraypata, Quiquijana District, Quispicanchis Province, Cusco.
Pascuala is 38 and married, with two children, ages 18 and 14. She maintains a store and sells food and chicha in Huaraypata on a corner where many members of the community gather.  The store also offers sweets, candy, cookies, beer, soft drinks and home-cooked food.  She also sells food at a local school to serve the teaching staff; her husband is a cook and together they run the business to benefit their family. Pascuala seeks credit to increase her inventory and thus expand her sales.

Other members of the communal lending association sell flowers, which grow well in due to the pleasant climate of the region.  Some raise domestic animals for market, and one member, Héctor, is a teacher, while two other members run small general stores.

Pascuala is grateful for the loan and is committed to prompt repayment according to lender terms.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. Rany K. (pictured here) is 40 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vanny Em, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. They are in school. The family lives approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Rany is tailor, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old and married to Grace who is a housewife. They are blessed with four children aged 14, 12, 8 and 2 years old.  He owns a posho mill in the Chemase Trading Centre in Kapsabet town.  He has been in the business for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Moses has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He wants to use the loan to purchase dry maize for his posho mill. The anticipated profits will be used to educate his school going children and increase the stock for the business.

He hopes to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase bags of dry maize for his posho mill

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Eva has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business running a bar.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to read story books that have increased her knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Manuel de 47 años y su querida hija Tracy de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La venta de carne le ha dado a Gilda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, ella tiene su puesto en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que la carne que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa, lo cual le ha hecho una buena fama y le trae mucho clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre la carne que más sabor le dará a sus comidas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero es parte del sacrificio para poder ganar más dinero. Espera con el tiempo tener una carnicería más grande en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne para implementar su negocio, ya que últimamente la demanda ha crecido.
texts.en: Gilda, 42 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Manuel, who is 47, and her beloved daughter Tracy, who is five. She wants to give them a better quality of life. Selling meat has given Gilda the necessary income to support her family. Her stand is in the N° 2 Market (and important market in the city of Pucallpa), which is very well visited since the meat that she sells is very fresh and flavorful. This has given her a good reputation and brings her many customers. The thing she most likes about her work is getting to know her customers over the meat that will give all their meals more flavor. She has been in this business for 20 years, and the thing she finds most difficult about it is having to stay at her stand all day without being able to leave. This is, however, part of the sacrifice necessary for making more money. She hopes that in time she will have a bigger butcher shop where she can serve more customers. This will be her fourth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes for all of your support in realizing her goals. She is a very active and loyal member of her community bank, which is why she is so respected by the other members. With the 1,000 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will purchase more meat for her business, since demand has recently grown.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to stock up her business

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras,  vive con su esposo y un hijo, todos trabajan en la casa; Ella inicio con el negocio por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad D. tener un ingreso extra que le ayudara a solventar sus necesidades, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado municipal, el horario D. trabajo es D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, comprando frutas y verduras, como manzanas, uvas, peras, bananos, fresas y papas, güisquiles, ejotes, plátanos y pipianes.
Toda esta mercadería es demandada diariamente en su negocio, por lo que esta inversión es muy necesaria para brindar mercadería en buen estado, fresca para satisfacer a los clientes, su aspiración es ser exitosa con el negocio, y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María works selling fruit and vegetables.  She lives with her husband and one son, both of whom work from home.   She started this business on her own initiative, out of the necessity to have extra income to help meet their needs.  Her stand is located in the municipal market, and her hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise, so she can buy fruits and vegetables such as apples, grapes, pears, bananas, strawberries and potatoes, green beans, plantains and various types of squash.

All these goods are demanded daily in her business, so this investment is highly necessary to proviD. merchandise that's in good condition and fresh to satisfy her customers.  Her aspiration is to be successful in her business and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy: apples, grapes, pears, bananas, strawberries and potatoes, green beans, plantains and various types of squash.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been practicing mixed farming for the last 12 years in her hometown in the Rift Valley of Kenya. Her farm produces tea, maize and  milk, which she sells to the local market. She employs one farmhand. 

Esther intends to use this loan of KES 70,000 to buy a quality dairy cow which will produce enough milk for her domestic consumption and sale. She says that the proceeds from this loan will help her pay her children's school fees. Esther's major challenge has been insufficient dairy feed which affects her milk production. In the future, she would like to improve her dairy cows to pure breeds and build a zero grazing unit.

Esther is 51 years old and married, with 3 children who all attend school.

loans.use: To buy a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en:
