Mackline is a 21-year-old married woman with two children who lives in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She dreams of educating her children up to university.  She has been selling clothes for five years and got her initial capital for the business from farming.  She faces challenges in raising funds to meet the demands of her customers, and her desire is to have a boutique.

Mackline intends to use the loan to buy second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  He is single and has no children. Samuel has a small retail shop that sells sugar, etc. which he has had for six years.  He owns another small shop that sells sugar, etc. as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Samuel hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself.  In the future, Samuel hopes to expand his business. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by increasing his capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 35 años es casado vive en Otavalo con su esposa y sus tres hijos que tienen 9, 4 y 2 años. Víctor se describe como una persona dedicada a su microempresa y a su familia.

Trabaja con su esposa en una panadería. Es la segunda vez que solicita créditos a Fodemi. El crédito que solicit actualmente es para la compra de 40 quintales de trigo lo cual le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas, sus ingresos.

Su sueño es de crear una sucrsal de su panadería para poder dar empleo a las personas que mas lo necesitan y en cuanto a lo familiar desea poderles dar lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old, he is married and he lives in Otavalo with his wife and his three children aged 9, 4 and 2. Victor describes himself as being dedicated to his micro-business and to his family.

He works with his wife in a bakery. This is the second time that he has requested a loan from Fodemi. The loan he is currently seeking is for the purchase of 4,000 pounds of wheat which will help him to increase his sales and his income.

It is his dream to open a storefront for his bakery in order to generate employment for those who need it most. As far as his family is concerned, he wants to be able to provide his children with everything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase 4,000 pounds of wheat.

loans.name: Yoel

texts.es: Yoel de 21 años de edad, convive con rosa de 21 años con quien tiene 1 hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.Yoel es un joven emprendedor, que desde muy joven supo ganarse la vida, con un solo propósito el de tener una vida digna.Yoel al principio se negaba enfrentarse al mundo de la competencia, donde ahora se encuentran posesionados los grandes emprendedores, fue entonces que una mañana cuando al recorrer las calles del distrito de Pichari vio que como los turistas buscaban un lugar de esparcimiento donde les pueda brindar bebidas comida que tenga juegos recreativos en conclusión buscaban un bar recreo, es donde yoel pensó tengo un terreno cerca al distrito es amplio lo único que me falta es capital es por esta razón que yoel recurre  a MFP, para solicitar un crédito con que si pueda hacer realidad ese anhelo, entonces yoel fue atendido de la mejor manera en la entidad de MICROFINANZAS PRISMA.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que yoel se compromete en efectivizar el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.Yoel esta contento con el grupo comunal que tiene por que son perseverantes y emprendedores.Con los 1,500 nuevos soles yoel invertirá en la compra de mesas para su bar recreo.
texts.en:
Yoel, aged 21, lives with Rosa, aged 21, with whom he has one child.  They live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari.

Yoel is an entrepreneurial young man, who since he was very young has known how to make a living, with the sole goal of having a decent life.  At first, Yoel refused to face the world of competition which the great entrepreneurs have to take on.  Then one morning, when he was walking along the streets of Pichari district, he saw how the tourists were looking for a place to relax where they could get food and drink, and play games.  In other words, they were looking for a recreational bar, so Yoel thought to take some land near to the district.  The only thing he lacks is capital, and it's for this reason the Yoel came to MFP, to request a loan with which he can realize this dream.  Yoel was well attended to by the MICROFINANZAS PRISMA organization.

This is his first loan with MFP, and Yoel agrees to make his repayments punctually.  Yoel is happy about the communal group he belongs to, because they are tenacious and enterprising people.  

With the 1,500 New Soles, Yoel will invest in buying tables for his games bar.

loans.use: to invest in buying tables for his recreational bar.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a peddler who sells cooking utensils and plastic bowls. 

She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer.  Hawa has been selling utensils for about 3 years.  

The loan will be used to buy more utensils to sell. Hawa plans to save her new profits to buy land.

loans.use: the sale of utensils.

loans.name: Johnson K.

texts.en: Johnson is 41-years-old and lives in Bardnersville. He is married and his wife is a business woman. They have two children ages 10 and 18 and all of them live at home and the children are presently in school. For the past five years he has been in the cement business. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for his business. He plans to send his children to a quality school and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business.

loans.name: Joen Patricia

texts.es: Joen Patricia tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Desde hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, que inicio como una oportunidad de empleo además le ayuda para contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo Joen se encarga de proporcionarle lo necesario a su hijo además todos los días le enseña valores muy importantes para que sea una persona de bien. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, fósforos y golosinas.
texts.en:
Joen Patricia is 42 years old and has managed a store for more than 15 years. She started to pursue this opportunity for employment so that she could help contribute toward the household expenses. Joen has a son who she cares for and tries to provide everything he needs. In addition, she tries to teach him very important values every day so that he will become a good person.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, and candy.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, and candy.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su nieto en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de fruta y un comedor que atiende los domingos, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la fruta que vende es fresca y de muy buena calidad, además en su comedor la gente la prefiere porque prepara ricos platos de comida como sopas y carne asada en un lugar muy higiénico, todo lo que comercia lo vende a precios accesibles; Juana es una mujer muy enérgica le gusta levantarse desde muy temprano a empezar su trabajo, para ella la clave del éxito depende sólo de lo que podamos hacer de la mejor manera posible y atender su negocio es lo que mejor realiza es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar fruta por mayor, y materia prima para sus comidas como carnes, verduras, condimentos, granos básicos entre otros. Juana tiene fe que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana is fifty-seven years old and lives with her partner and their grandson, in thier own house. She has a fruit stall, as well as a small diner which she opens on Sundays. She has built up a good customer base because the fruit she sells is fresh and very good quality. People also like her diner because she cooks delicious dishes such as soups and grilled meat, in a very hygenic kitchen. Everything she sells, she sells at affordable prices. Juana is a woman who is full of energy and who likes to get up early for her work. For her, the key to success is simply doing what we do to the best of our ability, and looking after her business is what she does best. For this reason she has come to INTEGRAL seeking a loan to buy fruit in wholesale quantities, and ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and staples such as flour and rice. Juana has faith that in this way she will succeed in improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, meat, vegetables, condiments, and staples such as flour and rice.

loans.name: Daidora

texts.en:
Daidora is married and blessed with six children. Three of them are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. 

He has been operating a motorbike transport business for three years to support his family. Previously, he was making doughnuts.  

In the next five years, he plans to buy a van for his transport business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Daidora has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: 060301-Đại Giang-Hoằng Châu Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hòa farms shrimp and crabs. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby shrimp and crabs to raise to sell in the future.

Hòa is 47 years old and she is married with three children.
She is the leader of a four member group, the 060301-Đại Giang-Hoằng Châu solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2005, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hòa has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby shrimp and crab to raise to sell

loans.name: Tassie

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Tassie.  She is a widow and has no children, but has 6 dependents who are her relatives and also relatives of her late husband. In 2009, Tassie established her toiletries and provision sales business, such as sardines, ovaltine, milk, sugar, etc. She began her business because she needed to help her husband support their home. Tassie never went to school so her only means of livelihood is petty trading. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Tassie requires a loan in order to buy more toiletries, sardines, ovaltine, milk and sugar to add to her business stock. In the future, Tassie plans to open her business in different areas of the city. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more toiletries, sardines, ovaltine, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran, 41 years old, is married and has 4 children. Two of her children work and two daughters stay at home and help Nazeeran with her household tasks. Nazeeran's husband has operated a livestock business for many years, selling animals and their milk. The quality of milk he provides is very good; therefore, he is known as a credible person among his customers and makes good sales every month. Nazeeran is a housewife who stays at home and manages her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she provides full support to her husband by milking the buffaloes and selling the milk to her community clients.

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy another buffalo to help him get a larger quantity of milk and increase his profits. Nazeeran is very hopeful that a loan investment will help him earn larger profits.

Note: In the photo, Nazeeran is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is 59-years-old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerenciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Emerenciana has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tetchie

texts.en:
Tetchie is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a retail shop where she sells animal feed by the kilogram, dried fish, shampoo and soap. She has had this business for three years.

Tetchie has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy dried fish, animal feed, and home products.  She is a new member of Kive field partner HSPFI.  In the future, Tetchie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, animal feed, and home products

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has three children whose ages range from three months to six years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail supply business where he sells sugar. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic and highly populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar for supply.

loans.name: Mahuwetin Beatrice's Group

texts.fr: Mahuwetin Béatrice âgée de 29 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend de la nourriture dans sa baraque. Elle a sollicité un concours auprès de Finadev pour faire valoir ses prestations et pouvoir se prendre en charge et surtout envoyé toujours ses enfants à l'école.
texts.en: Mahuwetin Béatrice, aged 29, is married and the mother of three children. She sells food from a stand. She is requesting funds from Finadev to enhance her range of offerings and to be able to support herself and in particular to keep her children in school.

loans.use: a basket of condiments, a sack of corn, and a basket of fish

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es:
Para la Sra. Sofía ser  parte de la alcancía “SIEMPRE UNIDAS DE SMP”  ha sido de mucha ayuda  porque gracias a sus préstamos ha logrado muchas cosas que la hacen feliz,  hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña bodega en su misma casa, los inicios fueron muy duros porque se privo de muchas cosas para salir adelante, con mucho sacrificio pudo seguir adelante con su negocio, en la actualidad tiene una de las bodegas más grandes y surtidas del sector donde vive, también ha logrado comprarse un puesto de venta en un mercado de su zona allí su hijo trabaja vendiendo golosinas, durante todo este tiempo ha logrado muchas cosas gracias a su trabajo pero considera que su mayor logro es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, en esta oportunidad usara su préstamo para la compra de productos de abarrotes para así mantener su negocio surtido para satisfacción de sus clientes.
*La Sra. Sofia es la primera de la izquierda viste chompa rosada.
texts.en:
Being part of Siempre Unidas de SMP Communal Bank has been a big help to Sofía because thanks to the loans she has achieved a lot of things that make her happy.  She began 20 years ago with a small grocery store in her own house.  It was very hard at the beginning because she lacked many things to get ahead.  With a lot of sacrifice she managed to keep going with her business.

Currently she has one of the largest and best-stocked grocery stores in her area.  She also has managed to buy herself a sales stall in a market in her area where her son works selling candy.  During all this time she has achieved many things thanks to her job, but she considers her greatest achievement to be seeing her children become professionals.

This time she will use her loan to buy grocery products to keep her business stocked and satisfy her customers.

*Sofía is the first seated woman, wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Wangnigni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNI est composé de trois  personnes qui  sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Jacqueline (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Jacqueline  est mariée à un certain Gabriel. Le couple à trois enfants, tous  scolarisé et  à leur charge. Jacqueline  vit ensemble avec  son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage  sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que  Jacqueline vend des beignets  depuis sept ans. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Jacqueline  ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNIGNI sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter  du maïs, de l'huile végétale et du sucre.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Ей 26 лет, и она проживает в районе Руми. Гулнора дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Гулнора добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо исправляется со своей работе. 2 года назад она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду. Гулнора замужем и имеет одного 2 летного сына. Её муж занимается ремонтом домов. Гулноре в этой деятельности нравится ежедневный доход, и сшить с удовольствием. Она принимает кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить и приобрести много клиентов. И на половине кредита она хочет купить холодильник для дома. Потому что у нее нет холодильника. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей приобрести швейную машинку и холодильник.
texts.en: She is 26 years old and lives in the J. Rumi District. Gulnora sews bespoke Tajik-style women's clothing in her home. It's convenient for her to sew at home. Gulnora is a kind and nimble woman who is doing a good job improving her business. Two years ago she learned how to sew and cut patterns for women's clothing. Gulnora is married and has a two-year-old son. Her husband repairs houses. Gulnora likes the daily income from her business and sews with pleasure. She is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine to improve her business and attract many customers. With the other half of the loan, she wants to buy a refrigerator for her home as she currently does not have one. The requested loan will allow her to buy a sewing machine and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and refrigerator for her home.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Margaret. She is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She sells fruits and vegetables in a small market in her locality. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables hence meet her customers' demand. She hopes this will increase her income which she will use to pay education fees for her children. 
 She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables so as to meet customers' demands hence more income to pay education fees for her children

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 57, married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought 0,08 hectare plot of land . He create apple garden. 
Now he needs a loan of $600 to start being busy with cattle breeding .
He has been in this business for 15 years.

loans.use: To start being busy with cattle breeding

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenab sells charcoal. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to help her expand. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sognameto

texts.fr:
A mother of five, Mrs AGBODAN Sognameto lives in the village of Aklalou in the Lakes district. Fifty years old, she has been selling packaged corn pasta usually called "Kom" for 15 years. It's her only income and it enables her to be a partner in her home management. She uses her profits for the home's everyday expenses. To be able to do so, she has been expanding her activities by establishing a fixed location, where her customers could come. This would improve her business turnover. This is why she requests a $850 loan to be able to carry out her project.

Translated from French by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Mère de cinq enfants, Mme A. Sognameto réside dans le village d’Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. A 50 ans d’âge, elle vend des pâtes de maïs emballées communément appelées « Kom », ceci depuis maintenant 15 ans. C’est sa seule source de revenu qui lui permet de participer à la gestion de son foyer. Le revenu tiré de cette activité est directement utilisé dans la gestion quotidienne du ménage. Pour ce faire, elle a voulu agrandir cette activité en aménageant un lieu fixe où sa clientèle viendra se satisfaire. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire. Ainsi, elle sollicite un prêt de $850 pour réaliser son projet.

loans.use: Preparing and selling corn pasta (kom)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old has a photo shop in Kirkuk. He is appling to get $1000 to purchase a new photo processing machine. He has a big family and he is the only one responsible for supporting them. He wants to develop his shop and increas his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: purchase new photo machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Her husband passed away 4 years ago, Ms Nguyễn Thị Hiệu must work hard to raise her 2 young children alone. It's difficult to provide 3 meals a day for her family. It's even more difficult to provide her children with an education. She works as a laborer in the field, raises pigs and sells goods at the market. All these works require time and money to invest. Ms Hiệu received her first loan from TYM fund in 2001. With 75 USD, she bought a pig. She made a small profit from selling the pig but it was a motivating factor for her to continue. Not only TYM fund provides capital for people like her to invest in a business, it is also a source of moral support to her in difficult times. Ms Hiệu is a very active member of the fund, she encourages other women to enroll in the program. She is the representative of the women group for TYM fund branch 10 in Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. She's requesting a loan of 500 USD to repair the pigsty, buy a few pigs and buy goods to resell at the market.

Trnaslated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chồng mất từ cách đây 4 năm, một mình chị Nguyễn Thị Hiệu phải lao động để nuôi hai con nhỏ. Lo được đủ ăn hàng ngày đã khó, lo cho hai con được học hành đầy đủ càng khó hơn. Ngoài công việc đồng áng, chị Hiệu còn dành thời gian cho việc chăn nuôi, chạy chợ. Những công việc này ngoài thời gian còn đòi hỏi phải có vốn đầu tư. Chị bắt đầu với 75 USD vay của Quỹ Tình thương năm 2001 đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn. Số lãi ban đầu tuy không nhiều nhưng đủ tạo niềm tin cho chị Hiệu vay tiếp những vòng sau. Quỹ Tình thương không chỉ cung cấp vốn mà còn là chỗ dựa tinh thần cho chị mỗi khi gặp khó khăn. Không những vay vốn làm ăn chị còn tích cực vận động những chị em có nhu cầu vay vốn tham gia Quỹ. Chị hiện đang là cụm trưởng của Quỹ tại chi nhánh 10 Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Chị vừa làm đơn xin vay 500 USD để sửa sang chuồng trại, mua vài con lợn và mua hàng bán ngoài chợ.

loans.use: to repair pigsty and buy some pigs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Doña Lucy is fifty years old, and when her husband abandoned her, she searched for a way to make a living. This is how, with much effort, she was able to acquire two sewing machines to start her small sewing shop to make rain ponchos. She does this work very efficiently with the help of her two younger children. This hardworking model mother works very hard from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night in the company of her beloved family. The wish of Lucy and her family is to have more fabric to make their waterproof ponchos and to distribute them on a wholesale basis to the different markets in the city. During this rainy season, the markets are demanding a large number of these garments. To secure their plans, Lucy is requesting a loan, which she will invest and use to obtain other economic benefits. Let's contribute so the dreams of this hard-working family can become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucy de cincuenta años de edad, desde que su esposo la abandonó buscó la manera de ganarse la vida y así a base de mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir dos máquinas de coser para implementar su pequeño taller de confección de ponchos impermeables; trabajo que ahora desempeña muy eficientemente con la ayuda de sus dos hijos menores. Esta laboriosa y ejemplar madre trabaja arduamente desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche en compañía de su querida familia.El deseo de Lucy y su familia es contar con más tela para la confección de sus ponchos impermeables y distribuirlos al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de su ciudad que por estas épocas de lluvia demandan en gran número estas prendas.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo con el que podrá invertir y obtener buenos beneficios económicos.Contribuyamos para que los sueños de esta trabajadora familia puedan hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of waterproof fabric to continue making her useful rain ponchos.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: My name is Shafqat S.. I live with my family in Lahore. My husband manufactures sewing machines. I have six children, three sons and three daughters, ranging in age from 15 to 24. We need a loan of $500 to purchase spare parts used in the manufacture of sewing machines. I wish to help my husband in his business and give my children a better education.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine parts

loans.name: Kinaawa C(I) Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a driver. She has a poultry business. She wants to use the extra profits she earns to invest in the piggery and cultivation businesses. Sophia and Rehema sell used clothes and want to use the loan to increase their stock. Noeline sells firewood.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed and to raise capital for the other businesses

loans.name: Villa Las Rosas 6 Group

texts.es:
Mrs.Gertrudis is 63 years old, has 3 children and has been a proud owner of a grocery store over the last three years. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Due to her age, her merchandise is transported to her home, which makes her fixed costs go up. Her margins are very low and she wants to purchase more stock to get a better price for the goods she sells, hoping to increase her profits.

Her partners sell: Flor G. M. and Maria Teresa L. L. (kitchenware), Rosalia J. H. (tostadas), Consuelo M. L., Dominga L. L., Ernestina G. H. (groceries).

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives and works in Beirut. She owns a toys and accessories shop. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino has a small electronics workshop, he works with his younger brother who assists him and who is also studying information technology. His brother’s help and knowledge will help Faustino offer a better service to his clients by implementing his know-how. Faustino is single, lives with his brother in the Zona de Rio Seco of the Ciudad de El Alto The loan will be destined to buy a computer, which will be used as a working tool for the workshop. This is the second loan for Faustino with Kiva ,the evaluation carried out qualifies him to have the loan approved.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Faustino posee un pequeño taller de electromecánica, trabaja con su hermano menor que le sirve de ayudante y esta estudiando computación, de esa manera brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementará sus conocimientos. Faustino es soltero, vive con su hermano en la Zona de Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El monto del crédito será destinado para comprar una computadora, la cual será usada como herramienta de trabajo en el taller. Este es el segundo crédito de Faustino con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar la solicitud de préstamo del cliente.

loans.use: To Buy a Computer

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor is a widow and has three children: Jazmin, age 33, is a housewife; Karen, age 29, is married; and Isac, age 24, just received his bachelor’s degree in Business Administration. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home and health expenses. She began three years ago selling clothing. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then.

She is requesting a loan of $775, which she will repay over 4 months, in order to purchase more clothing and have a greater variety of clothing, and in this way earn more. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos: Jazmin de 33 años se dedica al hogar, Karen de 29 casada e Isac de 24 años quien se acaba de recibir de Lic. en Administración de Empresas. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingresos extra para gastos familiares y personales ya que necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder costear los gastos de su casa y gastos de salud. Comenzó su negocio hace 3 años , porque siempre le han gustado las ventas, inicio y le fue bien, por lo que ha continuado con esto, ella vende ropa.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas ropa y tener un mayor surtido y así obtener mas ganancias. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-oeun P., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Khin, who about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. One son has full time employment and other two are in local school.   

Mr. Sam-oeun and his wife have been selling vegetables at Doemkor market in Phnom Penh for five years. They earned for living about $7.50 to $10 per day. Sam-oeun wants to expand his selling but lack some money. So, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase vegetables for resale in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable for resale.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Eucaris A. (pictured on the far left) is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 6 and 8) in a small community called Villa Ortega in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling shoes and continues to increase her inventory with each loan. Currently, Eucaris walks through the streets selling her shoes in addition to selling them from her home. Eucaris works hard to grow her business so that she can provide her children with a good education. She also hopes to save enough money in order to go to nursing school one day.

Eucaris is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Ebenezer. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Eucaris, the Ebenezer group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Ikhtayar's Group

texts.en:
Ikhtayar baji is the wife of M. and the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. She lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years.

Ikhtayar baji wakes up at 4 AM to milk the buffalos and fills the milk into big steel jars and hands it over to her husband who goes to several shops to sell the milk. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Bashiran baji and Shakeela baji each want a loan to buy vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat baji is the wife of G. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 27 years. She is the mother of eight children.

Rahmat baji's husband has been selling milk for the last twenty years. He gets milk from his own buffalos and sells it in various milk shops in their community. He has a good relationship with his customers. They currently have five buffalos at their house. Rahmat baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Villa Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco VilL. Esmeralda son D. distintos lugares, algunas D. ellas son familiares, otras son vecinas, amigas. Las socias conforman un nuevo Banco Comunal que recién inicia, con 15 socias en total.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, abarrotes, calzados, ropa, golosinas, CD y venta D. comida, sus negocios se ubican en su casa, en mercados, algunos D. ellos son ambulantes y también reparten D. casa en casa. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 7800 soles en el Banco Comunal.

Sus préstamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. Azúcar, arroz, carnes, verduras, chompas, casacas, polos, calzados, galletas, CD. L. socias mencionan que con el préstamo que obtendrán invertirán en sus negocios y con ello mejoraran sus negocios, surtiendo con mas productos. Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener un capital propio, casa propio, brindar L. mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Esmeralda Village Bank are from distinct locations, some of them are families, others neighbors, or friends. The members formed a new Community Bank that they recently initiated, with 15 members in all. The members have different businesses such as food sales, general stores, shoes, clothes, sweets, and CDs. Their business are in their homes, markets, and some of them travel or sell door-to-door. The members need different loan amounts like $150 dollars, $300 dollars, and $450 up to a total of $2550 in the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, meat, vegetables, coats, jackets, shirts, shoes, snacks, and CDs. The members mention that with the loan they each obtain they will invest in their respective businesses and with the loans improve their businesses by supplying them with more products. The dreams of the members are to expand their businesses, have their own capital, own homes, and proviD. better educations for their children.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Different loan amounts to purchase various merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 32 years old and married with two children. Luz and her husband own a store, where they offer printing and photocopying services. The business is located one block from Ayacucho's main plaza. Luz also has a degree in Accounting, and provides accounting services to various businesses.

Luz needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy paper and ink. Her dreams are to build her own home, to open branches in other provinces and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.

Luz es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Luz tiene una tienda en donde brinda servicios de impresión de planos, fotocopias, su local es alquilado y esta ubicado a 1 cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Además Luz es de profesión contadora y brinda asesoría contable a diferentes empresas.

Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papel y tintas. Los sueños de Luz son construir su casa, tener sucursales en diferentes provincias y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy paper and ink for print shop

loans.name: Clara Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Clara Sabina tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle José de la Riva Agüero 267 del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Se casó y tiene un hijo de 5 años que es estudiante.
Su negocio consiste en la compra de verduras y pescado, los cuales luego vende en la zona de la sierra. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en comprar verduras y pescado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en verduras y muy posible en fruta.
Clara sueña con tener una tienda en su zona.
texts.en:
Clara Sabina is 23 years old and married. She has a 5 year old who is in school. She herself finished high school, but could not continue her education due to a lack of resources. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder and lives on José de la Riva Agüero Street in the El Porvenir district, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. Clara's runs a business buying vegetables and fish and reselling them in the region. With her first loan of 300 soles, paid back in 4 installments, Clara bought vegetables and fish. With this next loan of 500 soles, which she will also pay back in 4 installments, she will purchase more vegetables and probably some fruit. Clara's dream is to set up a store in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Roki Group

texts.en:
Zelikha is the group leader of the Roki group. All the group members live in Kabul, Afghanistan and each of the group members wants to take a loan for his/her own business.

Zelikha wants to take out a loan for her beauty parlor business.  Roki would like the loan to buy fabric and Afghani cloths. Ghulam Mustafa requests it to stock up his mobile shop. Parween would like the loan to assist his brother's   business, and Sediqa who lives in 5th district, wants to take out a loan for for her seamstress business..

They all expect to expand their businesses through the loan, support their families and earn a good income.. Finally, they all would like to thank Kiva lenders that assist the entrepreneurs with starting and to sustaining businesses.

loans.use: To increase business activity

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA T. SERRRUCHE, pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano 20 de Diciembre Mz. B, Lt. 10 en el distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 36 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, confecciono una caja en general, al frontis de la Posta de Salud Nuevo Bolognesi.

Con este prestamos de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro frutas en variedad todos de la región, preparó comida para vender,  golosinas en general.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por apoyarle en el momento que mas necesitaba, se siente muy bien y contenta.
texts.en:
MARIA ELENA T. SERRRUCHE belongs to the Communal Bank "La Amistad” (Friendship) situated in the 20th of December Settlement in the District of Yarinacocha, in the Peruvian Amazon region. She is 36 years of age and has two children. Her husband is a construction worker. With her first loan of 300 New Sols, she built herself a stand in front of the Nuevo Bolognesi Health Post. With this loan of 1000 New Sols, she will buy fruits of all varieties of the region, food prepared for sale and various sweets. Maria Elena greatly appreciates the support she received from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER at a time when it was most needed. She now feels very well and satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar frutas en variedad todos de la región, preparar comida para vender y golosinas en general.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW member, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Pamela is 40 years old, married, with four children. She lives in Nanga village, outside of Kisumu. Pamela has two businesses that provide income for herself and her family – a tailoring business and a vegetable stall. Pamela farms her own vegetables to sell, mainly sukuma wiki (kale), tomatoes, and maize. In her tailoring business, she sells dresses for ladies, school uniforms, and also repairs clothes. She gets her materials from Kibuye Market in town.

Pamela is a Form 1 school dropout who used to make chapatti (local flat bread) to sell to her neighbors; she was also engaged in the illegal activity of brewing changa, a strong alcoholic brew. She decided to stop both of these activities and buy a sewing machine in 2004.

Pamela has applied for a loan of approximately $150 USD, which she will use to purchase dressmaking materials and farming supplies.

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials and farming supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is forty-five years old. She is married and has four kids who are all still in the basic school. Gladys lives with her husband and family in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities. Gladys is in the business of palm oil production. She has been in business for ten good years and is full of rich experience. 

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Gladys desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 44 años y esta casada con  el señor Pedro Leite que trabaja como seguridad privada. Ella es  madre de cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro aun son chicos y dependen de sus padres y uno que es mayor de edad y trabaja de forma independiente.  Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas y  por ejemplo: remeras, blusas, jeans, pantalones, entre otros. Ella misma lo confecciona en su taller que lo tiene en su propio domicilio.

Maria se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de cuatro años y su local comercial se encuentra en la misma casa, dónde para esto, ella realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial y taller.

Maria, con sus ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su marido hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Maria comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de telas y así poder confeccionar ropas de la temporada otoño - invierno, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde sale a hacer su venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and is married to Pedro Leite, who works as a private security guard. She is the mother of five children: one of them is an adult and supports himself, while the other four are still dependent on their parents. Maria makes a living selling all types of clothing, including T-shirts, blouses, jeans and other kinds of trousers, among other things. She makes all of the clothing in her sewing workshop, which she has set up in her home. Maria has been in this business for more than four years and, as mentioned, she runs her business out of her home. She had to make some changes there so she would have enough space to accommodate both her workshop and her store. Maria’s profits from sales contribute to the family’s income, and together with her husband she is able to take on the household expenses. Maria tells us that business is good. It is for this reason that she wants to purchase a larger amount of fabric so that she can make clothing for the autumn and winter seasons. This way she will be able to meet the strong demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric to make clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Abla Emekonawo

texts.fr: Madame A. Abla est une résidente du quartier de sogbossito, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits génériques, elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006. Elle a ouvert à cet effet sa boutique dans laquelle elle exerce ce commerce. Ne disposant pas d’assez de produits génériques, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 2 cartons d’EFFERLAGAN, 2 cartons de GRIPPE WATER, 1 carton de PARCETAMOL et 1 carton d’IBUCAP. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est enseignant.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Abla is a resident of the Sogbossito district. Her work involves selling generic pharmaceutical products. This is a business she started in 2006. She then opened her shop and does business there. Lacking enough merchandise, she's requesting a loan from WAGES that will enable her to buy two boxes of EFFERLAGAN (reduces pain and fever), two boxes of GRIPE WATER (for colic or stomach ailments in infants), one box of PARCETAMOL (pain reliever), and one box of IBUCAP (for pain and inflammation). She is married to a gentleman who is a teacher.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Safie J. and Zainab K.. They named their group Tamaraneh, a Temne phrase for “let us help each other.”  They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni, the northern provincial city. This is not their first loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have tremendously impacted the lives and businesses of these entrepreneurs. Out of their businesses, these ladies are able to look after themselves and their children. Their businesses are their only way of making a living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le I,200,000 each to further strengthen their business. 

Safie J. (right) is the leader of the group. She is fifty years of age. She was born in Makeni city, in north Sierra Leone. Her husband is the town crier. She has five children, three are already adults and two are in high school. Safie sells market food. She sells onions, vegetable oil, tomatoes, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for over thirty years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna P. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 30 years old and married with three infant children. To make a living, Elna sells home products to tourists and local community members. She has just started this business.

Elna joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third PMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

Elna is shown in the picture wearing the yellow shirt with a customer beside her.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional home products to sell.

loans.name: Olaruwaju

texts.en:
O. sells frozen food in large and small quantities. She has been in business for eight years and purchases goods from Cotonu, a border town by Lagos State. She goes to get goods once every week in order to meet up with her customers’ demands.

O. is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase goods in bulk to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and to LAPO who has been lifting her through the years to her present level.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Blanca Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Aidee es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Tiene 33 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de fruta; tiene un puesto en la Feria Libre de Cuenca. Ella trabaja vendiendo fruta desde los ocho años. Su mamá también vendía fruta, pero lamentablemente falleció hace un par de años. Blanca trabaja de las 8am hasta las 2pm o 3pm de martes a sábado (los días domingo y lunes pasa en casa con su familia). Hay bastante competencia en el mercado, pero dice que consigue clientes regulares porque les trata bien para que vuelvan, y además siempre les da su “yapa” (un poquito extra que se da de regalo).  
Blanca necesita un préstamo de $1,100 para poder comprar chirimoyas, uvas y manzanas para abastecer a su puesto en el mercado. También piensa comprar animales menores y cobijas para otros pequeños negocios que a veces hace. 
La señora es socia de Fundación Espoir hace 10 años ya. Blanca dice que le gusta sacar la plata y ahorrar. Su meta para el futuro es seguir trabajando para dar un buen ejemplo a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca Aidee is the president of the Cochapamba comunal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, located approximately one half-hour from the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two children who are 15 and 8 years old. Blanca sells all kinds of fruit. She has a stall in the Open Market of Cuenca. She has been selling fruit for eight years. Her mother also sold fruit but, unfortunately, she passed away a couple of years ago. Blanca works from 8am until 2 or 3pm Tuesday through Saturday. (She spends Sundays and Mondays with her family.) There is a lot of competition in the market, but she says she has regular customers because she treats them well so that they will come back. She also always gives them a “yapa” (a little bit extra that she gives as a gift). Blanca needs a loan of $1,100 so she can buy chirimoyas [also known as custard apples], grapes, and apples to stock her stall in the market. She is also planning to buy small animals and blankets for other small business deals that she occasionally does. Blanca has been a member of Fundación Espoir for 10 years. She says that she likes earning money and saving. Her goal for the future is to continue working so she can be a good example to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and stock her market stall

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es: Sabrina tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vive con su pareja, su abuelito y su hermana. La casa que habitan es de su madre. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de discos para aserrar madera, negocio que realiza junto a su pareja, ambos salen a vender esta herramienta a todos los talleres donde trabajan con madera. Lo que le gusta a Sabrina de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y aprender cada día más sobre su negocio, además le es rentable porque vende a un precio accesible y va directamente a las personas que utilizan estos discos. Para más adelante, Sabrina quiere tener una tienda donde venda mayor cantidad y variedad de herramientas e instrumentos para el trabajo con madera. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros y compañeras son responsables y solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más de estos discos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sabrina is 30 and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband, her grandfather, and her sister. They live in her mother's house. She has sold saw blades for two years, a business that she has with her husband. Both of them go out to sell this product in the shops where people work with wood. What Sabrina likes about her job is getting to know many places and to learn more every day about her business. It is profitable for her because she sells at an accessible price, and she goes directly to the people that use these saw blades. In the future, Sabrina wants to have a store where she can sell a larger quantity and variety of tools and instruments for woodwork. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of her fellow members are responsible and united. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more saw blades to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Bibi Jan Group

texts.en: Bibi Jan is the leader of the two-member Bibi Jan group, each of whom is requesting a loan to expand their businesses.  Bibi Jan wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Del Jan wants to take a loan for her husband who has a clothes-selling shop. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: For expanding business
